{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"Julianne Moore And Alicia Vikander Are ‘Those Crazy Women’ In ‘The Glorias’ Biopic Trailer","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402536227","description":"<div class=\"upx-component upx-embed-url\"><div class=\"embed-holder\"><iframe src=\"//youtube.com/embed/Iw7P90tJSJs?feature=emb_logo\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\" allowfullscreen></iframe></div></div><p><em>The Glorias</em> adapts Gloria Steinem&#8217;s 2015 memoir, <em>My Life On The Road</em>, and the film will soon arrive with not one Gloria Steinem, or even two, but five Glorias. That&#8217;s a lot of Glorias, and the two foremost incarnations of the feminist firebrand will be played by Julianne Moore and Alicia Vikander during (as the book suggests) her Greyhound bus travels. Glorias will appear onscreen together. They&#8217;ll have conversations. They&#8217;re reclaiming the &#8220;those crazy women&#8221; label for themselves under the direction of Julie Taymor (<em>Frida</em>), who&#8217;s clearly operating again here under a labor of love with what promises to be an inventive and nontraditional biopic approach.</p>\n<p>Following a Sundance debut and <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/the_glorias\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">largely positive</a> reviews, the movie&#8217;s coming to Amazon Prime (and VOD) on September 30, by way of Roadside Attractions and LD Entertainment. The film also features a busload of brilliant actresses in other activist roles, including Kimberly Guerrero as Wilma Mankiller (&#8220;I earned it,&#8221; she says of her surname), Janelle Monae as Dorothy Pitman Hughes, Bette Midler as Bella Abzug, and Lorraine Toussaint Flo Kennedy. The film will trace Steinem&#8217;s legacy all the way from her 1940s Ohio childhood to her founding of <em>Ms.</em> magazine to her 1960s women&#8217;s liberation movement leadership and beyond. From the <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.sundance.org/projects/the-glorias\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Sundance Institute</a>:</p>\n<blockquote><p>Julie Taymor brings her signature inventiveness and audacity to craft a complex tapestry of one of the most iconic and legendary figures of modern history, based on Steinem’s own memoir My Life on the Road. Remarkable performances by Julianne Moore and Alicia Vikander steer an engaging cast with strong supporting turns from Janelle Monáe and Bette Midler. Taymor makes her own rules in this dazzling ode to self-reflection, exploring the importance of forging your own path and embracing the challenge of the open road.</p></blockquote>\n<p><em>The Glorias</em> is coming to Amazon Prime and VOD on September 30.</p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=jQ5e7-QLaQw:FCoazXJ3akU:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img <em>The Batman</em> resumed production, and it&#8217;s already been shut down again. “A member of <em>The Batman </em> production has tested positive for COVID-19 and is isolating in accordance with established protocols,” a Warner Bros. spokesperson said <a href=\"https://variety.com/2020/film/news/batman-filming-halts-coronavirus-1234758442/\">earlier today</a> in a statement. “Filming is temporarily paused.” </p>\n<p>It turns out that the &#8220;member&#8221; was the Dark Knight himself, Robert Pattinson.</p>\n<p><em>Vanity Fair</em> <a href=\"https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2020/09/robert-pattinson-the-batman-coronavirus\">reports</a> that Pattinson &#8220;has tested positive for the coronavirus, causing filming of <em>The Batman</em> to be halted just days after the superhero drama resumed work at studios outside of London.&#8221; Pattinson could not be reached for comment by <em>Vanity Fair</em>.</p>\n<p>Little else is known about Pattinson&#8217;s condition (<a href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/dwayne-johnson-family-coronavirus/\">he hasn&#8217;t recorded a The Rock-style video</a>), but according to <em>Variety</em>, <em>The Batman</em> was &#8220;about seven weeks into filming when they had to turn off cameras due to the pandemic. The movie has approximately three months of material left to shoot and hopes to be done filming by the end of the year.&#8221;</p>\n<p><em>The Batman</em>, which also stars Zoë Kravitz, Paul Dano, Jeffrey Wright, John Turturro, Peter Sarsgaard, Barry Keoghan, Jayme Lawson, Andy Serkis, and Colin Farrell, is scheduled to be released on October 1, 2021.</p>\n<p>(Via <a Run","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402535535","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Disney</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p>We’re living in unprecedented times, if you haven’t noticed, and Hollywood is still trying to figure out how to cope in a world where theaters are only partially open. In another timeline, Disney’s live-action remake of <em>Mulan</em>, their animated favorite from 1998, would have hit theaters nationwide in late March. That, of course, did not happen. Instead its owners came up with a unique solution: The pricey picture would <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/mulan-disney-plus-additional-fee/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">debut on Disney+</a> on September 4, but for the fairly large sum of $30.</p>\n<p>But that brought up another question: When would it be subsumed into the rest of the Disney+ coffers, available to all subscribers? <a href=\"https://deadline.com/2020/09/disney-reveals-mulan-release-date-for-all-disney-subscribers-after-30-premier-access-run-1234569473/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">As per <em>Deadline</em></a>, there’s now an answer for that: At 11:59pm on November 3, Mulan will disappear from the service, to return a month later. So: Decemer-ish.</p>\n<p>To answer another question: Once you pay the enormous fee to watch <em>Mulan</em>, which you’ll be able to do for two whole months, how long and how often will you be able to watch it? Indefinitely, as per <em>Deadline</em>, allowing viewers to really get a bang for their considerable bucks. (Most PVOD titles disappear after a mere 48-hour window.) So that’s nice…considering you’re not turned off by the <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/mulan-boycott-disney-plus-premier-streaming-debut/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">re-emerging controversy</a> surrounding its lead actress Liu Yifei, who enraged many after she sided with the Hong Kong police over the protesters fighting to not have their human rights taken away from them by Mainland China.</p>\n<p>(Via <em><a href=\"https://deadline.com/2020/09/disney-reveals-mulan-release-date-for-all-disney-subscribers-after-30-premier-access-run-1234569473/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Deadline</a></em>)</p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=v5Hgpr9ZRSQ:XtIH6RxprTI:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"Ranking The Best BBQ Sauces Just In Time For Your Labor Day BBQ","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402535994","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1600\" height=\"495\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/bbq-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?w=1600&#38;h=495&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"\" loading=\"lazy\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/bbq-tfeat-uproxx.jpg 1600w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/bbq-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=300,93 300w, 640px) calc(100vw - 20px), (max-width: 1024px) calc(100vw - 40px), (min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">UPROXX</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p>Summer may be ending but that doesn&#8217;t mean we have to stop enjoying some <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/chefs-table-bbq-review-netflix/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">barbecue</a>, or even easy-going backyard grilling. Besides some tasty veg, meat, or fish to grill, you&#8217;ll also need some serious BBQ sauce to smother whatever you&#8217;re cooking. But what&#8217;s the <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/best-barbecue-tips-from-an-expert/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">best BBQ</a> sauce to have on hand when you fire up the grill or smoker? That question is not as easy to answer. </p>\n<p>Let&#8217;s look at what makes a <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/food-writer-bbq-cookoff/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">great BBQ</a> sauce first. For us, a great BBQ sauce starts with the marrying of an umami tomato base and molasses sweetness. From there, a little tang and spice need to be present to varying degrees of intensity, but usually fairly balanced. After that, things get too pinned to individual palates to really dig into here. </p>\n<p>So, to find out what <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/topic/according-to-the-masses/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">the people</a> use when they&#8217;re barbecuing in their backyards, we popped over to Ranker. There was a list of the <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.ranker.com/list/the-very-best-bbq-sauces/analise.dubner?ref=browse_list_5&#38;amp;l=2&#38;amp;pos=79\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Best BBQ Sauce Brands</a> with over 50,000 votes, and that felt like a good enough quorum for us (though, we had to combine a couple of rankings as they were for the same sauces). So, let&#8217;s dive into the best BBQ sauces you can buy right now and use this weekend. </p>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\"><strong>Related: <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/best-bbq-sauces-according-to-masses/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The Perfect Bourbon BBQ Sauce Recipe For Your Summer Grilling</a></strong></div>\n<h3>10. Farm2Market Foods Sonoran Style BBQ Sauce</h3>\n<figure id=\"402535999\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-402535999\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/bbq-sauce-amazon.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"650\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/bbq-sauce-amazon.jpg 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/bbq-sauce-amazon.jpg?resize=300,166 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/bbq-sauce-amazon.jpg?resize=196,110 196w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 650px) 100vw, 650px\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Amazon</span></figcaption></figure>\n<p><strong>Price:</strong> <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Farm2Market-Foods-Organic-Gluten-Free-Sonoran/dp/B00B3NXGEU/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=sl1&#38;tag=uproxx2016-20&#38;linkId=61582f2101a54e11d3f2180fd6d279e1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Currently Unavailable</a></p>\n<p><strong>The Sauce:</strong> This Arizona sauce is a blend of roasted tomatoes, roasted chilis, blue agave, molasses, apple cider vinegar, cocoa, and Oaxacan coffee that gives this sauce a powerful sounding depth of flavors. These days, it&#8217;s damn near impossible to find unless you&#8217;re in a specialty shop in Arizona. If you&#8217;ve had it, let us know! </p>\n<p><strong>Best For:</strong> You tell us! </p>\n<h3>9. Pappy&#8217;s Smokehouse Original BBQ Sauce</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CAvF1FWnno0/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Price:</strong> <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.pappyssmokehouse.com/product-page/pappy-s-original-bbq-sauce\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">$6</a> for a 19-oz. bottle</p>\n<p><strong>The Sauce:</strong> St. Louis&#8217; Pappy&#8217;s Smokehouse is a cornerstone of the local BBQ scene. Their sauce is equally beloved and worth tracking down for your own BBQ sauce collection. The sauce amps up the tang with plenty of vinegar while keeping things just the right amount of spicy with the addition of a chili sauce and a red hot sauce in the ketchup base. </p>\n<p><strong>Best For:</strong> St. Louis Style Ribs</p>\n<h3>8. Bone Suckin&#8217; Sauce</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B4qVM9ShCpM/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Price:</strong> <a title=\"\" href=\"https://shop.bonesuckin.com/bone-suckin-sauce-/1-bone-suckin-sauce-16-oz.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">$6.79</a> for a 16-0z. bottle</p>\n<p><strong>The Sauce:</strong> Bone Suckin&#8217; Sauce feels like a bespoke sauce that you can actually find at most grocery stores. The sauce is billed as a &#8220;Western North Carolina style sauce&#8221; that leans into a foundation of sweetness from a mix of honey and molasses next to plenty of tang. The sauce is so beloved that it continually <a title=\"\" href=\"http://bonesuckin.com/Bone-Suckin-Sauce-Press.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">tops</a> &#8220;best BBQ sauce&#8221; lists around the country. </p>\n<p><strong>Best For:</strong> Chicken Thighs and Legs</p>\n<h3>7. Sticky Fingers Memphis Original Barbecue Sauce</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B2KVwO7hhaK/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Price:</strong> <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.stickyfingers.com/product/sticky-fingers-bbq-sauce-memphis-original/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">$4.49</a> for an 18-oz. bottle</p>\n<p><strong>The Sauce:</strong> Memphis BBQ is low-key one of the best BBQ corners of the country (sorry Texas and the Carolinas). Sticky Fingers Memphis Original Barbecue Sauce brings that wonderful, smoky, and tangy world right to your own backyard. The sauce combines molasses and brown sugar with just the right amount of vinegar and mild spice to boost any grilling session. </p>\n<p><strong>Best For:</strong> Pulled Pork</p>\n<h3>6. Stubbs Sweet Heat BBQ Sauce</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/Bw1K3WLhgjT/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Price:</strong> <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.walmart.com/ip/Stubb-s-Sweet-Heat-Bar-B-Q-Sauce-18-oz/20971358\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">$3.22</a> for an 18-oz. bottle</p>\n<p><strong>The Sauce:</strong> Stubb&#8217;s is a Texan icon at this point. Their Sweet Heat sauce combines a base of molasses and brown sugar with chipotle chili sauce, giving it a mild yet distinctly sharp edge. There&#8217;s also a nice edge of apple cider vinegar tang, tying the whole damn sauce together. </p>\n<p><strong>Best For:</strong> Thick Cut BBQ Bacon</p>\n<h3>5. Bullseye Original Barbecue Sauce</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CDJgOpOFHU3/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Price:</strong> <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.walmart.com/ip/Bull-s-Eye-Original-BBQ-Sauce-18-oz-Bottle/10295518\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">$1.50</a> for an 18-oz. bottle </p>\n<p><strong>The Sauce:</strong> This is a perfectly fine dipping BBQ sauce. You can use it on some chicken, we guess. But the sauce leans a little more sweet than tangy. Also, it&#8217;s $1.50 for a bottle. You can&#8217;t expect hand-crafted greatness at that price point. </p>\n<p><strong>Best For:</strong> Dipping <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/best-fast-food-chicken-tenders-ranked-2020/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Chicken Tenders</a></p>\n<h3>4. KC Masterpiece Barbecue Sauce</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B8EkiRGhj9K/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Price:</strong> <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.walmart.com/ip/KC-Masterpiece-Original-Barbecue-Sauce-18-Ounces/10421988\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">$1.58</a> for an 18-oz. bottle</p>\n<p><strong>The Sauce:</strong> This feels like the Coors Light of the list. We love Coors Light around here because it gets the job done and is perfectly fine for what it is. Still, there&#8217;s a plastic presence here that&#8217;s a little off-putting.</p>\n<p><strong>Best For:</strong> Dipping Chicken McNuggets</p>\n<h3>3. Stubbs Original BBQ Sauce</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/BBh2FECpz6d/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Price:</strong> <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.walmart.com/ip/Stubb-s-Original-Legendary-Bar-B-Q-Sauce-36-oz/36299150?athcpid=36299150&#38;athpgid=athenaItemPage&#38;athcgid=null&#38;athznid=PWVUB&#38;athieid=v0&#38;athstid=CS004&#38;athguid=111a0d31-007-17452eb640fd17&#38;athancid=null&#38;athena=true\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">$4.22</a> for a 36-oz. bottle</p>\n<p><strong>The Sauce:</strong> Stubb&#8217;s Original should be in your fridge right now. This sauce isn&#8217;t going to blow your socks off, but it&#8217;ll suit any backyard grilling session perfectly fine with its mix of tangy vinegar, sweet molasses, and sharp black pepper. </p>\n<p><strong>Best For:</strong> Burgers</p>\n<h3>2. Jack Daniel&#8217;s Original #7 Recipe BBQ Sauce</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CBzKTMAhpVD/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Price:</strong> <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.target.com/p/jack-daniel-s-original-no-7-recipe-barbecue-sauce-19oz/-/A-13652414\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">$3.19</a> for a 19-oz. bottle</p>\n<p><strong>The Sauce:</strong> This is probably the most complex BBQ sauce on this list and a steal at this price. The sauce, of course, utilizes Jack Daniel&#8217;s Tennesee Whiskey with a mix of apple cider vinegar, pineapple juice, brown sugar, and tamarind paste. It&#8217;s bold and unique.</p>\n<p><strong>Best For:</strong> Beef Ribs</p>\n<h3>1. Sweet Baby Ray&#8217;s Honey Chipotle Barbecue Sauce</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/BhPoCYMA_MV/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Price:</strong> <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.walmart.com/ip/Sweet-Baby-Ray-s-Honey-Chipotle-Barbecue-Sauce-18-oz/10294612\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">$1.52</a> for an 18-oz. bottle</p>\n<p><strong>The Sauce:</strong> Honey and chipotle in one BBQ sauce? Sign us up! This is a great go-to sauce with a good thickness and tang that&#8217;s also cheap enough to always have stocked. It&#8217;s also the tasty sauce is this price range by a country mile. </p>\n<p><strong>Best For:</strong> Wings</p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=_6vKa8Ph11w:ibVxq5rB1n4:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=_6vKa8Ph11w:ibVxq5rB1n4:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=_6vKa8Ph11w:ibVxq5rB1n4:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=_6vKa8Ph11w:ibVxq5rB1n4:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=_6vKa8Ph11w:ibVxq5rB1n4:7Q72WNTAKBA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=_6vKa8Ph11w:ibVxq5rB1n4:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=_6vKa8Ph11w:ibVxq5rB1n4:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/_6vKa8Ph11w\" +0000","feedId":6617,"bgimg":"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/bbq-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?w=1600&h=495&crop=1","linkMd5":"f6890f885e0de9f638a5b02463ee430a","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn38@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-02-642_52600c7a6e1948d0.webp","destWidth":1600,"destHeight":495,"sourceBytes":341090,"destBytes":341090,"author":"Zachary Johnston","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/bbq-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?w=1600&h=495&crop=1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn38@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-02-642_52600c7a6e1948d0.webp","https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/bbq-sauce-amazon.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn47@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-16-634_808a06365900ad6d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=_6vKa8Ph11w:ibVxq5rB1n4:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn45@2020_4/2020/09/04/17-11-29-773_61a6b94a5050d619.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-18-942_f1234b5e3acb72a6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=_6vKa8Ph11w:ibVxq5rB1n4:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn52@2020_3/2020/09/04/17-11-15-478_02c509696c7ed37e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/_6vKa8Ph11w":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn20@2020_6/2020/09/04/17-11-17-014_edacf7e814ed9e55.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599239462313},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"The Rundown: Should Sylvester Stallone Cut Paulie’s Robot From The ‘Rocky IV’ Director’s Cut?","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402536886","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1600\" height=\"495\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/robot-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?w=1600&#38;h=495&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"\" loading=\"lazy\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/robot-tfeat-uproxx.jpg 1600w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/robot-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=300,93 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/robot-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=650,201 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/robot-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=768,238 768w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/robot-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=1024,317 1024w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/robot-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=1536,475 1536w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) calc(100vw - 20px), (max-width: 1024px) calc(100vw - 40px), (min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p><em><a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/tag/the-rundown/\" target=\"_blanak\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The Rundown</a> is a weekly column that highlights some of the biggest, weirdest, and most notable events of the week in entertainment. The number of items could vary, as could the subject matter. It will not always make a ton of sense. Some items might not even be about entertainment, to be honest, or from this week. The important thing is that it&#8217;s Friday, and we are here to have some fun.</em></p>\n<h3>ITEM NUMBER ONE &#8212; Robot news</h3>\n<p>Background first, because history is important. In <em>Rocky IV</em>, the classic work of cinema in which Rocky Balboa avenges his friend’s death and single-handedly ends the Cold War by whupping a roided-up Russian superhuman on Christmas Day in Moscow, Rocky gifts his brother-in-law, the charming and perpetually unshaven grump Paulie, a talking robot. Like, a full-on robot, not a Roomba or one of those little robot dogs. Here, look. </p>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:56.25%;\"><iframe class='youtube-player' width='640' height='360' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/cku6oPGWW7Q?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></div>\n<p>It is, to be very clear, hilarious and extremely 1980s, in a way very few things are. People were obsessed with robots for a chunk of the 1980s and 90s. Robots popped up in all sorts of television shows and movies, and, except for your Terminators and such, were usually friendly and helpful. It was a very optimistic time. People had yet to discover what technology and algorithms had in store for us. They thought we’d have polite robot butlers that would make us pancakes and do our laundry; instead, we have tiny supercomputers that we refuse to put down for one single second and that feed our once-sweet aunts and uncles a steady stream of conspiracy theories and thinly-disguised propaganda. It’s not ideal. </p>\n<p>Anyway, Sylvester Stallone is preparing a new director’s cut of the film for its 35th anniversary, and he announced it on Instagram, and everything was proceeding at a normal clip until we reached this section of the comments on the post. </p>\n<figure id=\"402536968\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-402536968\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/rocky-robot.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"488\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/rocky-robot.jpg 488w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/rocky-robot.jpg?resize=300,333 300w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 488px) 100vw, 488px\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">instagram</span></figcaption></figure>\n<p>I will get to the substance of this issue in a second, but first, take a minute to consider two things:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Please say “The robot is going to the junkyard forever” in your best and/or worst Stallone voice, out loud, at least a dozen times throughout the day</li>\n<li>Please picture Sylvester Stallone wearing reading glasses and sitting at a laptop pecking out replies to comments on his Instagram with his two meaty index fingers</li>\n</ul>\n<p>But yes, this all raises an important question: Should Sylvester Stallone cut Paulie’s robot from the director’s cut of <em>Rocky IV</em>? Let’s look at both sides of the argument.</p>\n<p>THE CASE FOR KEEPING THE ROBOT</p>\n<p>The robot is very funny and watching Paulie react to it cracks me up. I would be sad if it just disappeared. I would like more of the robot, actually. And there’s more of it there to give me, <a href=\"https://screencrush.com/rocky-iv-directors-cut-no-robot/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">as Screencrush explained</a> recently. </p>\n<blockquote><p>Removing Paulie’s Robot is particularly upsetting because there were additional scenes with him that were previously left on the cutting room floor. In one interview [the robot&#8217;s creator Robert] Doornick describes a scene that was cut where “Paulie and the robot had developed an odd couple relationship, with the robot complaining that Paulie always slept in the same t-shirt and made too much cigar smoke. The robot ‘found it offensive to [his] sensors.’” so then Paulie messes with the robot’s circuits and changes it from male to female “Most people in the movie don’t understand why the robot switched from a normal voice to a female voice,” Doornick said. “That’s why.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>I absolutely adore that Sylvester Stallone got three <em>Rockys</em> into this franchise and then decided, screw it, I’m throwing an entire robot subplot into my boxing movie about death and loss and ongoing Cold War tensions. I’m mad this much of it was cut already. I’ll be heartbroken if he cuts the rest, in part because it’s always a bummer when filmmakers go back and screw around with their works many decades later, and in part because, again, the whole thing is so cheesy and goofy and so aggressively 1980s that it just fits. It’s a time capsule. Leave it alone, Sly. </p>\n<p>THE CASE FOR CUTTING THE ROBOT</p>\n<p>Rocky is a Philadelphia icon and Philadelphia has a long and storied history of wiping friendly robots out of existence. And when I refer to this long and storied history, what I mean is HitchBOT. You remember HitchBOT, yes? If not, allow me to direct you to <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2015/08/03/us/hitchbot-robot-beheaded-philadelphia-feat/index.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">this CNN report</a>, headlined &#8220;HitchBOT, the hitchhiking robot, gets beheaded in Philadelphia&#8221;:</p>\n<blockquote><p>HitchBOT, the cheerful hitchhiking robot that had made cross-country trips across Canada, the Netherlands and Germany, had intended to travel across the United States as well. Instead, it survived all of 300 miles on the mean streets of the U.S.A.</p>\n<p>Two weeks after beginning its U.S. trip in Boston, the robot was vandalized in Philadelphia, the team overseeing the robot said in a statement.</p></blockquote>\n<p>It is fitting and accurate that Philadelphia’s most iconic fictional figure would eliminate this robot. Good riddance. </p>\n<p>VERDICT</p>\n<p>Sylvester Stallone should keep the robot in the director’s cut of <em>Rocky IV</em> but add a scene where a group of local toughs stomp it out on the street. A healthy compromise. </p>\n<h3>ITEM NUMBER TWO— Chadwick Boseman was good at everything</h3>\n<figure id=\"402531930\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-402531930\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/chadwick-boseman-marvel-tribute.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"650\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/chadwick-boseman-marvel-tribute.jpg 710w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/chadwick-boseman-marvel-tribute.jpg?resize=300,169 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/chadwick-boseman-marvel-tribute.jpg?resize=650,366 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/chadwick-boseman-marvel-tribute.jpg?resize=150,85 150w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/chadwick-boseman-marvel-tribute.jpg?resize=328,185 328w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/chadwick-boseman-marvel-tribute.jpg?resize=387,218 387w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/chadwick-boseman-marvel-tribute.jpg?resize=460,259 460w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/chadwick-boseman-marvel-tribute.jpg?resize=196,110 196w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 710px) 100vw, 710px\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Marvel</span></figcaption></figure>\n<p>Chadwick Boseman passed away from cancer at age 43. Every part of that sentence is awful. He was so young and so talented and had so much more to do and to give. I’ve read <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/entertainment/ryan-coogler-tribute-chadwick-boseman-black-panther/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">every</a> tribute <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/chadwick-boseman-tributes-marvel-cinematic-universe/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">to him</a> by <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/shuri-black-panther-chadwick-boseman-death-tribute-instagram/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">all of</a> his <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/shuri-black-panther-chadwick-boseman-death-tribute-instagram/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">co-stars</a> and <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/michael-b-jordan-chadwick-boseman-tribute/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">collaborators</a>, and I’ve read every other story about him I’ve seen this week, too, including the one about how <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/chadwick-boseman-beat-cancer-black-panther-2/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">he thought he had it beat</a> as recently as last month. It sucks. It sucks in every way. It would have sucked even if he wasn’t incredibly talented, but it sucks especially because of that. </p>\n<p>A lot of the focus this week has been on his work in <em>Black Panther</em>, and in biopics as Jackie Robinson and Thurgood Marshall. This is understandable, and correct, and good. He brought a kind of quiet power to those roles that leaped off the screen and brought them to life. He was so good in <em>Black Panther</em>. He was so, so good, even as he was playing against a charismatic and colorful villain in Michael B. Jordan’s Killmonger. That’s not easy. It also shouldn’t be a surprise, because he was kind of great at everything. </p>\n<p>For example, did you remember that Chadwick Boseman appeared in an episode of <em>Justified</em> earlier in his career? Because he did. He showed up in the second season as a character named Ralph “Flex” Beeman who could have very easily been one of many forgotten goons on the show. But he was great in the role. I remember watching it at the time and thinking “This guy kind of rules.” I was sad they killed him off at the end of the episode, for a few reasons, not the least of which being that he got to deliver one of the show’s best lines, which I will present here without context, because it doesn’t need it. </p>\n<figure id=\"402536938\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-402536938\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/just-tchalla.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"650\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/just-tchalla.jpg 700w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/just-tchalla.jpg?resize=300,165 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/just-tchalla.jpg?resize=650,357 650w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 700px) 100vw, 700px\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">FX</span></figcaption></figure>\n<p>He was also terrific as a host on SNL, which I say both because it is true and because it will allow me to embed the Black Jeopardy sketch where he appeared in character as T’Challa. </p>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:56.25%;\"><iframe class='youtube-player' width='640' height='360' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/hzMzFGgmQOc?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></div>\n<p>Again, this all just sucks very much. I’m sorry I don’t have a more eloquent way to express myself here. It’s about as far as my brain will let me take things right now. It just sucks, a lot, and I’m sad. </p>\n<h3>ITEM NUMBER THREE &#8212; Something to think about regarding the new trailer for the upcoming James Bond movie, <em>No Time to Die</em></h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:56.25%;\"><iframe class='youtube-player' width='640' height='360' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/vw2FOYjCz38?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></div>\n<p>Watch this whole trailer twice from start to finish. The first time, just take it all in. Then, the second time, use every ounce of power your brain can muster to replace Daniel Craig with Steve Buscemi every time he appears. </p>\n<p>Much better, right? Here to help </p>\n<h3>ITEM NUMBER FOUR &#8212; Look, if we&#8217;re going to do this, let&#8217;s really do it</h3>\n<figure id=\"402516575\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-402516575\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/harry-meghan-markle.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"650\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/harry-meghan-markle.jpg 1024w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/harry-meghan-markle.jpg?resize=300,161 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/harry-meghan-markle.jpg?resize=650,349 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/harry-meghan-markle.jpg?resize=768,413 768w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Getty Image</span></figcaption></figure>\n<p>Back when Prince Harry and Megan Markle dipped on the monarchy and came to America, the strong suspicion among many people whose job or hobby it is to suspect these things was that they would end up in Los Angeles doing Hollywood things. It took a little while, but it did finally happen this week. The former royals signed a big honking deal with Netflix, which, between this and the big honking deal with the Obamas, is now very much in the business of making big honking deals with power couples who have recently left positions of power. <a href=\"https://variety.com/2020/digital/news/prince-harry-meghan-markle-netlix-1234757040/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Variety has the details</a>. </p>\n<blockquote><p>The Duke and Duchess of Sussex, who moved to California earlier this year, had been pitching movies and TV plans around Hollywood, Variety previously reported. Under their new, multi-year deal at Netflix, the couple will make documentaries, feature films, scripted television shows and children’s series.</p></blockquote>\n<p>This is interesting, but vague. It kind of checks off every box Netflix has, short of “Zac Efron learns about science from the world’s most patient scientists,” which is <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/tv/zac-efron-netflix-down-to-earth-review-pure-sick-rad/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">admittedly a very specific niche</a>. Let’s get a little more specific. Tell me about some projects that are in development. </p>\n<blockquote><p>The couple will be focused on creating a wide variety of series about stories and issues that are close to their hearts, such as those that their newly formed nonprofit, Archewell, will highlight. Several projects are already in development, including a nature docuseries and an animated series centered on inspirational women.</p></blockquote>\n<p>Cool, cool, nice, nice. All fine and interesting and about what I think we all expected. But just hear me out here, Harry and Megan, if you’re reading this, which as of this moment I’m going to assume you are: A <em>Suits</em> spin-off. Megan Markle reprises her role as Rachel, who now lives in Los Angeles and his split from Mike and is a high-powered entertainment attorney. And, making his acting debut, Harry co-stars as bad boy rival entertainment lawyer Brix Montecarlo. Oh, they start out as hated adversaries (he hates her for being prepared and following the rules and being generally competent; she hates him for playing fast and loose and skirting the consequences), but eventually, baby, the sparks start flying. The tension builds until, finally, it pops like a balloon in a night of unplanned, spontaneous passion… <em>on the eve of the big trial where they are going head-to-head</em>. </p>\n<p>You would watch at least one episode, just out of curiosity, just to see if Harry can act. Please don’t lie to me or yourself about this. </p>\n<h3>ITEM NUMBER FIVE &#8212; Hankso</h3>\n<figure id=\"402464068\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-402464068\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/tom-hanks-feat.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"650\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/tom-hanks-feat.jpg 710w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/tom-hanks-feat.jpg?resize=300,169 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/tom-hanks-feat.jpg?resize=650,366 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/tom-hanks-feat.jpg?resize=150,85 150w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/tom-hanks-feat.jpg?resize=328,185 328w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/tom-hanks-feat.jpg?resize=387,218 387w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/tom-hanks-feat.jpg?resize=460,259 460w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/tom-hanks-feat.jpg?resize=196,110 196w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 710px) 100vw, 710px\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Getty Image</span></figcaption></figure>\n<p>Tom Hanks is a good man. This much we know or should know based on his long career in the public eye and the numerous stories about him being a sweetheart and <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/13/movies/tom-hanks-mister-rogers.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">the <em>New York Times</em> profile of him</a> that came out when he was about to play Mr. Rogers, because who the hell else was supposed to play Mr. Rogers, you know? He’s also a smart, well-read man, as he proved yet again in a long feature <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/02/magazine/world-war-ii-end-tom-hanks.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">about the legacy of WWII this week</a>, also in the <em>New York Times</em>. And you are welcome to go read it if you life, but I am going to skip right past all of the words he wrote, all the way to the bottom of the page, to what is easily one of the two or three best corrections I’ve ever seen. </p>\n<figure id=\"402537725\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-402537725\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Screen-Shot-2020-09-04-at-11.05.19-AM.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"650\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Screen-Shot-2020-09-04-at-11.05.19-AM.jpg 1123w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Screen-Shot-2020-09-04-at-11.05.19-AM.jpg?resize=300,70 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Screen-Shot-2020-09-04-at-11.05.19-AM.jpg?resize=650,151 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Screen-Shot-2020-09-04-at-11.05.19-AM.jpg?resize=768,178 768w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Screen-Shot-2020-09-04-at-11.05.19-AM.jpg?resize=1024,238 1024w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1123px) 100vw, 1123px\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">New York Times</span></figcaption></figure>\n<p>Okay, two things:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>I don’t know why, and I refuse to risk overthinking it in an attempt to figure it out, but this is the funniest thing in the world to me</li>\n<li>I promise all of you, right now, via words that are published online and cannot be taken back, that if I ever meet Tom Hanks, I will open the conversation by saying “Yo, Hankso”</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Tom Hankso</p>\n<p>TOM HANKSO. </p>\n<p>I will never get over this. </p>\n<h3>READER MAIL</h3>\n<p><em>If you have questions about television, movies, food, local news, weather, or whatever you want, shoot them to me on Twitter or at brian.grubb@uproxx.com (put &#8220;RUNDOWN&#8221; in the subject line). I am the first writer to ever answer reader mail in a column. Do not look up this last part.</em></p>\n<p>From Amanda:</p>\n<blockquote><p>Saw your excellent <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/great-muppet-caper/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">piece on The Great Muppet Caper</a>, one of the nuttiest kids&#8217; movies ever made. While reading it, I was struck by the similarity between it and 2014&#8217;s &#8220;Muppets Most Wanted,&#8221; a criminally underrated entry in the Muppet canon.</p>\n<p>&#8220;Most Wanted&#8221; borrows a lot of elements from &#8220;Caper&#8221; &#8212; jewel thieves, Piggy being romanced by scoundrel who means her harm, celebrity cameos, etc. But there is one area in which &#8220;Most Wanted&#8221; sets itself apart, and that is with the jaw-dropping musical number &#8220;The Big House.&#8221;</p>\n<p>Here is why &#8220;The Big House&#8221; is one of the greatest sequences to appear on film:<br />\n1. The song is written by the peerless Bret McKenzie, one half of the cherished folk comedy duo Flight of Conchords.<br />\n2. It is literally a song about the Gulag, done in a style that is part light pop, part doo-wop (think Manhattan Transfer).<br />\n3. The lead vocal is performed by Tina Fey. Yes, that Tina Fey, of &#8220;30 Rock&#8221; and &#8220;Mean Girls&#8221; fame. She&#8217;s wearing a Russian military uniform and singing in a Russian accent that comes and goes.<br />\n4. She is backed by a chorus that includes McKenzie&#8217;s fellow Conchord, Jemaine Clement, but also Danny Trejo, Ray Liotta and &#8212; somehow &#8212; Josh Groban.<br />\n5. The lyrics include the following &#8220;This is Russia&#8217;s premier state funded hotel/We&#8217;re very proud of our eclectic clientele/Excellence in service since 1932/Don&#8217;t believe what you read in the online reviews&#8221;</p>\n<p>This performance is absolutely the most insane thing in a movie that also include Salma Hayek being chased by bulls, a dancing Ricky Gervais and Kermit being framed by a look-a-like with a heavy Russian accent.</p>\n<p>The Big House is amazing. I think about it at least once a day, and we just don&#8217;t talk about it enough. Please help me in righting this colossal wrong.</p></blockquote>\n<p>Amanda has sent in a number of emails, all of them good, but this is my favorite one yet. It checks all the boxes:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Compliments me in a way that <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/great-muppet-caper/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">allows me to link back</a> to a thing I wrote earlier in the week</li>\n<li>Is informative and comprehensive to a degree that I really don’t have to do any extra thinking beyond block quoting it and doing these lazy bullet points</li>\n<li>Mentions the Muppets</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Thank you, Amanda. I will gladly post this video. </p>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:56.25%;\"><iframe class='youtube-player' width='640' height='360' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/tPDfnzCEgaQ?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></div>\n<p>And guess what: We have a second reader email this week. Another good one that I don’t have to elaborate on much. What a lovely development for me and you. </p>\n<p>From AJ:</p>\n<blockquote><p>As a fellow Sixers fan, I feel the current bleakness of watching the NBA playoffs. Here&#8217;s a way I&#8217;ve been enjoying myself: just watch a Miami Heat game and wait for any mention of Duncan Robinson. The announcers always say his full name. Each time they mention him, I just repeat the name in a different vampire voice from What We Do In The Shadows. (&#8220;Get out of here, Duncan Robinson! *hiss*) He shoots like 12 3s a game, so you get a lot of opportunities to practice your various Nandor, Nadia, and Lazlo deliveries. Not so much a question as a suggestion for finding simple joy in these trying times.</p></blockquote>\n<p>Mentioning both my beloved Philadelphia 76ers and my beloved <em>What We Do in the Shadows</em> in the same email is basically a cheat code to get yourself published in this column. And yes, I will be saying “Duncan Robinson” with exactly the same energy as those three say “Colin Robinson,” but worse, because I am incapable of doing accents or impressions. Sometimes I forget this last part and start to do one and I realize one syllable into it what a horrible mistake I’ve made. You’d think I would know by now. </p>\n<p>And yet!</p>\n<h3>AND NOW, THE NEWS</h3>\n<p>To <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/airline-pilots-reported-seeing-guy-jetpack-flying-3-000-feet-n1239027\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Los Angeles</a>!</p>\n<blockquote><p>Two pilots on two different flights reported seeing a man in a jetpack thousands of feet in the air above Los Angeles on Sunday, prompting an investigation by authorities.</p></blockquote>\n<p>Hell yes. I love this. I love a good jetpack story. I’m kind of mad we all don’t have jetpacks, to be honest. It’s 2020! Come on! I should be able to fly around with my own personal rocket backpack! Now I&#8217;m angry! Let&#8217;s move on!</p>\n<blockquote><p>An American Airlines pilot was approaching Los Angeles International Airport at around 6:30 p.m. when he called in the sighting to air-traffic control, according to an audio log. The unidentified flying person was at the plane’s altitude, the pilot said, about 3,000 feet in the air.</p></blockquote>\n<p>Damm. I wonder what the pilot said to the tower when he saw some dude in a damn jetpack 3,000 feet in the air. </p>\n<blockquote><p>“Tower, American 1997. We just passed a guy in a jetpack,” the pilot said.</p>\n<p>“Only in LA,” an unidentified person said in the audio log.</p></blockquote>\n<p>This is tremendous. It’s almost exactly like what the pilot and tower guy would say in a movie about a guy who has a jetpack. Screw it, let’s make this movie. Let’s make a jetpack movie. Prince Harry and Megan Markle can star in it as part of their Netflix deal. You know Harry would love to play a jetpack guy. I get strong “way into jetpacks” vibes from him. </p>\n<blockquote><p>The FBI’s Los Angeles Field Office also confirmed it was aware of the sighting. A spokeswoman for the office said the FBI was working to determine what happened.</p></blockquote>\n<p>If there is any justice in this cruel and unforgiving world, the FBI will assign this jetpack investigation <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/tv/mcmillions-agent-doug/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">to Agent Doug from <em>McMillions</em></a>. I think he would really enjoy it.</p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=8oR7O8iqf_I:882MYLEyH1U:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"‘The Batman’ Has Resumed Production Without Robert Pattinson After He Tested Positive For COVID-19","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402537653","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1600\" height=\"660\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/batman-robert-pattinson-batsuit.jpg?w=1600&#38;h=660&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"\" loading=\"lazy\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/batman-robert-pattinson-batsuit.jpg?resize=1200,495 1200w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/batman-robert-pattinson-batsuit.jpg?resize=1600,660 1600w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) calc(100vw - 20px), (max-width: 1024px) calc(100vw - 40px), (min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">DC</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p>Time to shine <a href=\"https://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-8697581/Batman-crew-working-round-clock-shoot-without-Robert-Pattinson-amid-covid.html\">the Penguin-Signal</a>. </p>\n<p><a href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/robert-pattinson-covid-the-batman/\">We learned yesterday</a> that a &#8220;member of <em>The Batman</em> production [had] tested positive for COVID-19,&#8221; leading to production temporarily being shut down. It turns out the &#8220;member&#8221; is Robert Pattinson (which was initially reported by <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2020/09/09/robert-pattinson-the-batman-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><em>Vanity Fair</em></a> and confirmed by the <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/03/arts/Robert-Pattinson-Covid-19-Batman.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><em>New York Times</em></a>), and although the Dark Knight actor is still sidelined, the show (superhero film) must go on. The <em>Daily Mail</em> <a href=\"https://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-8697581/Batman-crew-working-round-clock-shoot-without-Robert-Pattinson-amid-covid.html\">reports</a> that <em>The Batman</em> production crew is &#8220;working around the clock&#8221; to film as many scenes as possible without Pattinson, which doesn&#8217;t sound potentially hazardous for everyone involved, nope, not at all:</p>\n<blockquote><p>The Hollywood actor — who is understood to have turned up on set with a temperature &#8211; will have to stay away from filming for 14 days while he recovers and to ensure he doesn’t spread the deadly virus. Amid fears that halting production for two weeks could cost as much as £5 million [over $6 million], the film’s director Matt Reeves is trying to film as much as he can at the Warner Bros. Studio in Leavesden, Hertfordshire, without his leading man.</p>\n<p>Any of the 130-strong crew who did not have direct contact with Pattinson are being asked to return to work.</p></blockquote>\n<p>The irony of the world&#8217;s most famous masked hero testing positive for COVID should not be lost on anyone, but it has been, as &#8220;the United Kingdom industry is confident that crews are observing COVID-19 protocols,&#8221; <a href=\"https://variety.com/2020/film/global/the-batman-resumes-filming-without-robert-pattinson-1234759647/\">according to <em>Variety</em></a>. Adrian Wootton, chief executive of the British Film Commission and Film London, told the publication, &#8220;We’re confident that with all measures in place, any production will resume filming as soon as it’s safe to do so. We also believe this will not impact production overall continuing in U.K., precisely because we have such robust health and safety measures operating, enabling our world-class film and high-end TV sector to get back up and running.&#8221;</p>\n<p>Maybe Batman can work things out with the Riddler over Zoom.</p>\n<p>(Via <a href=\"https://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-8697581/Batman-crew-working-round-clock-shoot-without-Robert-Pattinson-amid-covid.html\">the <em>Daily Mail</em></a>)</p>\n<div 2020 15:05:56 +0000","feedId":6617,"bgimg":"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/batman-robert-pattinson-batsuit.jpg?w=1600&h=660&crop=1","linkMd5":"28f0314b4285863a3971da05ed837c74","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn72@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-610_ef4890100de0b5f4.webp","destWidth":1600,"destHeight":660,"sourceBytes":63416,"destBytes":63416,"author":"Josh Kurp","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/batman-robert-pattinson-batsuit.jpg?w=1600&h=660&crop=1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn72@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-610_ef4890100de0b5f4.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=qE5xRcr5n-4:op3EurbwyyA:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn21@2020_4/2020/09/04/17-11-18-712_9496c6bca663f1b0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-18-942_f1234b5e3acb72a6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=qE5xRcr5n-4:op3EurbwyyA:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn97@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-22-912_71798e0b68571571.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/qE5xRcr5n-4":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn62@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-22-542_489dda2e4db87dba.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599239462307},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"The Best Cheap Whiskey, According To The Masses","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402536003","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1600\" height=\"495\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/w-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?w=1600&#38;h=495&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"\" loading=\"lazy\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/w-tfeat-uproxx.jpg 1600w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/w-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=300,93 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/w-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=650,201 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/w-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=768,238 768w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/w-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=1024,317 1024w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/w-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=1536,475 1536w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) calc(100vw - 20px), (max-width: 1024px) calc(100vw - 40px), (min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">UPROXX</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p>Whiskey doesn&#8217;t have to be expensive. In fact, we&#8217;d argue that some of the best whiskey out there is actually very <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/bourbons-best-value-for-money/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">affordable</a>. The best cheap whiskey on the shelf generally hits in the $15 to $30 <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/best-bottles-of-bourbon-for-under-20/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">range</a> and, more often than not, is full of great flavors. This is especially true of the best <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/best-bourbon-under-50/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">cheap</a> bourbons since they don&#8217;t have to travel overseas to get to your home bar. </p>\n<p>So, what makes a good cheap whiskey? That&#8217;s simple. Does it taste good to you? Then that&#8217;s enough. Look, you spend $100 on a bottle of whiskey. No one&#8217;s stopping you from doing that. But, for that same $100 bill, you can buy five, maybe even six bottles of perfectly passable every-day-drinking whiskeys. We&#8217;ll let you do the math on that.</p>\n<p>To find out what the masses think are the best cheap whiskeys on the shelf today, we went over to Ranker to see what the people had to say. A clear top ten emerged that represents <a href=\"https://www.ranker.com/list/best-cheap-whiskey/bottoms-up?ref=search\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">a solid list of whiskeys</a>. Are these the best whiskeys overall? No. Maybe. Kind of. There are certainly some tasty crowd-pleasers on this list and that&#8217;s enough. </p>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\"><strong>Related: <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/underrated-bourbons/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The Most Underrated Bourbons You Can Buy Right Now</a></strong></div>\n<h3>10. Four Roses</h3>\n<figure id=\"402536009\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-402536009\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/four-roses.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"650\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/four-roses.jpg 1500w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/four-roses.jpg?resize=300,400 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/four-roses.jpg?resize=650,867 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/four-roses.jpg?resize=768,1024 768w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/four-roses.jpg?resize=1024,1365 1024w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/four-roses.jpg?resize=1152,1536 1152w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/four-roses.jpg?resize=1122,1496 1122w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/four-roses.jpg?resize=840,1120 840w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/four-roses.jpg?resize=687,916 687w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/four-roses.jpg?resize=414,552 414w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/four-roses.jpg?resize=354,472 354w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1500px) 100vw, 1500px\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Four Roses</span></figcaption></figure>\n<p><strong>ABV:</strong> 40%<br />\n<strong>Distillery:</strong> Four Roses Distillery Lawrenceburg, KY (Kirin Brewing)<br />\n<strong>Average Price:</strong> <a title=\"\" href=\"https://drizly.com/liquor/whiskey/bourbon/four-roses-bourbon/p3403\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">$20</a></p>\n<p><strong>The Whiskey:</strong></p>\n<p>We&#8217;re big fans of Four Roses around here. Their standard bourbon is a blend of the distillery&#8217;s ten unique mash bills (one high rye, one low rye, and each with five unique yeast strains used). The sip carries the essence of the distillery in the bottle. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>We luckily just got to taste this one live. <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CEcer6bld0P/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Check it out here</a>. This is a light and fruity bourbon up top. That sweet fruit carries through with hints of classic bourbon vanilla and a touch of oak. Overall, it&#8217;s light and accessible in all the best ways. </p>\n<p><strong>Bottom Line:</strong></p>\n<p>This is a solid cocktail mixer. </p>\n<h3>9. Jim Beam</h3>\n<figure id=\"402536012\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-402536012\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/jim-beam.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"650\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/jim-beam.jpg 882w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/jim-beam.jpg?resize=300,292 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/jim-beam.jpg?resize=650,632 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/jim-beam.jpg?resize=768,747 768w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 882px) 100vw, 882px\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Jim Beam</span></figcaption></figure>\n<p><strong>ABV:</strong> 40%<br />\n<strong>Distillery:</strong> Jim Beam Distillery, Clermont, KY (Beam Suntory)<br />\n<strong>Average Price:</strong> <a title=\"\" href=\"https://drizly.com/liquor/whiskey/bourbon/jim-beam-bourbon-whiskey/p5159\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">$18</a></p>\n<p><strong>The Whiskey:</strong></p>\n<p>Jim Beam is the classic (and ubiquitous) dram all standard bourbons are measured against. The juice is a classic mix of corn, rye, and malted barley that&#8217;s aged for four years before blending, cutting down to proof, and bottling. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>Caramel, corn, vanilla, and fruit lead the way. The bourbon is classic for a reason after all. The sip is touched by an echo of oak as the vanilla and caramel take center stage. There&#8217;s a mild spice with a fairground caramel corn sweetness on the short end. </p>\n<p><strong>Bottom Line:</strong></p>\n<p>Mix it, shoot it, drink it on the rocks. </p>\n<h3>8. Jack Daniel&#8217;s</h3>\n<figure id=\"402536010\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-402536010\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/jack-daniels-tennessee-whiskey.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"473\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/jack-daniels-tennessee-whiskey.jpg 473w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/jack-daniels-tennessee-whiskey.jpg?resize=300,634 300w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 473px) 100vw, 473px\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Jack Daniel</span></figcaption></figure>\n<p><strong>ABV:</strong> 40%<br />\n<strong>Distillery:</strong> Jack Daniel&#8217;s Distillery, Lynchburg, TN (Brown-Forman)<br />\n<strong>Average Price:</strong> <a title=\"\" href=\"https://drizly.com/liquor/whiskey/bourbon/jack-daniels-old-no-7-tennessee-whiskey/p5019\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">$25</a></p>\n<p><strong>The Whiskey:</strong></p>\n<p>Jack Daniel&#8217;s Tennessee Whiskey is another stone-cold classic. Frank Sinatra was buried with the stuff because he loved it so much. Rock stars have been swigging from bottles of Jack since there were rock stars. The Tennessee whiskey has an extra layer of refinement thanks to the Lincoln County Process of sugar maple charcoal filtration, making it a bit more refined than a standard Kentucky bourbon. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>Banana and oak greet you. Vanilla arrives next with a hint of dark spice and little tart apple. The banana is ever-present as the oak, spice, and vanilla fades away semi-slowly. </p>\n<p><strong>Bottom Line:</strong></p>\n<p>This is Jack Daniel&#8217;s, no one can tell you how to drink your JD. </p>\n<h3>7. Crown Royal</h3>\n<figure id=\"402536008\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-402536008\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/crown-royal-diageo.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"370\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/crown-royal-diageo.jpg 370w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/crown-royal-diageo.jpg?resize=300,300 300w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 370px) 100vw, 370px\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Crown Royal</span></figcaption></figure>\n<p><strong>ABV:</strong> 40%<br />\n<strong>Distillery:</strong> Crown Royal Distillery, Gimli, MB (Diageo)<br />\n<strong>Average Price:</strong> <a title=\"\" href=\"https://drizly.com/liquor/whiskey/canadian-whisky/crown-royal-fine-deluxe-blended-canadian-whisky/p2873\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">$28</a></p>\n<p><strong>The Whiskey:</strong></p>\n<p>This iconic Canadian whisky is a powerhouse. The juice is a blend of 50 different whiskies with varying grain mash bills, aging times, and even oak it&#8217;s aged in. The result is a focused look at what Canadian whisky can be when blended just right. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>Maple syrup, oak, and vanilla mingle upfront. The syrup leans into grape pancake syrup territory as mild hints of powdery spices ping throughout the taste. The end is short, full of oak and fruit, and satisfying. </p>\n<p><strong>Bottom Line:</strong></p>\n<p>This works well as a highball or as a cocktail base. </p>\n<h3>6. Knob Creek</h3>\n<figure id=\"402536013\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-402536013\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/knob-creek.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"400\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/knob-creek.jpg 400w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/knob-creek.jpg?resize=300,450 300w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 400px) 100vw, 400px\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Knob Creek</span></figcaption></figure>\n<p><strong>ABV:</strong> 50%<br />\n<strong>Distillery:</strong> Jim Beam Distillery, Clermont, KY (Beam Suntory)<br />\n<strong>Average Price:</strong> <a title=\"\" href=\"https://drizly.com/liquor/whiskey/bourbon/knob-creek-kentucky-straight-bourbon-whiskey/p1193\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">$35</a></p>\n<p><strong>The Whiskey:</strong></p>\n<p>Jim Beam spread its wings a bit back in the early 1990s with their Small Batch Collection. This &#8212; along with Basil Hayden, Booker&#8217;s, and Baker&#8217;s &#8212; helped reinvigorate the brand. The juice in the bottle is small-batched from barrels that average nine-years in age. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>Classic bourbon vanilla is present alongside hints of worn leather, buttermilk biscuit dripping with honey, and a sprinkling of orange zest. The peppery spice is a nice accent for the caramel corn bourbon-y aspect with a bit of tart apple crispness. The oak and spice linger the longest as the sip fades away while warming you up. </p>\n<p><strong>Bottom Line:</strong></p>\n<p>This is perfectly suited for a highball or over the rocks. But don&#8217;t sleep on using it in a Manhattan either. </p>\n<h3>5. Jameson</h3>\n<figure id=\"402536011\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-402536011\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/jameson.jpeg\" alt=\"\" width=\"414\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/jameson.jpeg 414w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/jameson.jpeg?resize=300,300 300w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 414px) 100vw, 414px\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Jameson</span></figcaption></figure>\n<p><strong>ABV:</strong> 40%<br />\n<strong>Distillery:</strong> New Midleton Distillery, County Cork<br />\n<strong>Average Price:</strong> <a title=\"\" href=\"https://drizly.com/liquor/whiskey/irish-whiskey/jameson-irish-whiskey/p5138\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">$30</a></p>\n<p><strong>The Whiskey:</strong></p>\n<p>You kind of can&#8217;t go wrong with a bottle of Jameson on the shelf. The Irish tipple is a blend of pot still and grain whiskeys that are aged in ex-bourbon and ex-sherry casks for varying amounts of time. The final result is a workhorse whiskey that works in any application. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>There&#8217;s a grassiness that leads toward a honey sweetness and apple tartness. Expect a hint of nuttiness next to the grass as citrus notes kick in next to a dusting of cinnamon. The oak, spice, fruit, and grassiness fade away fairly quickly, leaving you wanting another sip. </p>\n<p><strong>Bottom Line:</strong></p>\n<p>Jameson and ginger with a lime twist is a classic. But, this one also works fine in a highball or on the rocks in a pinch. </p>\n<h3>4. Wild Turkey</h3>\n<figure id=\"402536016\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-402536016\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/wild-turkey-whisky-exchange.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"650\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/wild-turkey-whisky-exchange.jpg 900w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/wild-turkey-whisky-exchange.jpg?resize=300,400 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/wild-turkey-whisky-exchange.jpg?resize=650,867 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/wild-turkey-whisky-exchange.jpg?resize=768,1024 768w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/wild-turkey-whisky-exchange.jpg?resize=840,1120 840w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/wild-turkey-whisky-exchange.jpg?resize=687,916 687w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/wild-turkey-whisky-exchange.jpg?resize=414,552 414w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/wild-turkey-whisky-exchange.jpg?resize=354,472 354w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Whisky Exchange</span></figcaption></figure>\n<p><strong>ABV:</strong> 40.5%<br />\n<strong>Distillery:</strong> Wild Turkey Distillery, Lawrenceburg, KY (Campari)<br />\n<strong>Average Price:</strong> <a title=\"\" href=\"https://drizly.com/liquor/whiskey/bourbon/wild-turkey-bourbon/p2124\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">$20</a></p>\n<p><strong>The Whiskey:</strong></p>\n<p>This bourbon is made for the mixing crowd. The mash has a fair amount of rye in there, adding texture and depth. The juice is aged for around six to eight years before blending and being brought down to the unique 81 proof. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>Stone fruit, popped corn, and vanilla open this one up. There&#8217;s a mix of Christmas spices next to apple pie with a nice, buttery crust. The sharp spices and mild oak carry the sip to a velvety end with more of the sweet corn and fruit lasting until the last moment. </p>\n<p><strong>Bottom Line:</strong></p>\n<p>Use this in your next old fashioned, Sazerac, or boulevardier. </p>\n<h3>3. Evan Williams</h3>\n<figure id=\"402536015\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-402536015\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mob-evan-williams-bg.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"640\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mob-evan-williams-bg.jpg 640w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mob-evan-williams-bg.jpg?resize=300,422 300w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) 100vw, 640px\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Evan Williams</span></figcaption></figure>\n<p><strong>ABV:</strong> 43%<br />\n<strong>Distillery:</strong> Heaven Hill Distillery, Louisville, KY<br />\n<strong>Average Price:</strong> <a title=\"\" href=\"https://drizly.com/liquor/whiskey/bourbon/evan-williams-bourbon/p3248\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">$15</a></p>\n<p><strong>The Whiskey:</strong></p>\n<p>This label has gained massive popularity since it became the go-to rail bourbon at many a bar around the nation. The classic juice is aged between four and seven years before it&#8217;s blended, cut to proof, and then bottled. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>It&#8217;s kind of like walking through a fairground and smelling the kettle corn popping and the caramel apples drying in the sun. The tartness of the apples mingles with the sweetness of the caramel with hints of vanilla, oak, and spice peeking in. The warm end fades quickly with a slight sweetness lingering. </p>\n<p><strong>Bottom Line:</strong></p>\n<p>It&#8217;s the perfect beer back shot or mixer with cola, ginger, or whatever you dig. </p>\n<h3>2. Buffalo Trace</h3>\n<figure id=\"402536007\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-402536007\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/buffalo-trace.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"596\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/buffalo-trace.jpg 596w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/buffalo-trace.jpg?resize=300,182 300w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 596px) 100vw, 596px\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Buffalo Trace </span></figcaption></figure>\n<p><strong>ABV:</strong> 45%<br />\n<strong>Distillery:</strong> Buffalo Trace Distillery, Frankfort, KY (Sazerac)<br />\n<strong>Average Price:</strong> <a title=\"\" href=\"https://drizly.com/liquor/whiskey/bourbon/buffalo-trace-bourbon/p2260\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">$30</a></p>\n<p><strong>The Whiskey:</strong></p>\n<p>Buffalo Trace is an award-winning bourbon from one of the biggest distilleries in Kentucky right now. This bottle was crafted to be an example of the great work Buffalo Trace does with its premier brands. The low-rye mash bill leans into the softness of the Kentucky limestone water the region is famous for. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>There&#8217;s a crafted feel to this sip as vanilla and molasses dance up top with a hint of fresh mint. Rich and buttery toffee mingles with hints of mild spice, dark berries, and plenty of oak. The sip&#8217;s softness takes hold as the oak, fruit, and spice fade, leaving you with a warming sense of comfort. </p>\n<p><strong>Bottom Line:</strong></p>\n<p>Use it however you see fit. </p>\n<h3>1. Maker&#8217;s Mark</h3>\n<figure id=\"402536014\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-402536014\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Makers_Mark_Bottle_wWindow_1300x1733.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"600\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Makers_Mark_Bottle_wWindow_1300x1733.jpg 600w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Makers_Mark_Bottle_wWindow_1300x1733.jpg?resize=300,400 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Makers_Mark_Bottle_wWindow_1300x1733.jpg?resize=414,552 414w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Makers_Mark_Bottle_wWindow_1300x1733.jpg?resize=354,472 354w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Maker</span></figcaption></figure>\n<p><strong>ABV:</strong> 45%<br />\n<strong>Distillery:</strong> Maker&#8217;s Mark Distillery, Loretto, KY (Beam Suntory)<br />\n<strong>Average Price:</strong> <a title=\"\" href=\"https://drizly.com/liquor/whiskey/bourbon/makers-mark-bourbon-whisky/p1254\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">$30</a></p>\n<p><strong>The Whiskey:</strong></p>\n<p>This is another classic Kentucky bourbon that leans into the world of wheated bourbons. The mash bill chucks the usual rye and replaces it with red winter wheat. The juice is then aged for six to seven years and then blended, cut down to proof, and then bottled before the famous red wax seal is applied. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>Crème brûlée cut with pods of vanilla beans rings loudest with a sense of dark spices drawing you in. There&#8217;s a crusty bread flourish that counterpoints the rich and velvety vanilla pudding edge. The sip lingers with a mild spice, a bit of oak, and a wisp of fresh mint as it slowly fades away. </p>\n<p><strong>Bottom Line:</strong></p>\n<p>This is the perfect cocktail base that works on the rocks or in a highball just as well.</p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=rBjVSRT4S3Y:DwIJWQD2KwY:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img
