01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"James Bond Meets A New 00 Agent And Kills Bad Guys With Ana De Armas In The ‘No Time To Die’ Trailer","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402536025","description":"<div class=\"upx-component upx-embed-url\"><div class=\"embed-holder\"><iframe src=\"//youtube.com/embed/vw2FOYjCz38\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\" allowfullscreen></iframe></div></div><p><em>No Time to Die</em>, which was <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/james-bond-no-time-to-die-delayed-coronavirus/\">originally scheduled</a> to come out in April, will now be released on November 20, making it a Thanksgiving movie. And for that, we&#8217;re thankful. </p>\n<p>We&#8217;re thankful that Daniel Craig is back for one more adventure as 007. We&#8217;re thankful for Rami Malek as Safin, who producer Barbara Broccoli <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/rami-malek-no-time-to-die-james-bond-supervillain/\">describes</a> as, &#8220;He is really the super-villain. He’s the one that really gets under Bond’s skin. He’s a nasty piece of work.&#8221; We&#8217;re thankful for ridiculous set pieces, like cars being flipped in a forest and people jumping off bridges, as seen in the trailer above. We&#8217;re thankful for Lashana Lynch as the rumored next 007. We&#8217;re thankful for Ben Whishaw as Q, because it reminds us of Paddington. And we&#8217;re thankful for seeing Ana de Armas in anything.</p>\n<p>Here&#8217;s the official plot synopsis:</p>\n<blockquote><p>In <em>No Time to Die</em>, Bond has left active service and is enjoying a tranquil life in Jamaica. His peace is short-lived when his old friend Felix Leiter from the CIA turns up asking for help. The mission to rescue a kidnapped scientist turns out to be far more treacherous than expected, leading Bond onto the trail of a mysterious villain armed with dangerous new technology.</p></blockquote>\n<p><em>No Time to Die</em>, which also stars Léa Seydoux, Naomie Harris, Jeffrey Wright, Christoph Waltz, Rory Kinnear, Ralph Fiennes, and Billy Magnussen, opens on November 20.</p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=tMLbUrb2ih0:Ola8KIGUQoc:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/tMLbUrb2ih0\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 03 Sep 2020 12:39:30 +0000","feedId":6617,"bgimg":"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs","linkMd5":"005240a9b60b3a77a7cc9910c9a76f6e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","destWidth":113,"destHeight":24,"sourceBytes":1072,"destBytes":460,"author":"Josh Kurp","articleImgCdnMap":{"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=tMLbUrb2ih0:Ola8KIGUQoc:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn56@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-17-964_f74745b78b387b8b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-18-942_f1234b5e3acb72a6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=tMLbUrb2ih0:Ola8KIGUQoc:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn27@2020_3/2020/09/04/17-11-15-546_36d99f2fa41e000c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/tMLbUrb2ih0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn14@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-22-264_9b0d60b9437ff661.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599239462314},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"Chadwick Boseman’s Hometown Is Building A Statue To Honor The ‘Black Panther’ Actor","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402537772","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1600\" height=\"660\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/black-panther-chadwick.jpg?w=1600&#38;h=660&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"\" loading=\"lazy\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/black-panther-chadwick.jpg?resize=1200,495 1200w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/black-panther-chadwick.jpg?resize=1600,660 1600w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) calc(100vw - 20px), (max-width: 1024px) calc(100vw - 40px), (min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Getty Image</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p>The <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/chadwick-boseman-replace-confederate-statue/\">Confederate monument is unfortunately staying (for now)</a>, but Chadwick Boseman is getting his statue. </p>\n<p>In the days following the <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/chadwick-boseman-dead/\"><em>Black Panther</em> star&#8217;s death</a>, a <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/chadwick-boseman-replace-confederate-statue/\">petition was created</a> to honor Boseman&#8217;s impact by erecting a statue in his hometown of Anderson, South Carolina. &#8220;Upon the release of his film <em>Black Panther</em>, Mr. Boseman took it upon himself to rent out a theatre in his home town of Anderson South Carolina to show the film for free. So that young boys and girls could be inspired by the film without the financial barrier. Mr. Boseman is without question an American treasure and his accolades go on and on,&#8221; it read. &#8220;It is only fitting that his work is honored in the same place that birthed him.&#8221;</p>\n<p><em>TMZ</em> <a href=\"https://www.tmz.com/2020/09/03/chadwick-boseman-hometown-honor-statue-tribute/\">contacted</a> Mayor Terence Roberts&#8217; office in Anderson and was told that &#8220;the city is enthusiastically working on a permanent public tribute to honor the late actor. We&#8217;re told the City has already contacted an artist and they&#8217;re brainstorming ideas on how best to honor the hometown hero who played legendary roles. We&#8217;re told the statue will include a mix of sculpture with mural and/or art elements.&#8221; As for tearing down the city&#8217;s shameful Confederate monument, that&#8217;s not the mayor&#8217;s call — it&#8217;s protected by the state&#8217;s Heritage Act, <a href=\"https://www.independentmail.com/story/news/local/2017/08/14/s-c-law-protects-confederate-monuments/566472001/\">which</a> &#8220;states that no historical monument can altered or moved without a two-thirds vote in both chambers of the General Assembly.&#8221;</p>\n<p>A screening of Black Panther was held on Thursday night in Anderson, where one resident <a href=\"https://www.independentmail.com/story/news/2020/09/04/chadwick-boseman-honored-anderson-public-ceremony-hometown-native-black-panther/5709330002/\">told the <em>Independent Mail</em></a>, &#8220;I have been crying, crying, crying. I&#8217;m here to show support to the family. A great young Black man, I came to celebrate him.&#8221;</p>\n<div class=\"iframe-holder\">\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-width=\"500\" data-dnt=\"true\">\n<p lang=\"en\" dir=\"ltr\">Chadwick Boseman is remembered by his hometown, on a stage with a big screen playing Black Panther and by James Brown’s daughter along with local artwork, a new scholarship and art endowment, as hundreds come from miles away to celebrate his life.<a href=\"https://t.co/X7wNJkeggT\">https://t.co/X7wNJkeggT</a></p>\n<p>&#8212; Mike Ellis (@MikeEllis_AIM) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/MikeEllis_AIM/status/1301869899879387141?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">September 4, 2020</a></p></blockquote>\n<p><script async src=\"https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/topic/netflix/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Netflix</a> ushers in September with a new space drama starring Hilary Swank and a creepy Charlie Kaufman film about meeting the in-laws. </p>\n<p>Swank and Josh Charles play a couple trying to make it work on different planets in <em>Away</em>, which feels less thrilling than it should be despite the fairly good special effects. For something a bit more grounded &#8212; and let&#8217;s face it, weird &#8212; Kaufman&#8217;s family drama starring Jessie Buckley and Jesse Plemmons is here to scare you off that relationship milestone for good. Seriously, when will people learn not to let Toni Collette throw their dinner party? </p>\n<p>Here&#8217;s everything coming to (and leaving) Netflix this week of September 4. </p>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:56.25%;\"><iframe class='youtube-player' width='640' height='360' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/3f_REapPwio?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></div>\n<h3><em>Away</em> (Netflix series streaming 9/4)</h3>\n<p>Hilary Swank heads to space in this new sci-fi series that follows an international crew of astronauts going where no man (or woman) has gone before: Mars. Swank plays Emma, a calculated and controlled captain at NASA who leads a team of eclectic geniuses from various ethnic backgrounds &#8212; there are astronauts from China, Russia, India, and the UK on board &#8212; to the red planet while back home, her husband (Josh Charles) and teenage daughter face their own struggles. </p>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\"><strong><a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.netflix.com/title/80214512\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Add To Netflix Queue</p>\n<p> </a></strong></div>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:56.25%;\"><iframe class='youtube-player' width='640' height='360' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/cDTg62vsV4U?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></div>\n<h3><em>I’m Thinking of Ending Things</em> (Netflix film streaming 9/4)</h3>\n<p>Charlie Kaufman&#8217;s latest film is based on a book of the same name and stars <em>Chernobyl&#8217;s</em> Jessie Buckley as a young woman meeting her boyfriend&#8217;s parents for the first time, which normally would be a happy event except she&#8217;s secretly been planning to break up the with the guy. That guy is Jesse Plemons, who seems to be in everything these days, and along with Toni Collette and David Thewlis who plays his parents, they make for hellish dinner mates. </p>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\"><a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.netflix.com/title/80211559\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><strong>Add To Netflix Queue</strong> </a></div>\n<h3>Here’s a transparent; border-left: 6px solid #f4f4f4; border-bottom: 2px solid transparent; transform: translateX(16px) translateY(-4px) rotate(30deg)\"></div>\n</div>\n<div style=\"margin-left: auto;\">\n<div style=\" width: 0px; border-top: 8px solid #F4F4F4; border-right: 8px solid transparent; transform: translateY(16px);\"></div>\n<div style=\" background-color: #F4F4F4; flex-grow: 0; height: 12px; href=\"https://www.instagram.com/tv/CEppiNRlpvs/?utm_source=ig_embed&#38;utm_campaign=loading\" style=\" color:#000; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; font-style:normal; font-weight:normal; line-height:17px; text-decoration:none; word-wrap:break-word;\" target=\"_blank\">Stay disciplined.  Boost your immune system.  Commit to wellness.  Wear your mask.  Protect your family.  Be strict about having people over your house or gatherings.  Stay positive.  And care for your fellow human beings.  Stay healthy, my friends.  DJ <img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/13.0.0/72x72/1f5a4.png\" alt=\"🖤\" class=\"wp-smiley\" style=\"height: 1em; max-height: 1em;\" />  #controlthecontrollables</a></p>\n<p style=\" color:#c9c8cd; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px; margin-bottom:0; margin-top:8px; overflow:hidden; padding:8px 0 7px; text-align:center; text-overflow:ellipsis; white-space:nowrap;\">A post shared by <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/therock/?utm_source=ig_embed&#38;utm_campaign=loading\" style=\" color:#c9c8cd; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; font-style:normal; font-weight:normal; line-height:17px;\" target=\"_blank\"> therock</a> (@therock) on <time style=\" font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px;\" datetime=\"2020-09-02T22:26:00+00:00\">Sep 2, 2020 at 3:26pm PDT</time></p>\n</div>\n</blockquote>\n</div>\n<p>The wrestler-turned-actor revealed the news in an Instagram post on Wednesday night, with a video that runs over 11 minutes. In it, he says that he and his wife, Lauren, and two of their three daughters, Jasmine, 4, and Tiana, 2, all came back with positive results. Mind you, this isn’t news: Johnson claims the disease has come and gone, and that they’re all “no longer contagious.”</p>\n<p>Still, he wanted to warn people about “one of the most challenging and difficult” ordeals he and his family have ever gone through.</p>\n<p>“Testing positive for COVID-19 is a lot different than recovering from nasty injuries, getting evicted or being broke, which I’ve been more than a few times,” he said. “My No. 1 priority is to always protect my family and my loved ones … I wish it was only me that tested positive. It was my entire family and it was a kick in the gut. We as a family are good, we’re on the other end of it and no longer contagious. Thank God, we’re healthy.”</p>\n<p>He continued:</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We are counting our blessings right now. We are well aware you don’t always get to the other end of COVID-19 stronger and healthier. I have had some of my best friends lose their parents to this virus that is so incredibly relentless and unforgiving. We are counting our blessings, but we are good.</p></blockquote>\n<p>Alongside the video, Johnson posted an encouraging message:</p>\n<blockquote><p>Stay disciplined.<br />\nBoost your immune system.<br />\nCommit to wellness.<br />\nWear your mask.<br />\nProtect your family.<br />\nBe strict about having people over your house or gatherings.<br />\nStay positive.<br />\nAnd care for your fellow human beings.</p>\n<p>Stay healthy, my friends.</p></blockquote>\n<p>Glad to hear you and your family are doing better, Mr. Johnson.</p>\n<p>(Via <em><a href=\"https://ew.com/celebrity/the-rock-family-tested-positive-coronavirus/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">EW</a></em>)</p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a +0000","feedId":6617,"bgimg":"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/therockdwaynejohnson1024.jpg?w=1024&h=501&crop=1","linkMd5":"d3ea3f373be61710f4ecb0fbca1e8d51","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn62@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-02-586_65eda10c40edb348.webp","destWidth":1024,"destHeight":501,"sourceBytes":39782,"destBytes":39782,"author":"matthewprigge","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/therockdwaynejohnson1024.jpg?w=1024&h=501&crop=1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn62@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-02-586_65eda10c40edb348.webp","https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/13.0.0/72x72/1f5a4.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn37@2020_4/2020/09/04/17-11-21-031_fb5f03c7cb610e5b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=fZ8eJRZKxwY:yWSiLGxF4o4:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn9@2020_3/2020/09/04/17-11-22-204_dad6003b2e89d124.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-18-942_f1234b5e3acb72a6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=fZ8eJRZKxwY:yWSiLGxF4o4:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn42@2020_3/2020/09/04/17-11-18-988_3127b0cea385ba1e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/fZ8eJRZKxwY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn26@2020_1/2020/09/04/17-11-20-068_a85b3a534b0d3f8f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599239462315},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"Report: Chadwick Boseman Was Convinced He Would Beat Cancer And Regain Weight For The ‘Black Panther’ Sequel To Film In 2021","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402534980","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1024\" height=\"450\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/chadwick-boseman.jpg?w=1024&#38;h=450&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"\" loading=\"lazy\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/chadwick-boseman.jpg 1024w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/chadwick-boseman.jpg?resize=768,338 768w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) calc(100vw - 20px), (max-width: 1024px) calc(100vw - 40px), (min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Getty Image</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p>Chadwick Boseman&#8217;s <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/chadwick-boseman-dead/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">death at age 43</a> came as a shock to almost everyone. Even Spike Lee, who directed Boseman in this year&#8217;s <em>Da 5 Bloods</em>, <a href=\"https://people.com/movies/spike-lee-chadwick-boseman-da-5-bloods-tribute/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">never suspected</a> that anything was amiss with Boseman&#8217;s health. The <em>Black Panther</em> star shielded virtually everyone from news of his Stage 3 diagnosis in 2016 &#8212; the same year he first appeared as the MCU&#8217;s T&#8217;Challa in <em>Captain America: Civil War</em>, all the way <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/chadwick-boseman-black-panther-superhero-jackie-robinson-thurgood-marshall-james-brown/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">though <em>Avengers: Endgame</em></a>. A new report from the <em>Hollywood Reporter</em> reveals that even Marvel Chief Kevin Feige had <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/disney-grapples-with-how-to-proceed-on-black-panther-without-chadwick-boseman\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">no idea</a> that Boseman was ill, and of course, people are now wondering what this all means for <em>Black Panther 2</em> (due to arrive in May 2022).</p>\n<p>According to the report, Boseman (who suffered from Stage 4 colon cancer with noticeable weight loss this year) fully <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/disney-grapples-with-how-to-proceed-on-black-panther-without-chadwick-boseman\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">believed</a> &#8220;until about a week before his death that he was going to beat cancer and would be able to gain the weight back.&#8221; He hoped to do so prior to <em>Black Panther 2</em>&#8216;s planned filming date in March 2021. Boseman also wished to start training for the sequel in September, but then his health took a turn for the worse. Here&#8217;s more about Boseman&#8217;s desire to keep his condition <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/disney-grapples-with-how-to-proceed-on-black-panther-without-chadwick-boseman\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">under wraps</a>:</p>\n<blockquote><p>Only a handful of non-family members knew that Boseman was sick, including producing partner Logan Coles, longtime agent Michael Greene, trainer Addison Henderson and 42 director Brian Helgeland &#8212; with varying degrees of knowledge about the severity of the actor’s condition. No one involved with Black Panther was aware, says a source. It was Boseman’s wish to keep his cancer battle private.</p></blockquote>\n<p>Given that Boseman was so beloved in the King T&#8217;Challa role (he was also <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/30/us/chadwick-boseman-children-cancer-trnd/index.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">heroic offscreen</a> as well as in his other <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/chadwick-boseman-black-panther-superhero-jackie-robinson-thurgood-marshall-james-brown/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">cinematic endeavors</a>), there&#8217;s little reason to believe that Marvel Studios and Disney would dream of having another actor portray T&#8217;Challa in a sequel to the 2018 movie that grossed over $1 billion. </p>\n<p><em>Hollywood Reporter</em> discusses that point, as well as an option that might be feasible: to have Letitia Wright&#8217;s Shuri, sister of T&#8217;Challa become the new Black Panther. It&#8217;s an idea that will probably find (bittersweet) audience support, especially considering that <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/hitfix/funniest-best-tweets-avengersendgame-trailer-where-is-shuri/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">fans panicked</a> while worrying whether Shuri would survive the snap. The idea of Shuri becoming the new Black Panther also <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.marvel.com/articles/comics/the-first-time-shuri-became-the-black-panther\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">slides into comic-book lore</a>, so surely, Feige and the rest of Marvel Studios will tie up all the proper knots if they decide to make it happen.</p>\n<p>(Via <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/disney-grapples-with-how-to-proceed-on-black-panther-without-chadwick-boseman\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><em>Hollywood Reporter</em></a>)</p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=-BGDg40x9KI:QlK1VWJEeA8:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/-BGDg40x9KI\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 02 Sep 2020 18:01:16 +0000","feedId":6617,"bgimg":"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/chadwick-boseman.jpg?w=1024&h=450&crop=1","linkMd5":"dc82b87e9dafaaeed4c61f9f5a126545","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn62@2020_1/2020/09/04/17-11-02-587_bf92a6c1cfcd4d5b.webp","destWidth":1024,"destHeight":450,"sourceBytes":79836,"destBytes":79836,"author":"Kimberly Ricci","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/chadwick-boseman.jpg?w=1024&h=450&crop=1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn62@2020_1/2020/09/04/17-11-02-587_bf92a6c1cfcd4d5b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=-BGDg40x9KI:QlK1VWJEeA8:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn23@2020_3/2020/09/04/17-11-20-823_d22f5085c61f69a0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-18-942_f1234b5e3acb72a6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=-BGDg40x9KI:QlK1VWJEeA8:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn95@2020_4/2020/09/04/17-11-20-597_c801785e795accac.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/-BGDg40x9KI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn2@2020_1/2020/09/04/17-11-21-484_c462df8336be9563.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599239462317},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"Zack Snyder’s ‘Army of the Dead’ Is Already Getting A Netflix Prequel And Anime Spinoff","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402537350","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1024\" height=\"497\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/zacksnyderarmyofthedead1024.jpg?w=1024&#38;h=497&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"\" loading=\"lazy\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/zacksnyderarmyofthedead1024.jpg 1024w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/zacksnyderarmyofthedead1024.jpg?resize=300,146 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/zacksnyderarmyofthedead1024.jpg?resize=650,315 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/zacksnyderarmyofthedead1024.jpg?resize=768,373 768w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) calc(100vw - 20px), (max-width: 1024px) calc(100vw - 40px), (min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Zack Snyder on Twitter</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p>We haven&#8217;t seen Zack Snyder&#8217;s <em>Army of the Dead</em> on Netflix just yet, but the Dawn of the Dead sequel is apparently getting its own extended universe on Netflix. Snyder&#8217;s Army of the Dead isn&#8217;t even out yet, as the movie still requires reshoots after it was announced that <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/tig-notaro-replacing-chris-delia-zack-snyder-army-of-the-dead/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Tig Notaro would fill a role meant for Zack D&#8217;Elia</a> following a series of sexual misconduct allegations against the actor and standup. </p>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/zack-snyders-army-of-the-dead-prequel-and-anime-series-in-the-works\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">But according to a story in The Hollywood Reporter</a>, Snyder&#8217;s non-Justice League playground is getting a lot bigger, with an anime and sequel already signed up for by the streaming giant well before the zombie heist film gets an audience on Netflix.</p>\n<p>The spinoff movie won&#8217;t feature Snyder directing the project, but he will produce it. Interestingly, an actor in the Army Of The Dead film, Matthias Schweighöfer, will direct the movie that will feature on his Ludwig Dieter. According to THR, the movie will film in Germany. As far as the animated series, it will take place in Las Vegas — or what&#8217;s left of it — and focus more on Bautista&#8217;s origin story. </p>\n<blockquote><p>The anime series, Army of the Dead: Lost Vegas, will chronicles the origin story of Bautista’s character and his rescue crew during the initial fall of Vegas as they confront the mysterious source of the zombie outbreak.</p>\n<p>Snyder will direct two episodes of the anime series while Jay Oliva, who has directed numerous movies for DC Comics’ animated line and was a storyboard artist for Dead, will act as showrunner and also direct two episodes of the series. Bautista, Ana de la Reguera, Tig Notaro, Omari Hardwick and Ella Purnell will reprise their roles in the anime series.</p></blockquote>\n<p>The original script of <em>Army of the Dead</em> was apparently pretty gruesome, so maybe that will appear in some of the other properties Netflix is cooking up now.</p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"Denis Villeneuve Wanted To Direct ‘Dune’ After Feeling Only ‘Half Satisfied’ With David Lynch’s Adaptation","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402534680","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1024\" height=\"450\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/dune-timothee-chalamet-top.jpg?w=1024&#38;h=450&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"dune timothee chalamet\" loading=\"lazy\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/dune-timothee-chalamet-top.jpg 1024w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/dune-timothee-chalamet-top.jpg?resize=300,132 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/dune-timothee-chalamet-top.jpg?resize=650,286 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/dune-timothee-chalamet-top.jpg?resize=768,338 768w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) calc(100vw - 20px), (max-width: 1024px) calc(100vw - 40px), (min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Warner Bros.</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p><em>Dune</em> (1984) is a confounding, often-incomprehensible movie, which is to say, it&#8217;s a David Lynch movie. But unlike earlier works like <em>Eraserhead</em> and <em>The Elephant Man</em> and later masterpieces like <em>Blue Velvet</em> and <em>Mulholland Drive</em>, there&#8217;s something&#8230; off about it. <em>Dune</em> has its hardcore defenders, of course, but even Denis Villeneuve, who directed the 2020 adaptation, admits he felt &#8220;half satisfied&#8221; while watching Lynch&#8217;s most expensive film.</p>\n<p>“I’m a big David Lynch fan, he’s the master,” the <em>Blade Runner 2049</em> and <em>Arrival</em> filmmaker <a href=\"https://www.empireonline.com/movies/news/dune-denis-villeneuve-on-being-half-satisfied-by-david-lynch-s-film-exclusive/\">told <em>Empire</em></a>. “When I saw [Lynch]’s <em>Dune</em>, I remember being excited, but his take&#8230; there are parts that I love and other elements that I am less comfortable with. So it’s like, I remember being half-satisfied. That’s why I was thinking to myself, there’s still a movie that needs to be made about that book, just a different sensibility.&#8221;</p>\n<p>That &#8220;different sensibility&#8221; involves Big Dave looking like <a href=\"https://twitter.com/castofcolor/status/1298664920976773120\">helmet-less Vader</a>. I can&#8217;t wait. </p>\n<p>Anyway, Villeneuve was respectful in his criticism of 1984&#8217;s <em>Dune</em>, but no one (<a href=\"https://www.rogerebert.com/reviews/dune-1984\">with the exception of Roger Ebert</a>) has fewer kind things to say about the film than <a href=\"https://io9.gizmodo.com/the-story-of-dune-david-lynch-and-hollywoods-most-not-1843885321\">Alan Smithee, I mean, David Lynch</a>. &#8220;With <em>Dune</em>, I sold out on that early on, because I didn’t have final cut, and it was a commercial failure, so I died two times with that,&#8221; he <a href=\"https://deadline.com/2018/08/twin-peaks-the-return-david-lynch-interview-showtime-emmys-news-1202407985/\">recently told <em>Deadline</em></a>. We&#8217;ll find out what he thinks of Villeneuve&#8217;s <em>Dune</em> (and whether he agrees that Timmy has <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/dune-casting-timothee-chalamet/\">&#8220;insane charisma&#8221;</a>) on December 18, when the film is scheduled to come out.</p>\n<p>(Via <a href=\"https://www.empireonline.com/movies/news/dune-denis-villeneuve-on-being-half-satisfied-by-david-lynch-s-film-exclusive/\"><em>Empire</em></a>)</p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a More","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402535493","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Getty Image</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p>At the top of this year, Prince Andrew and Meghan Markle went under a bit of a life makeover, mostly stepping down from their duties as members of the Royal Family and reimagining themselves as Hollywood players. Nearly nine months after moving to Los Angeles and <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/tv/prince-harry-meghan-markle-hollywood-project/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">quietly shopping around ideas</a>, the two have finally made it: <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/02/business/media/harry-meghan-netflix.html?smid=tw-share\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">As per<em> The New York Times</em></a>, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex have inked a massive deal with Netflix.</p>\n<p>When it was first reported that the two semi-ex-royals were pitching around Hollywood, it was believed they were touting some mysterious TV project. Now we know that they were far more ambitious. Their Netflix deal which will include not only TV, but also movies, documentaries, even children’s programming. There are currently no details on what any of these individual projects will entail, but perhaps a revival of Markle’s old TV show <em>Suits</em> is on the docket?</p>\n<p>When Prince Andrew and his Los Angeles-born wife left England, the portmanteau-loving press and social media dubbed it “Megxit.” Their reasons for relocating may have been less amusing; Markle was routinely attacked and condescended to by the British press, who weren’t above making comments about her being mixed-race. Markle is an outspoken feminist and Prince Andrew often champions progressive platforms, including environmentalism, so that may give you some idea of the many things they’ll be bringing to Netflix in the not-so-distant future.</p>\n<p>(Via <em><a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/02/business/media/harry-meghan-netflix.html?smid=tw-share\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"Taco Bell Is Killing The Mexican Pizza, A Longtime Fan Favorite","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402537151","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1600\" height=\"495\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mexpizza-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?w=1600&#38;h=495&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"\" loading=\"lazy\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mexpizza-tfeat-uproxx.jpg 1600w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mexpizza-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=300,93 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mexpizza-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=650,201 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mexpizza-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=768,238 768w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mexpizza-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=1024,317 1024w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mexpizza-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=1536,475 1536w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) calc(100vw - 20px), (max-width: 1024px) calc(100vw - 40px), (min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">UPROXX</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p>Taco Bell&#8230; what are you doing to us? All you have to do as a fast-food brand to continue to succeed is 1) give us what we love, and 2) cave already on the <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/taco-bell-fake-meat/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">plant-based taco thing.</a> That&#8217;s it! So why in the hell do you keep &#8220;streamlining&#8221; your menu by getting rid of much-loved staples? Last month, the taco chain took <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/taco-bell-changing-menu-august/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">a hatchet to their beefy menu</a> and cut the Grilled Steak Soft Taco, Nachos Supreme, Beefy Fritos Burrito, Quesarito, Spicy Tostada, Spicy Potato Soft Taco, Cheesy Fiesta Potatoes, Triple Layer Nachos, Loaded Grillers, Chips &#38; Dips (excuse me, why?), the Mini Skillet Bowl, and the fan-favorite <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/7-layer-burrito-taco-bell-recipe-at-home/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">7-Layer Burrito</a>. Which&#8230; fine. Whatever. </p>\n<p>This time around they&#8217;ve done the unthinkable. Yes, they actually cut the Mexican Pizza.</p>\n<div class=\"iframe-holder\">\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-width=\"500\" data-dnt=\"true\">\n<p lang=\"en\" dir=\"ltr\">Alright, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/tacobell?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">@tacobell</a>, I understand some of those first cuts you made, even if it hurt to lose the potatoes. But now you&#39;re axing the Mexican Pizza?!? <a href=\"https://t.co/H7zlO9xZtI\">pic.twitter.com/H7zlO9xZtI</a></p>\n<p>&#8212; Justin Bradford (@justinbbradford) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/justinbbradford/status/1301586441189949442?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">September 3, 2020</a></p></blockquote>\n<p><script async src=\"https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script></div>\n<p>Before you freak out, know that you&#8217;ll have until November 5th to enjoy the Mexican Pizza, but after that&#8230; it&#8217;s gone forever. So is Taco Bell&#8217;s shredded chicken option, which will kill the Shredded Chicken Soft Taco, Shredded Chicken Burrito, and the Shredded Chicken Quesadilla Melt. But none of those are nearly as important as the Mexican Pizza. </p>\n<p>Just listen to the anger! </p>\n<div class=\"iframe-holder\">\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-width=\"500\" data-dnt=\"true\">\n<p lang=\"en\" dir=\"ltr\">Just heard the most awful news.  Starting November 5th <a href=\"https://twitter.com/tacobell?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">@tacobell</a> is getting rid of the Mexican Pizza.  As if 2020 couldn’t get any worse.  Why does Taco Bell want to hurt us? <a href=\"https://t.co/LeWfgYFUtE\">pic.twitter.com/LeWfgYFUtE</a></p>\n<p>&#8212; Tom Bartkowski (@TomBartkowski) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/TomBartkowski/status/1301602693778006016?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">September 3, 2020</a></p></blockquote>\n<p><script async src=\"https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script></div>\n<p>The resistance!</p>\n<div class=\"iframe-holder\">\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-width=\"500\" data-dnt=\"true\">\n<p lang=\"en\" dir=\"ltr\">PLEASE RETWEET THIS if you think <a href=\"https://twitter.com/tacobell?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">@tacobell</a> is making A mistake by CANCELING the Mexican pizza!!!</p>\n<p>With enough RT’s maybe we can stop this!!!</p>\n<p>&#8212; bert kreischer (@bertkreischer) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/bertkreischer/status/1301640090821820416?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">September 3, 2020</a></p></blockquote>\n<p><script async src=\"https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script></div>\n<p>The memes!</p>\n<div class=\"iframe-holder\">\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-width=\"500\" data-dnt=\"true\">\n<p lang=\"en\" dir=\"ltr\">when taco bell removed the mexican pizza from their menu <a href=\"https://t.co/RthCnQYd58\">pic.twitter.com/RthCnQYd58</a></p>\n<p>&#8212; kyle (@notori0us_FIG) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/notori0us_FIG/status/1301597361043648513?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">September 3, 2020</a></p></blockquote>\n<p><script async src=\"https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script></div>\n<p>When Taco Bell made its initial menu cuts earlier this summer, they promised that the &#8220;simplified menu and innovation process will leave room for new &#8220;fan favorites&#8221; but we&#8217;ve yet to develop a new favorite that meets the legendary status of the 7-Layer Burrito or the Mexican Pizza. According to<em> <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/amp/2020/09/03/taco-bell-removes-several-menu-items-as-it-streamlines-choices.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">CNBC</a>,</em> alongside the cuts on November 5th, Taco Bell will introduce the Dragonfruit Freeze beverage and a Chicken Chipotle Melt. </p>\n<p>Yay?</p>\n<div class=\"iframe-holder\">\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-width=\"500\" data-dnt=\"true\">\n<p lang=\"en\" dir=\"ltr\">R.I.P. Mexican pizza&#8230;and fuck you taco bell. Nobody wants your dragonfruit freeze. <a href=\"https://t.co/30AShIkgCo\">pic.twitter.com/30AShIkgCo</a></p>\n<p>&#8212; ElephantArmpit (@ArmpitElephant) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/ArmpitElephant/status/1301596140241068034?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">September 3, 2020</a></p></blockquote>\n<p><script async src=\"https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script></div>\n<p>So why cut the Mexican Pizza? <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/amp/2020/09/03/taco-bell-removes-several-menu-items-as-it-streamlines-choices.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">CNBC</a> suggests sustainability is Taco Bell&#8217;s main concern, as the item&#8217;s packaging accounts for more than 7 million pounds of paperboard annually, which is admittedly insane. But couldn&#8217;t they find another way to package this thing? I mean, wrap it in the same paper as the tacos. Or just serve it straight onto our hands. We can deal with the inconvenience for this beloved dish. </p>\n<div class=\"iframe-holder\">\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-width=\"500\" data-dnt=\"true\">\n<p lang=\"en\" dir=\"ltr\">see&#39;s mexican pizza trending and clicks it<br /><img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/13.0.0/72x72/1f62d.png\" alt=\"😭\" class=\"wp-smiley\" style=\"height: 1em; max-height: 2020</a></p></blockquote>\n<p><script async src=\"https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script></div>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=8ShNQ-s1_gk:_yG1a44wC7Q:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=8ShNQ-s1_gk:_yG1a44wC7Q:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=8ShNQ-s1_gk:_yG1a44wC7Q:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=8ShNQ-s1_gk:_yG1a44wC7Q:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=8ShNQ-s1_gk:_yG1a44wC7Q:7Q72WNTAKBA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=8ShNQ-s1_gk:_yG1a44wC7Q:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=8ShNQ-s1_gk:_yG1a44wC7Q:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/8ShNQ-s1_gk\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 03 Sep 2020 22:46:28 +0000","feedId":6617,"bgimg":"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mexpizza-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?w=1600&h=495&crop=1","linkMd5":"3d028272a3b5433e03ac67e3a4b32fa0","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn53@2020_3/2020/09/04/17-11-02-631_48bd1f0358973a75.webp","destWidth":1600,"destHeight":495,"sourceBytes":415714,"destBytes":415714,"author":"daneriveralpc","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mexpizza-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?w=1600&h=495&crop=1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn53@2020_3/2020/09/04/17-11-02-631_48bd1f0358973a75.webp","https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/13.0.0/72x72/1f62d.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn25@2020_1/2020/09/04/17-11-21-660_2904d3843886d8f1.webp","https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/13.0.0/72x72/270c.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn90@2020_1/2020/09/04/17-11-22-819_b9408e8de7672fb9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=8ShNQ-s1_gk:_yG1a44wC7Q:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn41@2020_3/2020/09/04/17-11-21-755_ee1e4072afa51fde.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-18-942_f1234b5e3acb72a6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=8ShNQ-s1_gk:_yG1a44wC7Q:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn5@2020_4/2020/09/04/17-11-19-275_a14df5ff6fbc84cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/8ShNQ-s1_gk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn18@2020_4/2020/09/04/17-11-19-212_1a3e3f4a7a6d7ec0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599239462310},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"Charlie Kaufman’s ‘I’m Thinking Of Ending Things’ Is An Insular, Mystifying Experiment","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402533708","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1600\" height=\"495\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/EndingThings-Caro.jpg?w=1600&#38;h=495&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"\" loading=\"lazy\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/EndingThings-Caro.jpg 1600w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/EndingThings-Caro.jpg?resize=300,93 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/EndingThings-Caro.jpg?resize=650,201 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/EndingThings-Caro.jpg?resize=768,238 768w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/EndingThings-Caro.jpg?resize=1024,317 1024w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/EndingThings-Caro.jpg?resize=1536,475 1536w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) calc(100vw - 20px), (max-width: 1024px) calc(100vw - 40px), (min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Mary Cybulski/NETFLIX</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p>To my mind, Charlie Kaufman has been responsible for at least three or four perfect movies (<a href=\"https://uproxx.com/filmdrunk/eternal-sunshine-spotless-mind-10-years-later/\"><em>Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind </em></a>and <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/filmdrunk/anomalisa-review-charlie-kaufman/\"><em>Anomalisa </em></a>at the top), and at the age of 61, could easily rest on his laurels as one of the greatest screenwriters of all time (not that I&#8217;d want him to). Instead, he has a 700-page novel and a 134-minute movie coming out this year: <em>Antkind</em>, from Random House, and <em>I&#8217;m Thinking Of Ending Things</em>, which he both wrote and directed, out this week on Netflix. </p>\n<p>Knowing that <em>Antkind</em> is about a frustrated film critic named B. Rosenberger Rosenberg (part of the joke is that Rosenberg isn&#8217;t Jewish), it feels almost like Kaufman is pre-emptively daring any unfortunate middlebrow hack to become the butt of an enduring Kaufman joke by daring not to understand Kaufman&#8217;s latest masterpiece. He may as well have titled his latest &#8220;It&#8217;s a Trap!&#8221;</p>\n<p>But fine, here I go into the dunking booth. Honestly, we sound like <a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Confederacy_of_Dunces#Ignatius_J._Reilly\">Ignatius J. Reilly</a> any time we write a negative review anyway, and it&#8217;s not as if &#8220;film critics&#8221; were ever in danger of winning any popularity contests. Charlie Kaufman is probably my favorite filmmaker.<em> I&#8217;m Thinking Of Ending Things</em> is, as of now, my least favorite of his films.</p>\n<p>Adapted from Canadian author Iain Reid&#8217;s debut novel,<em> I&#8217;m Thinking Of Ending Things</em> takes its title from the inner monologue of its protagonist, played by Jessie Buckley, who&#8217;s thinking of breaking things off with her new boyfriend, Jake &#8212; played by Jesse Plemons &#8212; during a road trip to visit Jake&#8217;s parents (hey, Jessie &#38; Jesse, how &#8217;bout that). The Ireland-born Buckley, previously of <em>Taboo</em> and <em>Chernobyl,</em> and one of the best young actresses around, plays a character known alternately as Cindy, Lucy, Lucia, or Amy, who is either a poet, painter, physics student, gerontologist, waitress, or veterinary student depending on which version <em>I&#8217;m Thinking Of Ending Things</em>&#8216; constantly-shifting reality you choose to believe. </p>\n<p>Charlie Kaufman is one of the most astute relationship chroniclers who has ever lived, giving us the <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/filmdrunk/eternal-sunshine-spotless-mind-10-years-later/\">enduring heartbreak of doomed romance in <em>Eternal Sunshine</em></a> (undoubtedly one of the greatest movies of all time), the narcotic rush of a new lover in <em>Anomalisa</em>, and the petty cruelty of a dying marriage in <em>Being John Malkovich</em>. His movies are about the inherent selfishness of the human condition and the struggle to connect (occasionally using himself as the butt of all his least charitable observations about humanity, as in <em>Adaptation</em> and <em>Antkind</em>). <em>I&#8217;m Thinking Of Ending Things, </em>with a relationship reference right in the title, is clearly attempting to mine some of the same territory. Yet for the first time, Kaufman seems unable to connect with his own characters. He can&#8217;t even name them.</p>\n<p><em>I&#8217;m Thinking Of Ending Things</em> is about mortality, relationships, inherited trauma, but more than anything it&#8217;s about verbal dexterity. Almost the entire first 30 minutes takes place inside Jake&#8217;s early 90s sedan, a two-hander with a single location. To Kaufman&#8217;s credit, this isn&#8217;t as boring as that sounds. Jake and Cindy/Lucy contemplate and complement, ponder and provoke, discussing Wordsworth, <em>Oklahoma!</em>, and the death drive in the animal kingdom, all culminating in a hilariously bleak poem that Lucy/Cindy/Lucia/Amy recites aloud. </p>\n<p><em>&#8230;the sun goes up and down like a tired whore,<br />\nthe weather immobile like a broken limb while you just keep getting older.<br />\nNothing moves, but the shifting tides of salt in your body.<br />\nYour vision blears, you carry your weather with you; the big blue whale;<br />\na skeletal darkness<br />\n[&#8230;]<br />\nyou come home with your mutant gifts<br />\nto a house of bone<br />\neverything you see now<br />\nall of it<br />\nbone</em></p>\n<p>The poem is the clearest evidence of the old Kaufman wit, and feels a bit self-deprecating, like Kaufman poking fun at his own depressiveness (though for the record I always found him to be at least as idealistic as he is bleak). </p>\n<p>Through it all, there are constant tone shifts and brief forays into formalistic experimentation &#8212; the implication that Jake can maybe hear what Lucy is thinking, Lucy staring directly into the camera, the extended, certainly-not-intended-literally poems recited by heart. The stylized, hyperarticulate, tone-shifting dialogue, in particular, feels like it was borrowed from Don Delillo or another author whose characters&#8217; dialogue feels more like drowning in that author&#8217;s obsessions than listening to separate humans speaking. Is Kaufman doing an art? But why? </p>\n<p> This manic invocation of theater, poetry, high culture, horticulture, is the kind of thing I expect from Aaron Sorkin or Noah Baumbach, not Charlie Kaufman. Kaufman&#8217;s experimentation has traditionally taken the form of characters <em>doing</em>, not characters <em>saying</em>. Here the main dramatic tension is our expectation that all these references will eventually add up to something.</p>\n<p>When Jake and whatsherface finally arrive at Jake&#8217;s parents&#8217; isolated farmhouse in the midst of a blizzard, the action gets darker, more provocative. There are scratches on the door to the basement. A border-collie that won&#8217;t stop shaking. A pool of blood on the floor of the barn where Jake tells us some pigs got eaten alive by maggots. What&#8217;s happening here? Clearly an art of some kind. (<em>Bone, everything you see&#8230;</em>)</p>\n<p>David Thewlis (voice of the lead in <em>Anomalisa</em> and the yucky-toothed guy in <em>Fargo</em> season 3) plays Jake&#8217;s lecherous, belittling father, who goes off on a tangent about how much he dislikes abstract art (didn&#8217;t we already see this character, in <em>Sideways</em>, with Thomas Hayden Church&#8217;s father-in-law saying he only reads non-fiction?). Toni Collette plays Jake&#8217;s high-strung mother, alternately supportive and infantilizing. Both parents flash forward and backward in age from scene to scene, sometimes appearing young and vibrant, other times old and decrepit, confirming anew that Kaufman is most definitely doing an art of some kind. </p>\n<p>Kaufman seems like he&#8217;s leaving us breadcrumbs along the way, patterns and memes and callbacks, to Pauline Kael, to David Foster Wallace, to &#8220;Baby It&#8217;s Cold Outside&#8221; (is Kaufman lashing out at being unfairly lumped in with the &#8220;sad white guy&#8221; artistic milieu?), leaving us wondering whether this will all come together in some Kaiser Soze moment of clarity at the end. He&#8217;s turned his characters themselves into yet more ephemera, probably deliberately, but in such a way that makes it hard to care. For all our selfishness, it&#8217;s much easier to care about people than about whether a person is doing an art.</p>\n<p>The Reid novel from which the film was adapted has been described as a &#8220;<a href=\"https://www.syfy.com/syfywire/charlie-kaufman-adapting-im-thinking-of-ending-things-for-netflix\">psychological horror</a>&#8221; in the vein of Stephen King, and Kaufman&#8217;s movie feels David Lynchian at times, like a series of vignettes in which a horror film is about to break out but never does. It offers, mainly, the vague sense that this is all supposed to be a fresh and intriguing way of telling a story. And this intrigue is meant to be enough for us not to mind that the characters are all ciphers performing a series of illusory bits and homages amidst a frozen wasteland. This dearth of recognizable humanity and situations made me feel, presumably Kaufman-like, trapped inside my own head, both lonely and bored.</p>\n<p>Maybe it&#8217;s quarantine, but lately I find myself feeling less and less interested in the innovative storytelling techniques and groundbreaking formal experimentation that once inspired me, and which, to some extent, were Kaufman&#8217;s bread and butter. These days I kind of just want to meet interesting characters and go to interesting places. <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/tv/ted-lasso-review-apple-tv-jason-sudeikis/\"><em>Ted Lasso</em></a> looks like absolute Disney drivel on paper, but had me hooked, thanks to a cast of characters I just wanted to hang out with for a while and a setting that was just enough outside my daily experience as to offer some novelty. <em>Ted Lasso</em> is a decidedly less ambitious thing than <em>I&#8217;m Thinking of Ending Things</em> and I judge them through different lenses (and yes, some dull critic invoking a dopey commercial television show in a review of a Charlie Kaufman movie would probably make a great bit for B. Rosenberger Rosenberg). But maybe a polarized world that always feels on the brink of some fresh collapse has made me yearn for simple stories of nice people, interesting places, and low stakes. I don&#8217;t know. </p>\n<p>Maybe, like <a href=\"https://mlb.nbcsports.com/2020/07/05/sean-doolittle-sports-are-like-the-reward-of-a-functioning-society/\">Sean Dolittle said of sports recently</a>, Charlie Kaufman movies are a reward for a functioning society. Or maybe this one just wasn&#8217;t quite as good.</p>\n<p><em>&#8216;I&#8217;m Thinking Of Ending Things&#8217; streams on Netflix on September 4. Vince Mancini is on</em><a href=\"http://twitter.com/vincemancini\"> <em>Twitter</em></a><em>. You can access his archive of reviews</em><a href=\"https://uproxx.com/reviews/\"> <em>here</em></a><em>.</em></p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=-PaTsBOUXMM:ga7oSOWubW0:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=-PaTsBOUXMM:ga7oSOWubW0:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=-PaTsBOUXMM:ga7oSOWubW0:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=-PaTsBOUXMM:ga7oSOWubW0:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=-PaTsBOUXMM:ga7oSOWubW0:7Q72WNTAKBA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=-PaTsBOUXMM:ga7oSOWubW0:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=-PaTsBOUXMM:ga7oSOWubW0:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/-PaTsBOUXMM\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 02:41:36 +0000","feedId":6617,"bgimg":"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/EndingThings-Caro.jpg?w=1600&h=495&crop=1","linkMd5":"682a7e5db3431838dfada5bff582d1a6","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn69@2020_6/2020/09/04/17-11-02-620_c95cf3838123481c.webp","destWidth":1600,"destHeight":495,"sourceBytes":389550,"destBytes":389550,"author":"Vince Mancini","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/EndingThings-Caro.jpg?w=1600&h=495&crop=1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn69@2020_6/2020/09/04/17-11-02-620_c95cf3838123481c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=-PaTsBOUXMM:ga7oSOWubW0:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn33@2020_3/2020/09/04/17-11-17-303_c87cb0634d74ac0a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-18-942_f1234b5e3acb72a6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=-PaTsBOUXMM:ga7oSOWubW0:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn83@2020_1/2020/09/04/17-11-15-423_d53a5e491d50d7b0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/-PaTsBOUXMM":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn53@2020_4/2020/09/04/17-11-21-162_5ee98a9a3b2629ea.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599239462309},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"Robert De Niro And Zach Braff Try To Kill An Unkillable Tommy Lee Jones In ‘The Comeback Trail’ Trailer","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402537848","description":"<div class=\"upx-component upx-embed-url\"><div class=\"embed-holder\"><iframe src=\"//youtube.com/embed/ZgafjiUOonI\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\" allowfullscreen></iframe></div></div><p>In <em>The Comeback Trail</em>, <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/topic/robert-de-niro/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Robert De Niro</a> and <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/tag/zach-braff/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Zach Braff</a> star as Max Barber and Walter Creason, two down and out movie producers who owe money to <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/tag/morgan-freeman/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Morgan Freeman</a>&#8216;s no-nonsense mob boss Reggie Fontaine. The two hatch a scheme to pay back Fontaine, but it doesn&#8217;t exactly go as planned. </p>\n<p>Going by the trailer, there&#8217;s also the matter of Tommy Lee Jones&#8217; character, who isn&#8217;t the easy person to kill. The guy wakes up every morning and plays Russian Roulette, yet he&#8217;s easily pushing 70. He also seems to be impervious to fire and severe blunt force trauma, which should throw a kink in things. The synopsis clears <a href=\"https://deadline.com/2020/06/robert-de-niro-tommy-lee-jones-morgan-freeman-george-gallo-comedy-the-comeback-trail-acquired-by-cloudburst-entertainment-1202970771/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">up a few details</a>:</p>\n<blockquote><p>To save himself and Walter, Barber has to sell the only great script he’s ever had to his former intern and, now, A-Movie producer, James Moore (Emile Hirsch). On the first day of shooting Moore’s lead actor dies in a stunt accident and lets him cash in on a huge insurance policy. That gives Barber an idea to do the same. They take a horrible script called <em>The Oldest Gun In The West</em> and hire a washed-up cowboy actor, Duke Montana (Tommy Lee Jones) to play the lead. Known for doing his own stunts during his prime, Montana is poised for an early demise allowing Barber to get away with his get-rich-quick scam. Only one problem… nobody told Montana.</p></blockquote>\n<p>On a film buff note, <em>The Comeback Trail</em> is the first-time reunion of De Niro and director George Gallo since their collaboration on the action comedy classic <em>Midnight Run</em>.</p>\n<p><em>The Comeback Trail</em> hits theaters November 13.</p>\n<p>(Via <a href=\"https://deadline.com/2020/06/robert-de-niro-tommy-lee-jones-morgan-freeman-george-gallo-comedy-the-comeback-trail-acquired-by-cloudburst-entertainment-1202970771/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Deadline</a>)</p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=gtkpdlQJjV0:VRzBP8JqHqc:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=gtkpdlQJjV0:VRzBP8JqHqc:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/gtkpdlQJjV0\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 16:40:02 +0000","feedId":6617,"bgimg":"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs","linkMd5":"3e1a26ba063e255dede78e1a657954af","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","destWidth":113,"destHeight":24,"sourceBytes":1072,"destBytes":460,"author":"Mike Redmond","articleImgCdnMap":{"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=gtkpdlQJjV0:VRzBP8JqHqc:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn42@2020_4/2020/09/04/17-11-17-319_384d3459a79ae066.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-18-942_f1234b5e3acb72a6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=gtkpdlQJjV0:VRzBP8JqHqc:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn99@2020_4/2020/09/04/17-11-20-640_0c2e2a7e9f85d6e6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/gtkpdlQJjV0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn74@2020_1/2020/09/04/17-11-19-803_76fac1cb93c2ed1d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599239462315},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"No Oktoberfest, No Problem: Drink These 10 Beers Instead","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402533623","description":"<div class=\"featured-image\"> \n <figure class=\"post-thumbnail\"> \n  <div class=\"upx-component upx-image\">\n   <div class=\"image-holder\">\n    <img width=\"1600\" height=\"495\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/okt-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?w=1600&amp;h=495&amp;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"\" loading=\"lazy\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/okt-tfeat-uproxx.jpg 1600w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/okt-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=300,93 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/okt-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=650,201 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/okt-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=768,238 768w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/okt-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=1024,317 1024w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/okt-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=1536,475 1536w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) calc(100vw - 20px), (max-width: 1024px) calc(100vw - 40px), (min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" />\n   </div>\n  </div>\n  <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">\n   <span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Sierra Nevada/Schlafly/Allagash/Uproxx</span>\n  </figcaption> \n </figure> \n</div> \n<p>When summer turns to fall, our thoughts turn to Märzen-style lagers and the beer event that celebrates the style. This year, for obvious reasons, <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/oktoberfest-party-guide/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Oktoberfest </a>in Munich, Germany, has been <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/why-oktoberfest-was-canceled/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">canceled</a>. This is a real bummer for fans of dirndls, giant beer mugs, day drinking, and pretzels as big as your head. But, while the biggest beer festival on the planet is on hiatus this year, you can still throw on your lederhosen, grab an accordion, and hoist your favorite brews from Löwenbräu, Spaten, Hofbräu. Paulaner, Augustiner, or Hacker-Pschorr. Or, you could try one of the many Oktoberfest-style beers available from U.S. breweries. </p> \n<p>“There are many American Oktoberfest-style beers that stand out to me,” says Zachary Shore, bartender at <a href=\"https://www.thompsonhotels.com/hotels/washington/seattle/thompson-seattle/eat-and-drink/the-nest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The Nest</a> in Seattle. “The first being from Sierra Nevada out of California.” Shore continues, “For the first time, Bitburger’s house sealed hops and yeast were used outside of the brewery to provide a true German-style Oktoberfest beer in America.” And, although Bitburger isn’t a traditional Oktoberfest beer (the beers have to be brewed in Munich’s city limits), it’s still a win for Sierra Nevada and American beer drinkers. </p> \n<p>It seems like every brewery makes an Oktoberfest-style beer these days. To find the best, we asked a handful of <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/topic/bartenders-tell-us/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">bartenders</a> to tell us what Oktoberfest beer they’ll be drinking this fall. </p> \n<h3>Dry Dock Docktoberfest</h3> \n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\">\n <iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B2cXM6AJWxe/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe>\n</div> \n<p><strong>Suman Pradham, director of outlets at <a href=\"https://www.viceroyhotelsandresorts.com/snowmass\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Viceroy Snowmass</a> in Snowmass Village, Colorado</strong></p> \n<p><em>Dry Dock Oktoberfest has a light but delightful nose of pilsner malt and earthy hops. It’s very biscuity. The flavor is also light yet inviting with a smooth pilsner base from which a gentle caramel flavor builds mild bitterness with a nice earthy hop character. It’s crisp and clean and smooth. The beer finishes almost creamy, lighter bodied, and well carbonated.</em></p> \n<h3>Metropolitan Afterburner</h3> \n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\">\n <iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CD7Al3PBQZv/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe>\n</div> \n<p><strong>Hayden Miller, head bartender at <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/?p=402533623/Bodega Taqueria y Tequila\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Bodega Taqueria y Tequila</a> in Miami</strong></p> \n<p><em>Metropolitan Afterburner is my favorite American beer for the season. The limited release is a shame because this beer absolutely crushes. Balanced and not aggressive with just a touch above that session ABV at around 6%. It’s perfect for a cool autumn eve.</em></p> \n<h3>Allagash Tripel</h3> \n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\">\n <iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/BtrzCzhgG6h/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe>\n</div> \n<p><strong>Christopher Farzanrad, bartender at <a href=\"http://theglenmarkhotel.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Mila Rooftop Bar</a> in Glendale, California</strong></p> \n<p><em>Allagash brewery beers in general. They have a vast selection. If you are looking for a light, smooth beer, they have the Allagash white. But also have stronger, bitter IPA beers and a perfect beer for fall known as the Allagash Tripel. Technically a Belgian-style Tripel, I still hoist it for Oktoberfest.</em> </p> \n<h3>Schlafly Oktoberfest</h3> \n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\">\n <iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/BaPZ_w9F9Sp/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe>\n</div> \n<p><strong>Kurt Bellon, beverage director at <a href=\"https://www.chaobaanstl.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Chao Baan</a> in St. Louis</strong></p> \n<p><em>For a crisp, cool autumn night, Schlafly Oktoberfest is perfectly crisp and light to match solid windbreaker weather situation.</em></p> \n<h3>Sierra Nevada Oktoberfest</h3> \n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\">\n <iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B3p60dNgwtN/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe>\n</div> \n<p><strong>Veronica Flores, <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/_veronicaalessandra/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">bartender</a> in Austin, Texas</strong></p> \n<p><em>I’m definitely going to thank my home state and Sierra Nevada for making a beer that I can still find when I no longer live there. I am a fan of their beer aptly named “Oktoberfest.” I’m typically a sour, gose, or stout beer drinker. But with this one, when it comes to flavor and yearly consistency, is enough to satisfy me.</em> </p> \n<h3>No Label Oktoberfest</h3> \n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\">\n <iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B04GR1wAZYq/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe>\n</div> \n<p><strong>Jon Joseph, director of food and beverages at <a href=\"https://jlbar.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">JL Bar Ranch, Resort &amp; Spa</a> in Sonora, Texas</strong></p> \n<p><em>I am a big fan of No label Oktoberfest beer. It is on a small scale and done correctly. More of a bock than a Märzen, it’s light, refreshing, and perfect for those early fall days.</em> </p> \n<h3>Samuel Adams Octoberfest</h3> \n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\">\n <iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CD7lKSEJE53/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe>\n</div> \n<p><strong>Aaron Miyakawa, director of restaurants at <a href=\"https://www.princewaikiki.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Prince Waikiki</a> in Waikiki Beach, Hawaii</strong></p> \n<p><em>Whenever I celebrate Oktoberfest with friends, the first beer to come to mind is Samuel Adams. I love the deep amber hue and slight hints of caramel that always remind me of the fall season. It’s not heavy but easy drinking as you can enjoy more than one when celebrating this festive holiday.</em></p> \n<h3>Brooklyn Oktoberfest</h3> \n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\">\n <iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B2_kDS_CnYJ/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe>\n</div> \n<p><strong>Andrew Erickson, lead bartender at <a href=\"https://fablelounge.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Fable Lounge</a> in Nashville</strong></p> \n<p><em>The best beer to have during Oktoberfest is Brooklyn Brewery’s Oktoberfest. It’s a classic Märzen style with sweet maltiness, bready aromas, and subtle hoppy bitterness. It will pair well with any yeasty bread that can be served with unctuous meats or cheeses. Enjoy a fresh poured Brooklyn Oktoberfest with burgers, sausages, or soft pretzels — all of your classic Oktoberfest grub. Just be sure to buy your lederhosen one size up.</em></p> \n<h3>Left Hand Oktoberfest</h3> \n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\">\n <iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B2piPpQhtVf/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe>\n</div> \n<p><strong>Zachary Shore, bartender at <a href=\"https://www.thompsonhotels.com/hotels/washington/seattle/thompson-seattle/eat-and-drink/the-nest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The Nest</a> in Seattle</strong> </p> \n<p><em>My go-to Oktoberfest style beer is from Left Hand brewing out of Colorado. At 6.6 percent, it is one of the higher ABV Oktoberfests you can get, but make no mistake this beer drinks dry and crisp with subtle notes of biscuit and spice.</em></p> \n<h3>Rahr and Sons Oktoberfest</h3> \n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\">\n <iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CCWqpynBulo/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe>\n</div> \n<p><strong>Jeff Wood, creative director at <a href=\"https://rahrbrewing.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Rahr and Sons Brewing Co.</a> in Fort Worth, Texas</strong></p> \n<p><em>Rahr and Sons Brewing Co.’s Oktoberfest Märzen Lager is a traditional Märzen. It’s full-bodied, rich, and toasty with a malty sweetness and a balanced finish. It’s perfect for the fall. It’s not only award-winning — with accolades from the Great American Beer Festival, European Beer Star Awards, and more — but it’s proudly brewed in Fort Worth, Texas, by 5th and 6th generation brewers who come from a long line of beer-making that originally started in Germany.</em></p> \n<div class=\"feedflare\"> \n <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=Pl1YWpg06YQ:IYLl5twSf4k:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\" /></a> \n <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=Pl1YWpg06YQ:IYLl5twSf4k:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=Pl1YWpg06YQ:IYLl5twSf4k:V_sGLiPBpWU\" 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"Sylvan Esso’s Delightful Alternate ‘Ferris Wheel’ Video Was Made In ‘Animal Crossing’","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402536935","description":"<div class=\"upx-component upx-embed-url\"><div class=\"embed-holder\"><iframe src=\"//youtube.com/embed/3-NUC2enkl8\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\" allowfullscreen></iframe></div></div><p><a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/indie/sylvan-esso-tiny-desk/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Sylvan Esso</a>, the indie pop duo comprised of working couple Amelia Meath and Nick Sanborn, are gearing up for the release of their third studio record, <em><a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/indie/sylvan-esso-ferris-wheel-full-frontal-sam-bee/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Free Love</a></em>. So far, the duo have shared the singles &#8220;<a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/indie/sylvan-esso-rooftop-dancing-video/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Rooftop Dancing</a>&#8221; and &#8220;<a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/indie/sylvan-esso-ferris-wheel-free-love/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Ferris Wheel</a>&#8221; alongside vibrant videos. But since their upcoming album&#8217;s roll-out was hindered by quarantine, Sylvan Esso decided to jump on the <em>Animal Crossing</em> bandwagon and film an alternate video within the popular Nintendo Switch game.</p>\n<p>The video opens with a look at Meath&#8217;s <em>Animal Crossing</em> character. She explores her island&#8217;s carnival, passing by a cotton candy machine and old school arcade games. Meath is able to live vicariously through her character, performing on stage to an <em>Animal Crossing</em> crowd and even lighting up the sky with fireworks.</p>\n<p>In a recent <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/indie/sylvan-esso-interview-free-love/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">interview with Uproxx</a>, Meath and Sanborn talked about how getting into arguments actually facilitated their songwriting process and made them a stronger couple. “Arguing is so underrated,” Sanborn said. “As a Midwesterner, I think I avoided confrontation. I really appreciate Amelia bringing it into my life. We have to say when we don’t like stuff, because it forces you to defend your idea. And on top of that, our original band goal was exclusively to make music that both of us liked. And that inherently means we’re going to argue about stupid sh*t.”</p>\n<p>Watch the new &#8220;Ferris Wheel&#8221; video above.</p>\n<p><em>Free Love</em> is out on September 25 via Loma Vista. Get it <a title=\"\" href=\"https://music.apple.com/us/album/free-love/1521720336\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">here</a>.</p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a Droke","articleImgCdnMap":{"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=T_VrvN0EHPk:m0abwLV69hE:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn93@2020_6/2020/09/04/17-11-16-881_97f5425f56631417.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-18-942_f1234b5e3acb72a6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=T_VrvN0EHPk:m0abwLV69hE:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn24@2020_4/2020/09/04/17-11-15-492_f0c125e16e6c157a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/T_VrvN0EHPk":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599239462310},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"Letitia Wright Shares A Touching Visual Poem To Honor Her ‘Black Panther’ CO-Star Chadwick Boseman","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402534898","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1024\" height=\"450\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/letiti-wright-chadwick-boseman-top.jpg?w=1024&#38;h=450&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"\" loading=\"lazy\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/letiti-wright-chadwick-boseman-top.jpg 1024w,
