(min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Marvel</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p>The sibling bond between <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/tag/chadwick-boseman/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Chadwick Boseman</a>&#8216;s T&#8217;Challa and <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/tag/letitia-wright/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Letitia Wright</a>&#8216;s Shuri is one of the numerous highlights of <em><a href=\"https://uproxx.com/topic/black-panther/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Black Panther</a></em>, which presumably has a lot to do with the real-life bond that quickly formed between the two actors. As <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/chadwick-boseman-dead/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Boseman&#8217;s death</a> continues to reverberate around the world, Wright shared a personal and touching <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/tv/CEnRJPMBPT6/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">visual poem</a> on Instagram to honor the late actor.</p>\n<p>In the 5-minute video, Wright narrates over a series of nature photos and candid moments featuring Boseman as she expresses the shock of losing the man she immediately loved as a brother. In an emotional moment, Wright shares that she messaged Boseman a few times before his death, but assumed he was just busy. “I didn’t know you were dealing with so much. But against all the odds, you remained focused on fulfilling your purpose with the time handed to you,” Wright says. “God told me that you are my brother and that I am to love you as such. And I always did, and I always will.&#8221;</p>\n<p>You can watch Letitia Wright&#8217;s tribute to Chadwick Boseman below:</p>\n<div class=\"iframe-holder\">\n<blockquote class=\"instagram-media\" post shared by <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/letitiawright/?utm_source=ig_embed&#38;utm_campaign=loading\" style=\" color:#c9c8cd; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; font-style:normal; font-weight:normal; line-height:17px;\" target=\"_blank\"> letitiawright</a> (@letitiawright) on <time style=\" font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px;\" datetime=\"2020-09-02T00:16:27+00:00\">Sep 1, 2020 at 5:16pm PDT</time></p>\n</div>\n</blockquote>\n</div>\n<p>The instant connection between Boseman and Wright was also noted in <em>Black Panther</em> director <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/entertainment/ryan-coogler-tribute-chadwick-boseman-black-panther/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Ryan Coogler&#8217;s tribute</a> to Boseman who recalled the first time the actors met. While praising Boseman for coming to every audition for supporting roles, which most lead actors in major Hollywood movies don&#8217;t do, Coogler specifically remembered Wright&#8217;s ability to shatter Boseman&#8217;s defenses and break his stoic demeanor while in character.</p>\n<p>&#8220;He was there for several M’Baku auditions,&#8221; Coogler <a href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/black-panther-director-ryan-coogler-pens-emotional-beautiful-tribute-to-chadwick-boseman\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">wrote</a>. &#8220;In Winston Duke’s, he turned a chemistry read into a wrestling match. Winston broke his bracelet. In Letitia Wright’s audition for Shuri, she pierced his royal poise with her signature humor, and would bring about a smile to T’Challa’s face that was 100% Chad.&#8221;</p>\n<p>(Via <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/tv/CEnRJPMBPT6/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Letitia Wright on Instagram</a>)</p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 02 Sep 2020 17:47:23 +0000","feedId":6617,"bgimg":"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/letiti-wright-chadwick-boseman-top.jpg?w=1024&h=450&crop=1","linkMd5":"5eef2a91c57460174a1a3a42e631829c","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn53@2020_6/2020/09/04/17-11-02-593_45a19200740d50d1.webp","destWidth":1024,"destHeight":450,"sourceBytes":119700,"destBytes":119700,"author":"Mike Redmond","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/letiti-wright-chadwick-boseman-top.jpg?w=1024&h=450&crop=1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn53@2020_6/2020/09/04/17-11-02-593_45a19200740d50d1.webp","https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/13.0.0/72x72/1f54a.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn63@2020_1/2020/09/04/17-11-20-438_ceab68a89256551b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=5a-bL01hpKM:7N0GVAcJNM4:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn24@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-17-979_8fbad88a78ce6dac.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-18-942_f1234b5e3acb72a6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=5a-bL01hpKM:7N0GVAcJNM4:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn66@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-21-836_a8d524e39b66d4f0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/5a-bL01hpKM":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn5@2020_3/2020/09/04/17-11-21-361_ee958e26f9787029.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599239462321},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"Ranking The Best Craft Beers To Drink This Labor Day Weekend","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402537527","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1600\" height=\"495\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/craft-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?w=1600&#38;h=495&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"\" loading=\"lazy\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/craft-tfeat-uproxx.jpg 1600w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/craft-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=300,93 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/craft-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=650,201 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/craft-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=768,238 768w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/craft-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=1024,317 1024w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/craft-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=1536,475 1536w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) calc(100vw - 20px), (max-width: 1024px) calc(100vw - 40px), (min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">UPROXX</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/best-craft-beer-releases-september-2020/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Craft beer</a> has never been bigger. Even in the current climate, it remains fairly strong as many of us look for an escape from, well, everything. The <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/brooklyn-brewery-garrett-oliver-interview/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">craft beer</a> industry has been around long enough now that there are true classics on the shelf that are fairly easy to find nationwide. But what is the best craft <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/best-belgian-ales-according-to-experts/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">beer</a> to drink if you&#8217;re looking to move away from the macro brands? That&#8217;s a tougher question to answer.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/best-lagers-according-to-beer-experts/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Craft beer</a> is a very wide net to cast. There&#8217;s a lot going on from the classic West Coast <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/most-overrated-ipas/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">IPAs</a> from yesteryear to the tart sours of the 2020s. It really comes down to what you dig. But, we&#8217;d also argue that it&#8217;s worth expanding your knowledge and palate with new things. So, maybe the best beer for you is one you haven&#8217;t even tried yet. </p>\n<p>To figure out the best craft beers that people like to drink, we popped over to Ranker. <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/topic/according-to-the-masses/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The masses</a> spoke and voted and a <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.ranker.com/list/best-craft-beers/reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">top ten list</a> of craft beers emerged. Interestingly, most of these beers are throwbacks to the halcyon days of microbrewing.</p>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\"><strong>Related: <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/best-bbq-sauces-ranked-2020/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Ranking The Best BBQ Sauces Just In Time For Your Labor Day BBQ</a></strong></div>\n<h3>10. Pliny the Elder</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CEmuS5plP6m/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Style:</strong> Imperial IPA<br />\n<strong>ABV:</strong> 8%<br />\n<strong>Brewery:</strong> Russian River Brewing Company, Santa Rosa, CA</p>\n<p><strong>The Beer:</strong></p>\n<p>It doesn&#8217;t get much more classic than this West Coast IPA. The brew is hopped with a matrix of Amarillo, Centennial, CTZ, and Simcoe hops next to a fine malt. The result is the king of hoppy beers that&#8217;s surprisingly not higher on this list. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>Floral hops with a pine resin funk greet you. Notes of citrus cut through the resin dank as the florals support the light, bready malty underbelly. This is as dialed in as it gets. </p>\n<h3>9. A Little Sumpin’ Sumpin’</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B_H-CbhotdL/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Style:</strong> American IPA<br />\n<strong>ABV:</strong> 7.5%<br />\n<strong>Brewery:</strong> Lagunitas Brewing Company, Petaluma, CA</p>\n<p><strong>The Beer:</strong></p>\n<p>This Californian standard is brewed with half malted barley and half malted wheat. The brew is then hopped with (takes a deep breath) Willamette, Santiam, Amarillo, Cascade, Centennial, Chinook, and Columbus hops. The addition of wheat gives the beer a velvety texture that edges it towards a hefeweizen while still sitting squarely in IPA territory. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>Hops, hops, hops. There&#8217;s a grassy nature with plenty of that West Coast pine resin dankness. The sip then veers into sunny California beaches with a nice and subtle citrus nature with pleasant florals. The beer ends dry and full of that resinous dank. </p>\n<h3>8. Grapefruit Sculpin IPA</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/BpsjZK-ntBY/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Style:</strong> American IPA<br />\n<strong>ABV:</strong> 7%<br />\n<strong>Brewery:</strong> Ballast Point Brewing Company, San Diego, CA</p>\n<p><strong>The Beer:</strong></p>\n<p>This beer was a revelation when it dropped back in the day. The addition of actual grapefruit to an already fruity hopped beer added depth and accessibility to the often overwrought style. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>This is a fruit bomb in a bottle with tropical fruits, peaches, and citrus present throughout. The grapefruit is ever-present with a very distinct hint of saline. The beer ends with a rush of all that fruit, making it one of the most thirst-quenching beers on this list.</p>\n<h3>7. Boston Lager</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CEVdyjGjv6I/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Style:</strong> Vienna Lager<br />\n<strong>ABV:</strong> 5%<br />\n<strong>Brewery:</strong> Boston Beer Company, Jamaica Plain, MA</p>\n<p><strong>The Beer:</strong></p>\n<p>This is (kind of) the original craft beer. The brew is a simple blend of water, German hops, American barley, and Samuel Adam&#8217;s own lager yeast. The rest, as they say, is history. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>The ultimate airport beer opens with a clear hit of caramel malts next to grassy hops. The hops are an accent to the underlying maltiness and balance well. The end of the sip is dry and short but always draws you back for more. </p>\n<h3>6. Goose IPA</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CEpkXcQnLhE/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Style:</strong> English IPA<br />\n<strong>ABV:</strong> 5.9%<br />\n<strong>Brewery:</strong> Goose Island Beer Co., Chicago, IL</p>\n<p><strong>The Beer:</strong></p>\n<p>This Chicago IPA was brewed with the origins of IPA in mind. Back in the day, the English used to overly hop their ales for transport to, you guessed it, India. The India Pale Ale was born. The difference with the modern version, however, is that there&#8217;s very little time between brewing and quaffing IPAs, so the hoppiness has no time to fade as it would back in the days of old. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>Earthy and resinous hops mingle with big notes of tropical fruits that lean more sweet than fresh. Those big notes of citrus fruits lead the way as the bready malts remain buried under the hoppiness. A note of bitterness arrives late on the refreshing and dry finish. </p>\n<h3>5. Arrogant Bastard Ale</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/Bdk4a_hFlda/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Style:</strong> American Strong Ale<br />\n<strong>ABV:</strong> 7.2%<br />\n<strong>Brewery:</strong> Stone Brewing, Escondido, CA</p>\n<p><strong>The Beer:</strong></p>\n<p>The Arrogant Consortia, an offshoot of Stone Brewing, has been brewing this bombastic ale since the late 1990s. It&#8217;s well-hopped and helped define the San Diego craft beer scene. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>You can almost smell the pine dank before you crack one of these open and that&#8217;s the point. There&#8217;s a toffee-esque sweetness to the malts that just balances all the dank, bitterness, and citrus of this West Coast classic. </p>\n<h3>4. Sierra Nevada Stout</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CAaB-HXpvh6/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Style:</strong> American Stout<br />\n<strong>ABV:</strong> 5.8%<br />\n<strong>Brewery:</strong> Sierra Nevada Brewing Co., Chico, CA</p>\n<p><strong>The Beer:</strong></p>\n<p>It&#8217;s great to see Sierra Nevada&#8217;s Stout on this list and in the top five. This was the first beer they brewed all the way back in 1980. It&#8217;s one of the better stouts you can find in the U.S. to this day, making it the progenitor of decades of imitation. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>Roasted and bitter malts greet you with a sense of damn-near burnt espresso beans. The bitterness barely wanes as the hints of black licorice mingle with cacao nibs and velvety maltiness. The brew ends with a lingering sense of a full-bodied beer with serious depth (and milky chocolate). </p>\n<h3>3. Stone IPA</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B3VLVvRow85/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Style:</strong> American IPA<br />\n<strong>ABV:</strong> 6.9%<br />\n<strong>Brewery:</strong> Stone Brewing, Escondido, CA</p>\n<p><strong>The Beer:</strong></p>\n<p>This San Diego IPA is part of the reason IPAs are still brewed by pretty much every craft brewer, homebrewer, and macro brewer these days. Though there were plenty of other IPAs already hopping up the microbrewing scene for years before this one dropped in 1997, it definitely harkened in a new phase of craft brewing to the country. It&#8217;s also a solid example of the style that&#8217;s, thankfully, not overdone. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>This is the West Coast in a can. There&#8217;s a nice mix of pine dank next to sweet citrus juices. The juice leans more orange than anything else as the malts peek in with an almost sourdough crustiness. The bitterness from the hops is unavoidable through the juicy end of this beer. </p>\n<h3>2. Lagunitas IPA</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B74YDTMAgBR/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Style:</strong> American IPA<br />\n<strong>ABV:</strong> 6.2%<br />\n<strong>Brewery:</strong> Lagunitas Brewing Company, Petaluma, CA</p>\n<p><strong>The Beer:</strong></p>\n<p>This is another great example of the ol&#8217; West Coast IPA that helped bring the style to worldwide domination. This brew is crafted to balance loads of hops with a clean maltiness, making this a very crushable brew to have stocked in your fridge. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>The woodiness of the hops leans away from pine and into cedar territory with a citrus counterpoint. That citrus is more bitter grapefruit pith as the fruitiness gets a little peachy. The malts hold onto a caramelized sweetness with a bready edge that&#8217;s very under the radar. The sip ends with all that resin and fruit as the star of the show. </p>\n<h3>1. 90 Minute IPA</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/BL60X1gjOkl/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Style:</strong> Imperial IPA<br />\n<strong>ABV:</strong> 9%<br />\n<strong>Brewery:</strong> Dogfish Head Craft Brewery, Milton, DE</p>\n<p><strong>The Beer:</strong></p>\n<p>And then there&#8217;s Dogfish Head, another powerhouse of the 90&#8217;s craft beer evolution. This beer is named after the fact that it&#8217;s hopped for 90 straight minutes, adding some serious hoppiness to the malty foundation. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>Pine, orange rind, and malty bread mingle on the nose. Toffee sweetness creates a base on which florals flourish and mix with bright citrus and grassy dankness. The sip ends briskly with plenty of juice, resin, and subtle sweetness.</p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=M1Qcc-0Shsw:z-WO2ZehMLw:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a Johnston","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/craft-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?w=1600&h=495&crop=1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_1/2020/09/04/17-11-02-602_b42805db9edf123c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=M1Qcc-0Shsw:z-WO2ZehMLw:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn55@2020_3/2020/09/04/17-11-20-402_36ad3d8bf08a001b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-18-942_f1234b5e3acb72a6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=M1Qcc-0Shsw:z-WO2ZehMLw:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn14@2020_1/2020/09/04/17-11-19-360_ae59f3153cd39b49.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/M1Qcc-0Shsw":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn34@2020_3/2020/09/04/17-11-22-463_38e7d72b56362a79.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599239462308},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"Amazon’s ‘Welcome To The Blumhouse’ Trailer Is Here To Make Sure Halloween Happens This Year","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402534736","description":"<div class=\"upx-component upx-embed-url\"><div class=\"embed-holder\"><iframe src=\"//youtube.com/embed/DD5F0ets7ps?feature=youtu.be\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\" allowfullscreen></iframe></div></div><p>Halloween as we know it (parties, costumes, bars) probably shouldn&#8217;t happen this year for obvious reasons. However, Blumhouse Television and Amazon Studios have <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/welcome-to-the-blumhouse-amazon-october/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">teamed up</a> to bring Halloween to your living room &#8212; in the form of four horror movies. Beginning on October 6, Amazon Prime will start releasing these titles, so you can start feeding those spooky urges as the witching month heats up. They might be best enjoyed while pilfering through a mixed candy bag and chomping on Snickers, who knows? But skip the candy corn. That stuff is trash.</p>\n<p>Some recognizable faces, including Joey King in <em>The Lie</em>, pop up in the above trailer, as well as a new song by FJØRA, &#8220;What&#8217;s Up,&#8221; which was produced by the late 4 Non Blondes lead singer, Linda Perry (as a reimagining of Perry’s original version of the song). Here&#8217;s a list of all four movies:</p>\n<p>&#8211; <em>Black Box</em> (Oct. 6): A single father involved in a tragic car accident agrees to an experimental treatment that results in a terrifying identity crisis.</p>\n<p>&#8211; <em>The Lie</em> (Oct. 6): Two parents race to cover up the crime after their teenage daughter confesses that she killed her best friend. This, naturally, results in even more lies and deception.</p>\n<p>&#8211; <em>Evil Eye</em> (Oct 13): A mother grows convinced that her daughter&#8217;s boyfriend actually holds a dark connection to mom&#8217;s past. Uh-oh. </p>\n<p>&#8211; <em>Nocturne</em> (Oct 13): An elite music academy becomes an unsettling setting when a mysterious notebook (belonging to a dead student) invigorates a timid girl&#8217;s practice.</p>\n<p>Blumhouse rarely swings and misses, so this is promising news for those Saturday nights when big Halloween gatherings won&#8217;t be such a good idea in 2020. Stay safe everyone, and pop some popcorn for a few double features.</p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=ZULJh1aYmd0:wDj8NhFI9zs:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=ZULJh1aYmd0:wDj8NhFI9zs:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=ZULJh1aYmd0:wDj8NhFI9zs:7Q72WNTAKBA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA\" src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=ZULJh1aYmd0:wDj8NhFI9zs:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/ZULJh1aYmd0\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 02 Sep 2020 16:44:19 +0000","feedId":6617,"bgimg":"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs","linkMd5":"73cbed39a48528d8e51000d9fc49dd1e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","destWidth":113,"destHeight":24,"sourceBytes":1072,"destBytes":460,"author":"Kimberly Ricci","articleImgCdnMap":{"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=ZULJh1aYmd0:wDj8NhFI9zs:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn91@2020_4/2020/09/04/17-11-20-563_220af44149ee1264.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-18-942_f1234b5e3acb72a6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=ZULJh1aYmd0:wDj8NhFI9zs:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn92@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-16-516_ea1fefbb27c25c7f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/ZULJh1aYmd0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn58@2020_6/2020/09/04/17-11-21-733_3728cdb1265a6216.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599239462319},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"Start Fall Off On A Spicy Note With These Bartender Approved Rye Whiskeys","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402533129","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1600\" height=\"495\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/rye-tfeat-uproxx-1.jpg?w=1600&#38;h=495&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"\" loading=\"lazy\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/rye-tfeat-uproxx-1.jpg 1600w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/rye-tfeat-uproxx-1.jpg?resize=300,93 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/rye-tfeat-uproxx-1.jpg?resize=650,201 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/rye-tfeat-uproxx-1.jpg?resize=768,238 768w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/rye-tfeat-uproxx-1.jpg?resize=1024,317 1024w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/rye-tfeat-uproxx-1.jpg?resize=1536,475 1536w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) calc(100vw - 20px), (max-width: 1024px) calc(100vw - 40px), (min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Two James/Old Forester/Russell&#039;s Reserve/Lot 40/Unsplash/Uproxx</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p>As the summer end and <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/warming-scotches-fall-2020/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">fall</a> begins, those humid, hot days make way for crisp, cool evenings perfectly suited for the subtle pepper spiciness of a well-made <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/best-bottles-of-rye-for-under-30/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">rye whiskey</a>. Some would argue that <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/ryes-whiskey-summer-2020/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">rye</a> is the &#8220;spice of life&#8221; you need just at this moment. </p>\n<p>In recent years, rye whiskey has become increasingly popular yet again. Rye used to be the main whiskey distilled in America way back in the day but then history happened. Anyway, this newfound popularity means that there are now countless brands available. To find the right fit for you, we decided to ask the professionals. We tasked some of our <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/topic/bartenders-tell-us/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">favorite bartenders</a> with telling us the best rye whiskeys to make your first sips of fall peppery and spicy. </p>\n<h3>Michter’s Rye</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CADcsxkHy_D/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Anthony Aviles, general manager of <a href=\"http://www.ritzcarlton.com/en/hotels/florida/sarasota/dining/jack-dusty?scid=bb1a189a-fec3-4d19-a255-54ba596febe2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Jack Dusty</a> in Sarasota, Florida</strong></p>\n<p><em>Michter’s Rye has enough smokiness to enjoy with a good cigar (if you’re into that sort of thing) without overpowering it. Yet, the juice carries enough complexity to truly be enjoyed while the sun sets. It doesn’t have the same burn/bite that most whiskeys do, which is something I can appreciate during those 90-degree Florida summer nights.</em></p>\n<h3>Lot 40 Rye</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CC5ncWMnDGp/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Meredith Barry, executive beverage chef of <a href=\"https://www.angadartshotel.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Angad Arts Hotel</a> in St. Louis</strong></p>\n<p><em>I fell in love with Lot 40 Rye a few years ago. It’s a 100 percent rye mash bill from Canada that&#8217;s distilled in a single copper pot. It&#8217;s great for cocktails, from a sazerac to even a fruity cobbler. The rye spice is persistent on the palate as well as vanilla, cardamom, and the earthy green notes from the virgin oak. It&#8217;s just damn delicious. </em></p>\n<h3>Old Forester 100 Proof Rye</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B7FRLuJn9c5/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Benjamin Burch, bartender at <a href=\"https://thenolenrooftop.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The Nolen</a> in San Diego</strong></p>\n<p><em>I&#8217;d love to pick a local craft distillery here, but I&#8217;m just not convinced they&#8217;ve quite caught up to the big distillers. Brands selling MGP stuff are still putting out phenomenal whiskeys. But, I have to go with Old Forester 100 proof Rye. It is insanely affordable and just brings everything I want out of a rye whiskey. It&#8217;s got enough vanilla and caramel sweetness but also has those nice big spice notes and the higher proof just makes better cocktails. If I&#8217;m making an old fashioned or a Manhattan, this is the whiskey I&#8217;m reaching for.</em> </p>\n<h3>Two James Catcher’s Rye</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/BBkol2hHh39/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Rebecah Hunter, bartender at <a href=\"https://monarchclubdetroit.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The Monarch Club</a> in Detroit</strong> </p>\n<p><em>If you’re interested in thinking local, then you’ll enjoy knowing that this rye is distilled from 100 percent Michigan grown rye and made with the freshwater of the Great Lakes. Although it has no color, it provides your tongue with spice and notes of fig.</em></p>\n<h3>Oregon Spirit Rye</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CCjU48khrA8/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Eva Al-Gharaballi, bartender at <a href=\"https://datztampa.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Datz</a> in St. Petersburg, Florida</strong> </p>\n<p><em>Oregon Spirit Rye Whiskey is my choice of rye to drink. With hints of clove, honey, cinnamon, and ginger, this award-winning rye has a smooth start with a traditional wheat finish.</em></p>\n<h3>High West Double Rye</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B-QS9iqnYZv/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Tommy Ergle, bar manager at <a href=\"https://drbbqs.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Dr. BBQ</a> in St. Petersburg, Florida</strong> </p>\n<p><em>One of our go-to rye whiskeys here at Dr. BBQ is High West’s Double Rye. The High West Double Rye has a great spicy-meets-sweet flavor that gives it an early summertime taste with a strong, mellow finish. The perfect rye to sip on at the end of a hot summer day.</em></p>\n<h3>Savage &#38; Cooke Lip Service Rye</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B6woDR-n25X/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Jerry Shaffer, food and beverage manager at <a href=\"https://www.hilton.com/en/hotels/napvles-embassy-suites-napa-valley/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Embassy Suites Napa</a> in Napa, California</strong> </p>\n<p><em>I&#8217;m going with Lip Service because of its intense nose orange peel, clove, candied ginger, creamy and velvety flavors.</em></p>\n<h3>Pikesville Rye</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/BomjgVtgGAc/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Jeremy Allen, bartender at <a href=\"http://www.minibarhollywood.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">MiniBar</a> in Los Angeles</strong></p>\n<p><em>The bottle I&#8217;ve been recommending to people &#8212; when you can&#8217;t find Willett &#8212; is Pikesville 6 Year 110 proof. It&#8217;s a little bit older and more developed than Rittenhouse. It&#8217;s strong enough for bartenders or would-be tough guys, mellow enough for bourbon drinkers, and complex enough for sophisticates.</em></p>\n<h3>WhistlePig PiggyBack Rye</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CAf2a_MgCgG/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Hayden Miller, head bartender at <a href=\"https://www.bodegataqueria.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Bodega Taqueria y Tequila</a> in Miami</strong></p>\n<p><em>Whiskey lovers owe a lot to Dave Pickerell, not just this killer bottle. With a full rye mash bill for the spice and bottling just under 100 proof for the strength, it makes great cocktails. It&#8217;s also perfect to toast some old pals, no matter the occasion.</em></p>\n<h3>Rittenhouse Rye</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CEE3e9Mns02/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Damian Langarica, head bartender at <a href=\"https://www.akitchenandbar.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">a.bar</a> in Philadelphia</strong></p>\n<p><em>How can I not choose Rittenhouse Rye? I live in Philly and the bar that I work at is in the corner of Rittenhouse Square. But besides that, it is a &#8220;must-have&#8221; rye whiskey to have at your home bar. It&#8217;s a very versatile rye. You can either get creative with it in a cocktail or enjoy it neat.</em></p>\n<h3>Willett Family Estate Rye</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CEIjxAVJyh1/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Emmanuelle Massicot, beverage director of <a href=\"https://www.katarobata.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Kata Robata</a> in Houston</strong></p>\n<p><em>While it’s great for Manhattans and old fashioneds, you’re probably going to want to sip on this one over a few ice cubes.</em> </p>\n<h3>Knob Creek Rye</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CD225WxAXR4/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Marta De La Cruz Marrero, food and beverage supervisor of <a href=\"https://www.ritzcarlton.com/en/hotels/florida/fort-lauderdale/dining/burlock-coast-seafare-spirits\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Burlock Coast</a> in Fort Lauderdale, Florida</strong></p>\n<p><em>Knob Creek rye whiskey is a smooth rye whiskey with bold rye spiciness with undertones of vanilla and oak with expansive notes of herbs and rye with nuances of oak.</em></p>\n<h3>Journeyman Last Feather Rye</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B7yxvRqn0s9/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Stephen Potter, lead bartender at <a href=\"https://amwaygrand.com/dining/the-kitchen-by-wolfgang-puck\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The Kitchen by Wolfgang Puck</a> in Grand Rapids, Michigan</strong></p>\n<p><em>This is an easy one, Journeyman Distillery Last Feather Rye. I love the pepper and spice of the rye. Balanced with the sweetness of the wheat and some notes of banana to make it a nice easy drink.</em></p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=JKlNYI4-kjk:qA4h6TGztbU:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=JKlNYI4-kjk:qA4h6TGztbU:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=JKlNYI4-kjk:qA4h6TGztbU:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=JKlNYI4-kjk:qA4h6TGztbU:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=JKlNYI4-kjk:qA4h6TGztbU:7Q72WNTAKBA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=JKlNYI4-kjk:qA4h6TGztbU:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=JKlNYI4-kjk:qA4h6TGztbU:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/JKlNYI4-kjk\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 03 Sep 2020 01:00:00 +0000","feedId":6617,"bgimg":"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/rye-tfeat-uproxx-1.jpg?w=1600&h=495&crop=1","linkMd5":"119aac19c6f0c6d5b9b8a6b3b62efb97","destWidth":1600,"destHeight":495,"sourceBytes":546904,"destBytes":546904,"author":"christopherosburn","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/rye-tfeat-uproxx-1.jpg?w=1600&h=495&crop=1":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=JKlNYI4-kjk:qA4h6TGztbU:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn26@2020_4/2020/09/04/17-11-17-212_736a917d9deafcf1.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-18-942_f1234b5e3acb72a6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=JKlNYI4-kjk:qA4h6TGztbU:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn61@2020_1/2020/09/04/17-11-19-848_d18d856ced7cbc34.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/JKlNYI4-kjk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn95@2020_6/2020/09/04/17-11-18-519_be45bba0d30b6e10.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599239462320},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"‘Mulan’ Updates Its Story For A Slightly Older Audience And Its Battle Scenes Are Dynamite","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402532375","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"710\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mulan-grid-uproxx.jpg?w=710&#38;h=400&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"\" loading=\"lazy\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mulan-grid-uproxx.jpg 710w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mulan-grid-uproxx.jpg?resize=300,169 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mulan-grid-uproxx.jpg?resize=650,366 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mulan-grid-uproxx.jpg?resize=150,85 150w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mulan-grid-uproxx.jpg?resize=328,185 328w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mulan-grid-uproxx.jpg?resize=387,218 387w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mulan-grid-uproxx.jpg?resize=460,259 460w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mulan-grid-uproxx.jpg?resize=196,110 196w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) calc(100vw - 20px), (max-width: 1024px) calc(100vw - 40px), (min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p><em>Mulan</em> becomes the latest live action remake of Disney animated canon. When <em>The Lion King</em> came out last year there was a lot of talk about if it was necessary or not (the overwhelming majority of movies aren’t “necessary” so I guess the answer is “probably not”) even though I wound up quite enjoying it. (Though, a big reason <em>why</em> I enjoyed <em>The Lion King</em> is because I wound up at a “family” screening, which was filled with children, instead of the normal critics screening. And their enjoyment was infectious. Add that to the list of why I miss movie theaters, even though there’s no way I’d go to one right now.) But I at least sort of get the argument that it was too faithful to the source material, so what’s the point if it’s not going to be reimagined at all? (Well, other than the $1.6 billion It made, which certainly classifies as “a point.”)</p>\n<p>Unlike <em>The Lion King</em>, Niki Caro&#8217;s <em>Mulan</em> is a more reimagined version of the 1998 original film. The original film was rated G, is filled with music, and is truly something that can be defined as a family film. This new version has no musical performances, is rated PG-13 (and earns that rating) and is more aimed at the “young adult” market. (Two friends of mine asked if it would be suitable for their children. When asked about a four-year old, I said, “no.” When asked about a ten-year-old, I said, “probably.”) There are some pretty intense battle scenes for a “family” movie where our hero, Mulan (Liu Yifei), stabs and impales a few villains. It’s a bloodless fight, but still. </p>\n<p>After a brazen attack by enemy forces, the local government declares each family must provide one male to fight in the army to defend against these attacks. Hua Xiu (Tzi Ma) was once a great warrior, but he’s getting old and has an injured leg, but he also has two daughters, so he will do his duty and fight. His oldest daughter, Mulan, steals his battle gear and shows up instead, disguising herself (not very convincingly, but whatever) as a man and joins the fight. She fights bravely and saves her battalion, but her ruse (not surprisingly) is discovered and she’s banished. And that’s where Mulan’s adventures come to a close as the end credits roll. (That last sentence is a lie.)</p>\n<p>As I mentioned before, I wouldn’t call <em>Mulan</em> ultra-violent by any means, at least compared to other PG-13 movies. But if you’re a big fan of the original movie and want to show this to someone on the younger side, you may want to judge for yourself first. There are scenes of swords, spears, and arrows all impaling bad people in the chest. Again, the tone here seems to be aimed at the young adult market. </p>\n<p>But I guess the big question here is, “is <em>Mulan</em> worth $30?” Well, first, that’s between you and your god. I will say I wound up enjoying this film quite a bit, and even more than I thought I would. More than I thought I would because the battle scenes are so well choreographed and performed. Instead of muddled CGI, everything is crisp and clear and very well done. And in these scenes <em>Mulan</em> borrows a bit from films like <em>The Matrix</em> and <em>Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon</em>. </p>\n<p>But $30 is an interesting price point for something like this and can be looked at a few different ways. On one hand, a person has access to an almost endless supply of classic films they’ve probably never seen that, at worst, might cost $3.99 to rent. So upping that to $30 is a big jump. But it is a <em>new</em> movie. And a <em>big</em> new movie at that. And here in New York City at least, between a ticket, a soda, and some sort of food item, I’ve spent $30 on a movie plenty of times. So that price, in that respect, doesn’t seem <em>too</em> unreasonable, even by yourself. </p>\n<p>But if a person has a family, this starts to feel like a bargain. A big thing to me when discussing these price points is, “do I get to own the movie or not?” I’ve said in the past I’d pay $40 to watch <em>Tenet</em> at home right now as long as I got some promise of a permanent digital file down the line without having to purchase it again. And with <em>Mulan</em> you do get that. As long as you subscribe to Disney+, <em>Mulan</em> is forever a part of your library. If a person has a family and members of that family want to watch it a few times, it’s really a bargain. So, $30 for a brand new movie that was going to be a blockbuster in theaters, and you don’t lose access to the movie, this all seems about right to me. But, <em>your</em> mileage may vary. But, for me (no, I didn’t have to pay for it, so keep that in mind), it felt legitimately <em>fun</em> to watch. It wasn’t <em>quite</em> the feeling you get in a theater, but it just felt good to watch a new <em>huge</em> would-have-been-a-blockbuster movie, even at home.</p>\n<p><em>You can contact Mike Ryan <a href=\"http://twitter.com/mikeryan\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">directly on Twitter.</a></em></p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=vuZ05jtEnA4:cHRFLawMhk8:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"The ‘Sh*thouse’ Trailer Tells A Familiar College Romance In An Endearing New Way","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402534873","description":"<div class=\"upx-component upx-embed-url\"><div class=\"embed-holder\"><iframe src=\"//youtube.com/embed/PkA7m1DbeH8?feature=emb_title\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\" allowfullscreen></iframe></div></div><p>It&#8217;s not the same thing as a fancy in-person world premiere, complete with a red carpet and photographers screaming &#8220;over here! over here!&#8221; at celebrities, but <em>Shithouse</em> had its digital world premiere at this year&#8217;s called South by Southwest, where <a href=\"https://deadline.com/2020/06/ifc-films-acquires-sxsw-shithouse-1202955370/\">it won</a> the Grand Jury Prize for Best Narrative. The college romance was written and directed by Cooper Raiff, who also stars as a college freshman who&#8217;s having a tough time adjusting to his new life away from home. But then he meets a sophomore played by Dylan Gelula (Xanthippe from <em>Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt</em>!). They quickly become friends until things get complicated after — you know where this is going — they sleep together. </p>\n<p>The plot may sound familiar, but as <em>IndieWire</em>&#8216;s David Ehrlich writes in <a href=\"https://www.indiewire.com/2020/03/shithouse-review-sxsw-1202217200/\">his glowing review</a>, &#8220;Here’s the catch: It’s good. Like, really good. And more than that, it somehow feels completely singular despite its lo-fi approach and even lower-concept premise.&#8221; I would also accept, &#8220;<em>Sh*thouse</em>? More like, not a sh*tty movie!&#8221; as a review.</p>\n<blockquote><p>Alex (Cooper Raiff) is a lonely, friendless college freshman who is seriously contemplating transferring to a college closer to his mom and sister, to whom he is still extremely tethered. Everything changes one night when Alex takes a leap and attends a party at his campus&#8217; party house &#8220;Shithouse,&#8221; where he forges a strong connection with his RA, Maggie (Dylan Gelula).</p></blockquote>\n<p><em>Shithouse</em> opens in theaters and debuts on VOD on October 16.</p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a Kurp","articleImgCdnMap":{"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=6IahjP6PNDU:FcbGfOXmBFM:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn50@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-21-151_e1a561b168d248ac.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-18-942_f1234b5e3acb72a6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=6IahjP6PNDU:FcbGfOXmBFM:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn9@2020_1/2020/09/04/17-11-20-041_5c10701babc853f6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/6IahjP6PNDU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn69@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-18-986_2402387993227a02.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599239462322},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"A Secret, Mini Burning Man Is Apparently Happening In Black Rock City This Weekend","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402537669","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1600\" height=\"495\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/burningman-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?w=1600&#38;h=495&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"\" loading=\"lazy\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/burningman-tfeat-uproxx.jpg 1600w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/burningman-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=300,93 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/burningman-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=650,201 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/burningman-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=768,238 768w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/burningman-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=1024,317 1024w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/burningman-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=1536,475 1536w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) calc(100vw - 20px), (max-width: 1024px) calc(100vw - 40px), (min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Getty</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p>Burning Man has officially <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/burning-man-2020-canceled/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">gone digital</a> this year, but deep down we always knew that some small portion of Burners were never going to be satisfied with a digital burn. So we can&#8217;t say we&#8217;re surprised to hear that since last weekend, several Burners have been flocking to the Black Rock Desert for an unofficial and socially distanced erecting of Black Rock City, pandemic be damned. </p>\n<p>Local Reno news station <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.ktvn.com/story/42577528/no-place-like-the-playa-burners-head-to-the-desert-despite-burning-man-cancellation\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><em>KTVN</em></a>, the <em>Reno Gazette</em>, and <em><a title=\"\" href=\"https://mynews4.com/news/local/burning-man-or-bust-hundreds-head-to-black-rock-city\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">NBC4</a></em> all report that &#8220;hundreds&#8221; of people have been arriving in the Black Rock Desert playa since last weekend with all the usual <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/photos-burning-man-2019/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Burning Man staples</a> in tow, including RVs, campers, mutant freak vehicles, and art installations. The Burners plan to leave after Labor Day Weekend. </p>\n<p>The state of Nevada seems pretty down for the impromptu gathering, including the local businesses that have been especially hard hit by the damages of the pandemic, and usually rely on the heavy foot traffic that Burning Man brings. According to one Burner, Mark Fowler, who spoke to <em><a title=\"\" href=\"https://mynews4.com/news/local/burning-man-or-bust-hundreds-head-to-black-rock-city\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">NBC4</a></em>, &#8220;We were worried at first coming out here, we heard the Bureau of Land Management may block people from getting out here, but that wasn&#8217;t the case.&#8221; In fact, the Bureau of Land Management (BLM) along with the Washoe and Pershing County Sheriff&#8217;s offices and local tribes have given Burners official permission for their camping zones and will be monitoring the playa over the weekend in case of an emergency. </p>\n<p>According to the <em><a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.rgj.com/story/life/arts/burning-man/2020/09/01/burning-man-black-rock-desert-record-weather-labor-day-weekend/5686404002/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Reno Gazette</a></em>, visitors have been advised by Nevada&#8217;s BLM to bring water, food, shade, lights for their camp, and supplies to last their entire stay, probably so Burners won&#8217;t pose a risk to the local community. Currently, Nevada has counted 70,319 cases of COVID-19 and has been on a sharp downward trajectory of cases since late July. The state is currently in <a title=\"\" href=\"https://nvhealthresponse.nv.gov/info/travelers-visitors/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Phase 2</a> of reopening and has a pretty relaxed policy on social distancing and gatherings. According to the <a title=\"\" href=\"https://nvhealthresponse.nv.gov/info/event-organizers/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Nevada Health Response</a>, &#8220;When it comes to gatherings, the risk is not just based on how many people there are, but rather how closely they are gathered and how they are interacting with each other.&#8221;</p>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CEuG3RLHhCd/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/culture/spring-breakers-coronavirus/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Unlike spring breakers</a> at the start of the pandemic or <a href=\"https://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/wireStory/covid-19-death-tied-sturgis-rally-reported-minnesota-72777302\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Sturgis bikers</a> last month, Burners seem pretty conscious of the dangers of COVID-19 exposure. &#8216;Bureaucracy,&#8217; one of this weekend&#8217;s event organizers told <em><a title=\"\" href=\"https://mynews4.com/news/local/burning-man-or-bust-hundreds-head-to-black-rock-city\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">NBC4</a></em>, &#8220;People made the decision to come here during a global pandemic. So we decided to keep people&#8217;s camps 200 feet away from one another and to advise wearing masks when meeting others. If people feel safe, they then should make others feel safe.&#8221; Burners it seems, are pretty accepting of the changes, &#8220;It&#8217;s just like asking somebody, &#8216;hey is one burn better than the next?&#8217; The answer is no. It&#8217;s just another chapter in our book,&#8221; Burner Mark Debbie told <em><a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.ktvn.com/story/42577528/no-place-like-the-playa-burners-head-to-the-desert-despite-burning-man-cancellation\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">KTVN</a></em>. </p>\n<p>While Burners are optimistic and aware that putting themselves in possible danger is their own choice, any type of travel increases the risk of COVID-19 transmission. Peter &#8216;Happy Mentor&#8217; a middle school English teacher and Burner who talked to KTVN remarked on the use of masks when venturing into town, saying &#8220;We want to keep people in the town healthy and we&#8217;re trying to abide by the rules and have a good time,&#8221; but acknowledged that a lot of Burners aren&#8217;t wearing face coverings out on the playa, where temperatures are expected to tip into triple digits this weekend. </p>\n<p>While this is likely to be one of the most interesting and crunchy &#8220;Burning Mans&#8221; of all time &#8212; what are people going to do with their poop?! &#8212; we&#8217;d rather take our chances with <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/burning-man-2020-canceled/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">the digital experience</a>, where our own private bathrooms are just a few steps away.</p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=C5pNtPBHQIE:r5ANraS2jnI:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=C5pNtPBHQIE:r5ANraS2jnI:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=C5pNtPBHQIE:r5ANraS2jnI:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=C5pNtPBHQIE:r5ANraS2jnI:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" Birthday","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402536536","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/style/20-best-nike-air-max-90s-of-all-time/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Air Max 90s</a>, the 25th anniversary of the <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/style/ranking-best-jordan-colorways/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Air Jordan 11</a>, and the 40th anniversary <em><a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/style/where-to-buy-boba-fett-adidas-top-ten-hi/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Empire Strikes Back</a></em> Adidas series, 2020 has been one hell of a year for anniversary sneaker collections, and now PUMA is adding one more to the list with their <em>Super Mario 64</em> inspired RS-Dreamer. Made as part of Nintendo&#8217;s <a href=\"https://twitter.com/NintendoAmerica/status/1301505239930089473?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">35th-anniversary celebration</a> of the Mario franchise, the J-Cole signature shoe pretty much looks like Mario in sneaker form. </p>\n<figure id=\"402536828\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-402536828\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/20AW_PR_BB_RSD-Mario_64-005_RGB.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"650\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/20AW_PR_BB_RSD-Mario_64-005_RGB.jpg 3600w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/20AW_PR_BB_RSD-Mario_64-005_RGB.jpg?resize=300,240 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/20AW_PR_BB_RSD-Mario_64-005_RGB.jpg?resize=650,520 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/20AW_PR_BB_RSD-Mario_64-005_RGB.jpg?resize=768,614 768w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/20AW_PR_BB_RSD-Mario_64-005_RGB.jpg?resize=1024,819 1024w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/20AW_PR_BB_RSD-Mario_64-005_RGB.jpg?resize=1536,1229 1536w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/20AW_PR_BB_RSD-Mario_64-005_RGB.jpg?resize=2048,1638 2048w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/20AW_PR_BB_RSD-Mario_64-005_RGB.jpg?resize=1920,1536 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 3600px) 100vw, 3600px\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">PUMA</span></figcaption></figure>\n<p>While we have to admit that we&#8217;re a little disappointed in the lack of denim &#8212; a missed opportunity on PUMA&#8217;s part. We&#8217;re absolutely shocked that this is pretty tastefully done. The Super Mario branding on the tongue doesn&#8217;t feel at all intrusive, and the midsole gradient detailing and mixed suede and mesh upper subtlely suggest the iconography of Mario, rather than <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/style/adidas-darth-vader-sneaker-where-to-buy/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">hit you over the head</a> with Nintendo imagery. We could totally see Seinfeld rocking a pair of these in an episode of <em>Comedians in Cars</em> if he didn&#8217;t always opt for Nikes. </p>\n<p>Despite the cross-brand promotion, the RS-Dreamer Super Mario 64 is still built with performance in mind and features a disruptive cord lacing system, giving the wearer a snug and highly responsive fit that is complemented by the RS-Foam heel and ProFoam midsole which provide comfortability and maximum energy return on the court. </p>\n<p>The RS-Dreamer Super Mario 64 is set to make an on-court appearance soon in both the NBA and WNBA. Though, we&#8217;re in luck as it will hit retailers much sooner. The PUMA RS-Dreamer is set to drop on September 4th for a retail price of $125. Pick up a pair at <a title=\"\" href=\"https://us.puma.com/en/us/collections/basketball/rs-dreamer\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">PUMA</a>, <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.footlocker.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Footlocker</a>, and select PUMA retailers.</p>\n<figure id=\"402536833\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-402536833\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/20AW_PR_BB_RSD-Mario_64-002_RGB.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"650\" OqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn25@2020_4/2020/09/04/17-11-22-464_c99a0b7ea7650ae0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/w-40oiRtYik":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn69@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-23-332_b03e65c57d1a33a3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599239462309},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"Adidas Is Dropping A Darth Vader Sneaker To Celebrate The 40th Anniversary Of ‘Empire Strikes Back’","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402535367","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1600\" height=\"495\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/darthv-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?w=1600&#38;h=495&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"\" loading=\"lazy\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/darthv-tfeat-uproxx.jpg 1600w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/darthv-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=300,93 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/darthv-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=650,201 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/darthv-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=768,238 768w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/darthv-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=1024,317 1024w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/darthv-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=1536,475 1536w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) calc(100vw - 20px), (max-width: 1024px) calc(100vw - 40px), (min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Uproxxx</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p>Following last week&#8217;s reveal of the <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/style/where-to-buy-boba-fett-adidas-top-ten-hi/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Boba Fett Adidas Top Ten Hi</a>, Adidas has revealed the latest addition to its group of silhouettes celebrating the 40th Anniversary of the <em>Empire Strikes Back</em>, The Darth Vader Superstar. Oh wait, no sorry, they&#8217;re not actually called the <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/hitfix/darth-vader-idiot/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Darth Vader</a> Superstar, Adidas has chosen to oddly dub these kicks &#8220;Superstar Star Wars Shoes.&#8221; Last week&#8217;s release was officially named the &#8220;Top Ten Hi Boba Fett.&#8221; But these? They get the generic name. </p>\n<p>That&#8217;s probably because, while both the Darth Vader Superstar and the Boba Fett would&#8217;ve never made it on our <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/style/where-to-buy-jordan-1-bio-hack/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">weekly roundup of the best sneakers</a>. The Vaders aren&#8217;t nearly as cool as the Fetts. The Fetts were full of small fan-servicey details that reflected their namesake in a really cool way &#8212; they even came with a pouch! But the Vader Superstar does little to reflect the sith lord they&#8217;re named after aside from dress the sneaker in matte black leather. </p>\n<p>Admittedly, we do like the stitching on the upper and the reflective three-stripes that are meant to resemble the lines and detailing in Vader&#8217;s suit. But, we would&#8217;ve liked to see Adidas lean more into functional design details rather than using more obvious signifiers like the imperial insignia on the heel tab, or the tongue portrait of Vader. </p>\n<figure id=\"402536462\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-402536462\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Superstar_Star_Wars_Shoes_Black_FX9302_011_hover_standard.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"650\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Superstar_Star_Wars_Shoes_Black_FX9302_011_hover_standard.jpg 840w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Superstar_Star_Wars_Shoes_Black_FX9302_011_hover_standard.jpg?resize=300,300 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Superstar_Star_Wars_Shoes_Black_FX9302_011_hover_standard.jpg?resize=650,650 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Superstar_Star_Wars_Shoes_Black_FX9302_011_hover_standard.jpg?resize=768,768 768w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Superstar_Star_Wars_Shoes_Black_FX9302_011_hover_standard.jpg?resize=550,550 550w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Superstar_Star_Wars_Shoes_Black_FX9302_011_hover_standard.jpg?resize=470,470 470w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 840px) 100vw, 840px\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Adidas</span></figcaption></figure>\n<p>In another head-scratching move, Adidas also replaced the Superstar&#8217;s iconic shell toe with a toe box shaped like Darth Vader&#8217;s mask and helmet. Finally, the &#8220;Superstar Star Wars Shoes&#8221; feature translucent outsoles revealing the words &#8220;I Am Your Father.&#8221; Which, sure, is no doubt the most iconic line from <em>Empire Strikes Back</em>, but to print it on the bottom of a shoe? Hilarious.</p>\n<p>It&#8217;s a shame that of the full collection, which has so far featured a Luke Skywalker Stan Smith, Stormtrooper NMD R1, Lando Calrissian NMD RI V2, and a Boba Fest Top Ten Hi, the Darth Vader Superstar &#8212; ahem Superstar Star Wars Shoes &#8212; are the weakest by far. </p>\n<p>Vader deserved better than this. He killed the Emperor! <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/star-wars-rise-of-the-skywalker-review/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Oh, wait</a>&#8230;</p>\n<p>The Darth Vader Superstar is set to drop on September 17th for a retail price of $120. Pick up a pair at the <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.adidas.com/us/superstar-star-wars-shoes/FX9302.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Adidas webstore</a>. </p>\n<figure id=\"402536463\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-402536463\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Superstar_Star_Wars_Shoes_Black_FX9302_01_standard.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"650\" +0000","feedId":6617,"bgimg":"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/darthv-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?w=1600&h=495&crop=1","linkMd5":"07a0cd01523503e44158384404321174","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn29@2020_6/2020/09/04/17-11-02-892_5f5a6dd8bf74cd52.webp","destWidth":1600,"destHeight":495,"sourceBytes":330040,"destBytes":330040,"author":"daneriveralpc","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/darthv-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?w=1600&h=495&crop=1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn29@2020_6/2020/09/04/17-11-02-892_5f5a6dd8bf74cd52.webp","https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Superstar_Star_Wars_Shoes_Black_FX9302_011_hover_standard.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn58@2020_3/2020/09/04/17-11-19-057_e3042b59de7d862c.webp","https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Superstar_Star_Wars_Shoes_Black_FX9302_01_standard.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn49@2020_3/2020/09/04/17-11-19-014_afd6695241f0c760.webp","https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Superstar_Star_Wars_Shoes_Black_FX9302_43_detail.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn99@2020_3/2020/09/04/17-11-16-552_1745a71912cd8b6a.webp","https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Superstar_Star_Wars_Shoes_Black_FX9302_41_detail.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn47@2020_4/2020/09/04/17-11-18-017_6b2abd40c4d90b3a.webp","https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Superstar_Star_Wars_Shoes_Black_FX9302_03_standard.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn31@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-15-498_ec94d92fec666a0c.webp","https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Superstar_Star_Wars_Shoes_Black_FX9302_05_standard.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn19@2020_1/2020/09/04/17-11-16-547_e274f92f6476a4e6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","http://feeds.feed 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"People Are Sharing Their Favorite Keanu Reeves Stories In Honor Of His Birthday","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402535469","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1024\" height=\"450\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/keanu-reeves-top.jpg?w=1024&#38;h=450&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"keanu reeves\" loading=\"lazy\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/keanu-reeves-top.jpg 1024w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/keanu-reeves-top.jpg?resize=300,132 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/keanu-reeves-top.jpg?resize=650,286 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/keanu-reeves-top.jpg?resize=768,338 768w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) calc(100vw - 20px), (max-width: 1024px) calc(100vw - 40px), (min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Getty Image</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p>On Wednesday, September 2, 2020, Keanu Reeves turned 56 years young — and we use the word “young,” not “old” because he still looks better than most people in their 30s. The actor and <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/viral/keanu-reeves-photos-female-fans/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">by-all-accounts genuinely decent human</a> is arguably more beloved now than he’s ever been, even at the height of Speed and Matrix mania. He’s aged like fine wine, blossoming into one of the screen’s most welcome presences, from the <em>John Wick</em> movies to the new <em>Bill &#38; Ted</em> threequel to his instantly memed <em>Always Be My Maybe</em> cameo.</p>\n<p>Everyone loves Keanu, and for proof, all you had to do was head to social media. There, you found endless well-wishes, dreamy pictures, even anecdotes that showed what a stand-up guy he is, on top of being a terrific thespian. One story that went viral came from a sports writer from Australia.</p>\n<div class=\"iframe-holder\">\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-width=\"500\" data-dnt=\"true\">\n<p lang=\"en\" dir=\"ltr\">In honor of John Wick 3 I have a Keanu Reeves story.</p>\n<p>&#8212; James Dator (@James_Dator) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/James_Dator/status/1129381527702446080?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">May 17, 2019</a></p></blockquote>\n<p><script async src=\"https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script></div>\n<p>The anecdote was actually quite old, originally posted in May of 2019. “In honor of John Wick 3 I have a Keanu Reeves story,” wrote SBNation’s James Datar. And it was a good one:</p>\n<blockquote><p>Keanu came to the movie theater I worked at in Sydney in 2001. He was working on the Matrix series at the time. It’s a quiet, Wednesday morning — almost nobody is seeing movies. I’m working the box office, bored as hell and suddenly this dude walks up in jeans, a leather jacket and a horse riding helmet. A full ass, weird equestrian looking helmet. It takes me a solid 30 seconds to ignore the helmet and realize it’s Keanu Reeves. He wants to buy a ticket for “From Hell,” the Johnny Depp movie. I’m so fucking star struck I do what any sensible 16-year-old does and tell him I’d like to give him my employee discount. This means he needs to sign my sheet and therefore I have his autograph. “I don’t work here,” Keanu says. Seemingly confused by my offer. I’m flustered and just charge him the normal price. Kicking myself after for not getting his autograph. 2 minutes later there’s a knock on the door behind me that leads into the box office. I assume it’s my manager. It’s Keanu. “I realized you probably wanted my autograph,” he says. “So I signed this.” He hands me a receipt from the concessions stand that he signed on the back. He then casually throws an ice cream cone in the trash can and sees his movie. I realize later that he bought an ice cream cone he didn’t want, just to get receipt paper so he could scribble his autograph for a 16-year-old idiot.</p></blockquote>\n<p>There were plenty of other fine Keanu shares on his big day.</p>\n<div class=\"iframe-holder\">\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-width=\"500\" data-dnt=\"true\">\n<p lang=\"en\" dir=\"ltr\">On Keanu Reeves’ birthday let’s just remember when he murdered someone on live TV. </p>\n<p>Wait for it. <a href=\"https://twitter.com/hashtag/HappyBirthdayKeanuReeves?src=hash&#38;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">#HappyBirthdayKeanuReeves</a> <a href=\"https://twitter.com/hashtag/iplayted?src=hash&#38;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">#iplayted</a> <a href=\"https://twitter.com/hashtag/BillAndTed3?src=hash&#38;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">#BillAndTed3</a> <a href=\"https://t.co/QRxwKCVogF\">pic.twitter.com/QRxwKCVogF</a></p>\n<p>&#8212; TZE THEE CHUN (@thetzechun) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/thetzechun/status/1301213408440848386?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">September 2, 2020</a></p></blockquote>\n<p><script async src=\"https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script></div>\n<div class=\"iframe-holder\">\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-width=\"500\" data-dnt=\"true\">\n<p lang=\"en\" dir=\"ltr\">In honor of Keanu’s birthday, here’s some Bill and Ted fanart I made a while ago. One","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402537645","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1024\" height=\"450\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/tyler-perry.jpg?w=1024&#38;h=450&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Getty Image</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p><em>The Batman</em> is <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/the-batman-resumes-production-without-robert-pattinson/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">attempting</a> to re-start production after Robert Pattinson&#8217;s <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/robert-pattinson-covid-the-batman/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">positive COVID</a> test, and all fingers are crossed on that note, although the current situation in the U.K., where Matt Reeves is filming is&#8230; not great. However, filmmaker Tyler Perry &#8212; recently recognized <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/maddieberg/2020/09/01/from-poor-as-hell-to-billionaire-how-tyler-perry-changed-show-business-forever/#10fd65a534b5\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">by Forbes</a> after reaching a $1 billion net worth &#8212; is keeping his usual tight ship running (the same one that cranked out what feels like a zillion <em>Madea</em> movies) with added pandemic precautions.</p>\n<p>This week, as Deadline&#8217;s Nellie Andreeva reveals, Perry&#8217;s time has included wrapping production on <em>Ruthless</em>, a BET+ drama series that spins off <em>The Oval</em> series. He then swiftly moved onto taping fresh episodes of his BET+comedy series, <em>Bruh</em>. This is all happening in Atlanta, which has wrestled with our current situation like much of the South, but it&#8217;s all happening because of <a title=\"\" href=\"https://deadline.com/2020/09/tyler-perry-ruthless-wraps-production-bruh-starts-covid-positive-test-atlanta-studio-1234570682/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">a strict bubble</a>:</p>\n<blockquote><p>Perry employs a quarantine bubble model, sequestering cast and crew on the lot for the duration of a shoot. The production follows a 30-page document that outlines the plan in great detail. It involves check-in testing as cast and crew arrive at the studio, with everyone staying in their rooms until test results come back.</p></blockquote>\n<p>Perry isn&#8217;t messing around! This plan hasn&#8217;t gone off without a hitch, however. Perry revealed to Deadline that initial check-in procedure for his <em>Sistas</em> series <a title=\"\" href=\"https://deadline.com/2020/09/tyler-perry-ruthless-wraps-production-bruh-starts-covid-positive-test-atlanta-studio-1234570682/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">turned up four</a> positive COVID tests (among crew members and extras), but since no one had been allowed to congregate at that point, the situation was swiftly contained. The key appears to be keeping people in rooms until they have an all-clear test, and while it sounds simple, there&#8217;s undoubtedly a lot of coordination involved. Much like the NBA model, this is probably the only close-to-surefire way to get things done on a Hollywood scale, probably for the rest of the year.</p>\n<p>(Via <a title=\"\" href=\"https://deadline.com/2020/09/tyler-perry-ruthless-wraps-production-bruh-starts-covid-positive-test-atlanta-studio-1234570682/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Deadline</a> &#38; <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/maddieberg/2020/09/01/from-poor-as-hell-to-billionaire-how-tyler-perry-changed-show-business-forever/#10fd65a534b5\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Forbes</a>)</p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=SQ4ZcLH5rEQ:QICvebdw6Nk:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img
