01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"Tilda Swinton Ended Her Film Festival Acceptance Speech With A Chadwick Boseman Tribute","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402535144","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1600\" height=\"660\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/tilda.jpg?w=1600&#38;h=660&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"\" loading=\"lazy\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/tilda.jpg?resize=1200,495 1200w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/tilda.jpg?resize=1600,660 1600w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) calc(100vw - 20px), (max-width: 1024px) calc(100vw - 40px), (min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Getty Image</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p>For teaching us that <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_47ph6EvQPU\">a shoe doesn&#8217;t belong on your head</a>, for her transformations into <a href=\"https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/narnia/images/4/49/Turkdel8.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20110425160117\">white witches</a> and <a href=\"https://static.rogerebert.com/uploads/blog_post/primary_image/mzs/a-quintessence-of-dust-only-lovers-left-alive/only_lovers.jpg\">vampires</a>, and for reminding the world that we NEED to talk about Kevin, Tilda Swinton was awarded a Golden Lion For Lifetime Achievement at the Venice International Film Festival on Wednesday. The Oscar-winning actress, known for playing androgynous and often-eccentric characters, <a href=\"https://variety.com/2020/film/news/tilda-swinton-venice-golden-lion-wakanda-forever-cinema-1234757279/\">began her acceptance speech</a> by admitting that she&#8217;s been wondering two things: &#8220;One, how much exactly cinema means to me. Two, how to be able to accept this overwhelming honor with a straight face.&#8221;</p>\n<p>Swinton called cinema her &#8220;happy place, my true motherland. Its fellowship is my heart’s family tree. The names on the list of those awarded this honor, meanwhile, they are the names of my masters. They’re the elders of my tribe. The poets of the language I love above others. I sing their songs in the bath. I’m the punk kid film nut hitching a ride to the station to get to the foothills of the heights of their achievements.&#8221; Acknowledging the sincere absurdity of talking about baths and punks and motherlands, she jokingly added, &#8220;By the way, I am only just beginning.&#8221;</p>\n<p>You can <a href=\"https://variety.com/2020/film/news/tilda-swinton-venice-golden-lion-wakanda-forever-cinema-1234757279/\">read much of her speech here</a>, but I&#8217;m going to cut to the end, where Swinton paid tribute to her Marvel Cinematic Universe co-star Chadwick Boseman, who died from colon cancer last week. &#8220;The magic carpet is flying still and ever shall be — the best possible personal protective equipment for the soul. Viva Venezia. Cinema cinema cinema. Wakanda Forever,&#8221; she said, in reference to the salute from <em>Black Panther</em>. </p>\n<p>As seen here:</p>\n<figure id=\"402535211\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"size-full wp-image-402535211\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/tilda-wakanda.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"650\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/tilda-wakanda.jpg 3040w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/tilda-wakanda.jpg?resize=300,450 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/tilda-wakanda.jpg?resize=650,975 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/tilda-wakanda.jpg?resize=768,1152 768w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/tilda-wakanda.jpg?resize=1024,1536 1024w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/tilda-wakanda.jpg?resize=1365,2048 1365w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/tilda-wakanda.jpg?resize=1920,2880 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 3040px) 100vw, 3040px\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Getty Image</span></figcaption></figure>\n<p>Congratulations to Tilda Swinton, who will soon appear in Guillermo del Toro&#8217;s <em>Pinocchio</em> as The Fairy with Turquoise Hair. Sounds about right.</p>\n<p>(Via <a href=\"https://variety.com/2020/film/news/tilda-swinton-venice-golden-lion-wakanda-forever-cinema-1234757279/\"><em>Variety</em></a>)</p>\n<div border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/rN0Y2P3tt04\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 02 Sep 2020 18:53:39 +0000","feedId":6617,"bgimg":"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/tilda.jpg?w=1600&h=660&crop=1","linkMd5":"85144c2ce1ebc3e72319d82a3369f0f9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn45@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-627_c332f4702de85d01.webp","destWidth":1600,"destHeight":660,"sourceBytes":112934,"destBytes":112934,"author":"Josh Kurp","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/tilda.jpg?w=1600&h=660&crop=1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn45@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-627_c332f4702de85d01.webp","https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/tilda-wakanda.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn67@2020_4/2020/09/04/17-11-21-868_ab061fcef1fcb115.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=rN0Y2P3tt04:rXC1Q58B5Js:V_sGLiPBpWU":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-18-942_f1234b5e3acb72a6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=rN0Y2P3tt04:rXC1Q58B5Js:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn72@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-20-549_6cc9d1b66df1eb48.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/rN0Y2P3tt04":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn68@2020_4/2020/09/04/17-11-16-612_32491b68e9fcdf0e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599239462317},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"‘Eternals’ Director Chloé Zhao And Kevin Feige Reveal How The Film’s LGBTQ Relationship Will Feel Organic","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402536136","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1024\" height=\"450\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/eternals-cast.jpg?w=1024&#38;h=450&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"\" loading=\"lazy\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/eternals-cast.jpg 1024w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/eternals-cast.jpg?resize=300,132 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/eternals-cast.jpg?resize=650,286 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/eternals-cast.jpg?resize=768,338 768w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) calc(100vw - 20px), (max-width: 1024px) calc(100vw - 40px), (min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Getty Image</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p><em>Eternals</em>, as of last week, is officially the new title of the Marvel Studios/Disney film previously known as <em>The Eternals</em>. The &#8220;the&#8221; might not mean much to everyone, but it sure <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/hitfix/suicide-squad-relaunch-james-gunn-director/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">means a lot</a> to <em>The Suicide Squad</em> director James Gunn, who was <a title=\"\" href=\"https://twitter.com/JamesGunn/status/1299127264571830273\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">thrilled</a> to see that &#8220;[m]y friends at @MarvelStudios did me the favor and gave me the &#8216;The.'&#8221; Now that this issue is settled, we can go back to talking about the <em>Eternals</em> story, which is being <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/features/director-chloe-zhao-arrives-with-hot-oscar-contender-nomadland-and-next-years-eternals\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">teased</a> by director Chloé Zhao and Marvel chief Kevin Feige at <em>Hollywood Reporter</em>.</p>\n<p>Of chief interest is how (while <em>Thor: Ragnarok</em>&#8216;s Valkryie is still waiting to have a queen in <em>Thor: Love and Thunder</em>) <em>Eternals</em> will sprint ahead to include Marvel&#8217;s <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/the-eternals-marvel-first-gay-superhero/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">first openly gay superhero</a>. Haaz Sleiman previously revealed this his character will be married to gay superhero Phastos (Brian Tyree Henry), and the film will include a same-sex kiss. Zhao&#8217;s <em>Eternals</em> will present the relationship as integral to the story, rather than making it feel tacked-on, and Feige is on board with that approach. He also wants to get to a point where inclusion happens so much in Marvel movies that it&#8217;s <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/features/director-chloe-zhao-arrives-with-hot-oscar-contender-nomadland-and-next-years-eternals\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">not necessarily big news</a>:</p>\n<blockquote><p>An LGBTQ relationship in the film &#8220;was always sort of inherent in the story and the makeup of the different types of Eternals,&#8221; says Feige. &#8220;I think it is extremely well done, and I look forward to that level of inclusion in our future movies being less of a topic.&#8221;</p></blockquote>\n<p>He makes a fair point, and Zhao (<em>Songs My Brothers Taught Me</em> and the upcoming <em>Nomadland</em>, which is already hearing Oscar chatter) seems very confident in how the subject slides right into her movie. She also added that Marvel Studios gave her complete creative freedom with this project. &#8220;I shot exactly the way I wanted to shoot,&#8221; <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/features/director-chloe-zhao-arrives-with-hot-oscar-contender-nomadland-and-next-years-eternals\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">she says</a>. &#8220;On location. A lot of magic hour. Three-hundred-sixty degrees on the same camera as I did on <em>Nomadland</em>&#8221; She calls the level of deference to her judgment &#8220;surreal&#8221; and adds, &#8220;I’m still waiting for the shoe to drop. It hasn’t. I think I got lucky in that Marvel wants to take risks and do something different.&#8221;</p>\n<p><em>Eternals</em>, which also stars Gemma Chan, Kumail Nanjiani, Angelina Jolie, Richard Madden, Salma Hayek, and Kit Harington, is currently scheduled for February 12, 2021.</p>\n<p>(Via <a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/features/director-chloe-zhao-arrives-with-hot-oscar-contender-nomadland-and-next-years-eternals\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><em>Hollywood Reporter</em></a>)</p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=SI3hbhDYgZ8:7QjiwweOeEQ:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=SI3hbhDYgZ8:7QjiwweOeEQ:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=SI3hbhDYgZ8:7QjiwweOeEQ:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=SI3hbhDYgZ8:7QjiwweOeEQ:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=SI3hbhDYgZ8:7QjiwweOeEQ:7Q72WNTAKBA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=SI3hbhDYgZ8:7QjiwweOeEQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=SI3hbhDYgZ8:7QjiwweOeEQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/SI3hbhDYgZ8\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 03 Sep 2020 14:34:34 +0000","feedId":6617,"bgimg":"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/eternals-cast.jpg?w=1024&h=450&crop=1","linkMd5":"4fc55c672857d3acc00b0ea9b83a9895","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn1@2020_3/2020/09/04/17-11-03-275_eb0e3f79c85a87d4.webp","destWidth":1024,"destHeight":450,"sourceBytes":139700,"destBytes":139700,"author":"Kimberly Ricci","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/eternals-cast.jpg?w=1024&h=450&crop=1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn1@2020_3/2020/09/04/17-11-03-275_eb0e3f79c85a87d4.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=SI3hbhDYgZ8:7QjiwweOeEQ:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn42@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-21-071_68bf1b5ec2b09da9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-18-942_f1234b5e3acb72a6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=SI3hbhDYgZ8:7QjiwweOeEQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn30@2020_3/2020/09/04/17-11-21-050_8946732f907dc675.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/SI3hbhDYgZ8":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn37@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-20-265_25cd6339fea3f97f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599239462313},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"James Gunn Is Asking Everyone To Watch ‘Harley Quinn,’ So It Can Get A Much-Deserved Renewal","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402536059","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1600\" height=\"660\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/poison-harley.jpg?w=1600&#38;h=660&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">HBO MAX</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://uproxx.com/tv/harley-quinn-season-2-review/\"><em>Harley Quinn</em></a> recently made its way from DC Universe, the streaming service used exclusively by Twitter users with #SnyderCut in their bios, to HBO Max, where it&#8217;s hopefully a huge hit. <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/tv/harley-quinn-cartoon-hbo-max/\">It&#8217;s a really good show</a>! One of the best of 2020. It&#8217;s funny, it&#8217;s silly, it&#8217;s weird, it&#8217;s violent and lewd, there&#8217;s a talking shark, and in one episode, Harley Quinn and Poison Ivy plot to escape Bane&#8217;s Peña Duro North Correctional and Rehabilitation Facility, a.k.a. &#8220;The Pit,&#8221; on George Lopez&#8217;s helicopter while the comedian is doing a stand-up set for Killer Croc and other ne&#8217;er-do-wells. It&#8217;s a whole thing. You should watch, because if you don&#8217;t, <em>Harley Quinn</em> might not return for a third season.</p>\n<p>On Wednesday night, <em>The Suicide Squad</em> director James Gunn <a href=\"https://twitter.com/JamesGunn/status/1301370666222907393\">tweeted</a>, &#8220;Our dog barks at any animal that comes on TV. Including this animated hyena on @dcharleyquinn. The hyena is a still image. (Show is great btw),&#8221; along with a video of his dog barking at said hyena. <em>Harley Quinn</em> showrunner Patrick Schumacker <a href=\"https://twitter.com/PMSchumacker/status/1301373407255130112\">responded</a> to Gunn, thanking him for the shoutout. &#8220;Thanks for amplifying the show!&#8221; he wrote. &#8220;Will the much sought after James Gunn Bump help get us a season 3? (Seriously, have you heard anything? I have no idea.).&#8221; Gunn has no idea, but he did throw his support behind a renewal.</p>\n<p>&#8220;Let’s hope. Everyone watch Harley Quinn on @hbomax and help get them a well-deserved season three! @dcharleyquinn,&#8221; Gunn tweeted.</p>\n<div class=\"iframe-holder\">\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-width=\"500\" data-dnt=\"true\">\n<p lang=\"en\" dir=\"ltr\">Let’s hope. Everyone watch Harley Quinn on <a href=\"https://twitter.com/hbomax?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">@hbomax</a> and help get them a well-deserved season three! <a href=\"https://twitter.com/dcharleyquinn?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">@dcharleyquinn</a> <a href=\"https://t.co/D6z9mjk7Y0\">https://t.co/D6z9mjk7Y0</a></p>\n<p>&#8212; James Gunn (@JamesGunn) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/JamesGunn/status/1301386258074140672?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">September 3, 2020</a></p></blockquote>\n<p><script async src=\"https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script></div>\n<p>Most fan campaigns are bad, but this is a good one. You + watching <em>Harley Quinn</em> on HBO Max = another season of Bane yelling about &#8220;splosions&#8221; and Andy Daly as Two-Face and Harley and Poison Ivy&#8217;s blooming romance. It&#8217;s that simple.</p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=u7iYtvFb2ac:kL3MSRFqssE:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=u7iYtvFb2ac:kL3MSRFqssE:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=u7iYtvFb2ac:kL3MSRFqssE:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=u7iYtvFb2ac:kL3MSRFqssE:7Q72WNTAKBA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/u7iYtvFb2ac\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 03 Sep 2020 13:47:46 +0000","feedId":6617,"bgimg":"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/poison-harley.jpg?w=1600&h=660&crop=1","linkMd5":"3a41c990410c99052349596b11f0f84e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn24@2020_1/2020/09/04/17-11-02-558_238d0352d502d8e2.webp","destWidth":1600,"destHeight":660,"sourceBytes":98912,"destBytes":98912,"author":"Josh Kurp","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/poison-harley.jpg?w=1600&h=660&crop=1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn24@2020_1/2020/09/04/17-11-02-558_238d0352d502d8e2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=u7iYtvFb2ac:kL3MSRFqssE:V_sGLiPBpWU":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-18-942_f1234b5e3acb72a6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=u7iYtvFb2ac:kL3MSRFqssE:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn83@2020_3/2020/09/04/17-11-16-750_3156cd50b3e61027.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/u7iYtvFb2ac":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn3@2020_1/2020/09/04/17-11-15-342_703c6593a148ece6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599239462313},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"The Best Craft Beer To Chase Down This September","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402534395","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1600\" height=\"495\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/septbeers-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?w=1600&#38;h=495&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"\" loading=\"lazy\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/septbeers-tfeat-uproxx.jpg 1600w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/septbeers-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=300,93 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/septbeers-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=650,201 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/septbeers-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=768,238 768w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/septbeers-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=1024,317 1024w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/septbeers-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=1536,475 1536w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) calc(100vw - 20px), (max-width: 1024px) calc(100vw - 40px), (min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">Unsplash</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p>With <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/best-late-summer-beers-2020/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">summer 2020</a> pretty much wrapped, it&#8217;s time to look into one of my favorite beer seasons. The fall brings about two distinct and very good beers. One, it&#8217;s officially <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/best-german-lagers-oktoberfest-2019/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Oktoberfest</a> season. Even with the main event in Munich <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/oktoberfest-canceled-coronavirus/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">canceled</a> this year, you can still enjoy the beers. And, trust us, there are plenty of great German lagers to enjoy right now. </p>\n<p>The other big beer you&#8217;re going to be seeing on every tap list &#8212; especially in the U.S. &#8212; are <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/best-pumpkin-beers-fall-2019/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">pumpkin ales</a>. Yes, some of these fruited ales are a bit sugary or too spiced. But with the advent of every other brewery in the country making a pumpkin ale this season, that old view of the style is more the exception than the rule in 2020. </p>\n<p>Hopefully, the <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/topic/best-beers-of-the-month/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">eight beers</a> we’re calling out this month will pique your interest and inspire you to explore exciting expressions made near you or sold at your closest bottle shop. The picks below are regional craft beer releases from breweries that we vouch for (we weren’t able to taste them all this month because of the continued pandemic, so we’re offering tasting notes from the brewers where necessary).</p>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\"><strong>Related: <a title=\"\" href=\"https://uproxx.com/life/best-belgian-ales-according-to-experts/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Serious Beer Experts Name Their Favorite Belgian Ales</a></strong></div>\n<h3>PACIFIC NORTHWEST DROP: Elysian Night Owl</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/B25X-tSj5dY/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Style:</strong> Pumpkin Beer<br />\n<strong>ABV:</strong> 6.7%<br />\n<strong>Brewery:</strong> Elysian Brewing Company, Seattle, WA</p>\n<p><strong>The Beer:</strong></p>\n<p>This is a quality pumpkin ale. The brew is fruited with over seven pounds of pumpkin puree and pumpkin seeds per barrel of beer. Next, the suds are spiked with ginger, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and allspice. That pumpkin and seeds are layered into the beer, giving a real textural nuance of a well-crafted ale. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>It&#8217;s really surprising who dialed in this beer is. It sounds like the pumpkin should overpower everything, but it&#8217;s more of a whiff of savory fruit next to a mild spice matrix. There&#8217;s a lightness to the body of the beer that helps keep this feeling like a mild and malty, making it more of a spicy pumpkin cookie than an overly sweet pumpkin pie. </p>\n<h3>SOUTHWEST DROP: Bow &#38; Arrow Oktoberfest</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CEnERuqlHvV/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Style:</strong> Märzen<br />\n<strong>ABV:</strong> 5.4%<br />\n<strong>Brewery:</strong> Bow &#38; Arrow Brewing, Albuquerque, NM</p>\n<p><strong>The Beer:</strong></p>\n<p>Bow &#38; Arrow is the country&#8217;s only craft brewery run by Indigenous women. Their beer output continues to be some of the most interesting out of the entire Southwest region and their Oktoberfest is sure to be another winner to help ring in the autumn. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes (<a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.bowandarrowbrewing.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">from the brewer</a>):</strong></p>\n<p><em>&#8220;Malty and copper in color, balanced with a bready aroma with a hint of spice and toast, finishing with light raisin and caramel notes.&#8221;</em></p>\n<h3>ROCKY MOUNTAIN DROP: Upslope Pumpkin Ale</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CEmpDUpF9nB/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Style:</strong> Pumpkin Beer<br />\n<strong>ABV:</strong> 7.7%<br />\n<strong>Brewery:</strong> Upslope Brewing Company, Boulder, CO</p>\n<p><strong>The Beer:</strong></p>\n<p>This is another great example of how subtle (and tasty) a well-crafted pumpkin ale can be. The beer is a combination of local organic baby pumpkins, hops, malts, and a blend of six spices. The end result is a very crushable can of ale with a high ABV, so drink carefully. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>There&#8217;s a bit more body to this pour. The beer has a fresh pumpkin aroma supported by mild, bready malts. The sip leans into the spices more than fruit with a slightly sweet creaminess underneath. The feel of this one leans a little more into pumpkin pie territory with a subtle sweetness. </p>\n<h3>SOUTHERN DROP: Jester King &#38; Mikkeller Drink&#8217;in the Sunbelt</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CEkMcE0nP2M/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Style:</strong> Wheat<br />\n<strong>ABV:</strong> 3.9%<br />\n<strong>Brewery:</strong> Jester King Brewery, Austin, TX (with Mikkeller)</p>\n<p><strong>The Beer:</strong></p>\n<p>If you&#8217;re still trying to hold onto summer, then this hopped wheat beer is the play. The brew is mashed with two malts and both oats and wheat with Kviek yeast before a kettle hopping and then a dry hopping. The result is a crushable and distinct wheat beer that feels like it holds a little bit of sunshine in every sip. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>There&#8217;s a marrying of mild pine resin next to bright tropical and stone fruits with an orange citrus edge. The funk of the yeast provides a nice foundation and the pepperiness of the wheat is a solid counterbalance to all the juicy fruits. The beer edges into dry territory as the mildly floral, piney, grassy, and fruity hops fade into the background.</p>\n<h3>MIDWEST DROP: Revolution Oktoberfest</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CD_5GEmFnra/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Style:</strong> Märzen<br />\n<strong>ABV:</strong> 5.7%<br />\n<strong>Brewery:</strong> Revolution Brewing, Chicago, IL</p>\n<p><strong>The Beer:</strong></p>\n<p>This Chicago beer is German ingredients filtered through American craft brewing. Bavarian malts meet Bavarian hops and Bavarian lager yeast to create this one. The beer is then properly lagered at low temps for four weeks, and then it&#8217;s party time (this beer is very quaffable). </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>The malts are the star of the show with a toasted crusty bread presence. The malts edge a bit sweet with a touch of orange rind and grass when the subtle hops kick in. A slight spicy edge arrives late as the almost floral grassy edge cuts out. </p>\n<h3>NORTHEAST DROP: Finback Black is Beautiful</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CCbnEXnpqoA/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Style:</strong> American Imperial Stout<br />\n<strong>ABV:</strong> 9%<br />\n<strong>Brewery:</strong> Finback Brewery, Queens, NY</p>\n<p><strong>The Beer:</strong></p>\n<p>This coffee spiked stout was brewed specifically to raise awareness of the social and racial injustices plaguing the United States. Proceeds from this brew will be donated to the <a title=\"\" href=\"https://alp.org/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Audre Lorde Project</a> (an LGBT people of color non-violent community activist group) and the <a title=\"\" href=\"https://brooklynbailfund.org/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Brooklyn Community Bail Fund</a>.</p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes (<a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CCbnEXnpqoA/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">from the brewer</a>):</strong></p>\n<p><em>&#8220;This 9 percent imperial stout with Ecuador Santa Gertrudis coffee is bold and unctuous.&#8221;</em></p>\n<h3>WILD CARD DROP: Odd Breed Dotted Eighth Notes</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CCOeVyKpe5e/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Style:</strong> Wild Ale<br />\n<strong>ABV:</strong> 6.5%<br />\n<strong>Brewery:</strong> Odd Breed Wild Ales, Pompano Beach, FL</p>\n<p><strong>The Beer:</strong></p>\n<p>Odd Breed consistently puts out some of the most interesting wild ales in the U.S. This brew was mashed with a mix of Pilsner, spelt, and rye malts and then hopped with Styrian Golding and fresh Saaz hops. The beer then goes into French wine barrels for a year. The beer is then refermented with rhubarb and wild honey before being bottle conditioned with Madagascar vanilla.</p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes (<a title=\"\" href=\"https://shop.oddbreed.com/dotted-eighth-notes-375ml-p155.aspx\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">from the brewer</a>):</strong></p>\n<p><em>&#8220;Aromatics of sweet honey transition to notes of earthy and tangy rhubarb, vanilla, and our signature Odd Breed funk with moderate acidity.&#8221;</em></p>\n<h3>INT’L PICK OF THE MONTH: Hofbräu Oktoberfestbier</h3>\n<div class=\"embed-holder\" style=\"--embed-ratio:100%;\"><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CDU78_qhg3n/embed/\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe></div>\n<p><strong>Style:</strong> Märzen<br />\n<strong>ABV:</strong> 6.3%<br />\n<strong>Brewery:</strong> Hofbräuhaus München</p>\n<p><strong>The Beer:</strong></p>\n<p>In most other years, we&#8217;d be about two weeks out from the start of Oktoberfest. But 2020&#8217;s not like most other years and we&#8217;ll have to celebrate the world&#8217;s biggest beer fest at home this September. This isn&#8217;t exactly my favorite Munich Oktoberfest beer, but it&#8217;s the one you&#8217;re going to be able to find very easily in the U.S. (mostly). Also, it&#8217;s a supremely crushable brew in case you need to get your drink on this month. </p>\n<p><strong>Tasting Notes:</strong></p>\n<p>Grainy malts and slightly sweet and grassy hops greet you. There&#8217;s an almost corn sweetness to the bready malts. The beer remains light but not without a velvet body. A final flourish of ever-so-slightly earthy hops counterpunches the malts on the end and draws you back for another glug every time.</p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=k88LDAJkG08:YHPJODtElDk:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=k88LDAJkG08:YHPJODtElDk:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=k88LDAJkG08:YHPJODtElDk:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=k88LDAJkG08:YHPJODtElDk:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=k88LDAJkG08:YHPJODtElDk:7Q72WNTAKBA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=k88LDAJkG08:YHPJODtElDk:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=k88LDAJkG08:YHPJODtElDk:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/k88LDAJkG08\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 02 Sep 2020 23:00:00 +0000","feedId":6617,"bgimg":"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/septbeers-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?w=1600&h=495&crop=1","linkMd5":"8cbf31635ce8681f402a239a96ea3184","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn69@2020_6/2020/09/04/17-11-02-659_6a04d791f0616033.webp","destWidth":1600,"destHeight":495,"sourceBytes":485132,"destBytes":485132,"author":"Zachary Johnston","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/septbeers-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?w=1600&h=495&crop=1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn69@2020_6/2020/09/04/17-11-02-659_6a04d791f0616033.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=k88LDAJkG08:YHPJODtElDk:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn54@2020_4/2020/09/04/17-11-19-594_017041a533e27f40.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-18-942_f1234b5e3acb72a6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=k88LDAJkG08:YHPJODtElDk:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn46@2020_1/2020/09/04/17-11-21-828_07409bf470dfc1b2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/k88LDAJkG08":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn41@2020_4/2020/09/04/17-11-22-350_76ebb0a4551391b3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599239462317},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"Of Course There’s A Reason Why Most Of Christopher Nolan’s Movies Have One-Word Titles","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402536452","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1280\" height=\"660\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/tenet.jpg?w=1280&#38;h=660&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) calc(100vw - 20px), (max-width: 1024px) calc(100vw - 40px), (min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">WARNER BROS.</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p>With <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/christopher-nolan-movies-ranked-ranking-tenet/\">the exception of his Batman trilogy</a>, director Christopher Nolan has only made one movie with multiple words in the title. There&#8217;s <em>The Prestige</em>, then there&#8217;s everything else, including his three most recent films, <em>Interstellar</em>, <em>Dunkirk</em>, and <em>Tenet</em>. You could chalk this weird fact up to being a coincidence, but this is Nolan we&#8217;re talking about. There was a fake rumor that <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/christopher-nolan-bans-from-sets/\">he bans chairs from his sets</a> because &#8220;if [people are] sitting, they’re not working,&#8221; as Anne Hathaway put it, and everyone believed it. Nothing is under-thought.</p>\n<p>&#8220;For me, titles are very tricky to be too self-conscious about. You’re looking for a way of expressing something about the film. To a certain extent, it’s a branding exercise on larger-scale films. I’ve always gravitated towards the simplest version of something that gets it across,&#8221; Nolan explained on <a href=\"https://www.cinemablend.com/news/2553930/why-christopher-nolan-prefers-one-word-titles-like-tenet?pv=related_list\">the <em>ReelBlend</em> podcast</a>. He then gave an example:</p>\n<blockquote><p>&#8220;<em>Following</em>, I think when I wrote that script, it was <em>The Following</em>, so we got rid of the <em>The</em> and stripped that down. I think that was the beginning of my interest in trying to make things as short and a pithy as possible, really. But it’s all instinct at the end of the day.&#8221;</p></blockquote>\n<p>&#8220;Drop the &#8216;<em>The</em>.&#8217; Just <em>Following</em>. It&#8217;s cleaner&#8221; — Justin Timberlake to Christopher Nolan in 1998, <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PEgk2v6KntY\">probably</a>.</p>\n<p>(Via <a href=\"https://www.cinemablend.com/news/2553930/why-christopher-nolan-prefers-one-word-titles-like-tenet?pv=related_list\"><em>CinemaBlend</em></a>)</p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=iGVndXpjCzY:2j7rRDNPXL4:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=iGVndXpjCzY:2j7rRDNPXL4:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=iGVndXpjCzY:2j7rRDNPXL4:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=iGVndXpjCzY:2j7rRDNPXL4:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=iGVndXpjCzY:2j7rRDNPXL4:7Q72WNTAKBA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=iGVndXpjCzY:2j7rRDNPXL4:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=iGVndXpjCzY:2j7rRDNPXL4:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/iGVndXpjCzY\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 03 Sep 2020 17:23:30 +0000","feedId":6617,"bgimg":"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/tenet.jpg?w=1280&h=660&crop=1","linkMd5":"84fbf1fc68434d3e2f04ba117c57fa6b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn18@2020_1/2020/09/04/17-11-02-592_847768308c82e54c.webp","destWidth":1280,"destHeight":660,"sourceBytes":49928,"destBytes":49928,"author":"Josh Kurp","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/tenet.jpg?w=1280&h=660&crop=1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn18@2020_1/2020/09/04/17-11-02-592_847768308c82e54c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=iGVndXpjCzY:2j7rRDNPXL4:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn86@2020_6/2020/09/04/17-11-19-189_e35e36a14746c883.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-18-942_f1234b5e3acb72a6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=iGVndXpjCzY:2j7rRDNPXL4:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn50@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-23-221_a42622cf4616d9f6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/iGVndXpjCzY":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599239462312},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"The Plot Of ‘The New Mutants’ Recreated With Quotes From Baffled Critics","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402533584","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1600\" height=\"495\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mutants-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?w=1600&#38;h=495&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"\" loading=\"lazy\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mutants-tfeat-uproxx.jpg 1600w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mutants-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=300,93 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mutants-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=650,201 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mutants-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=768,238 768w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mutants-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=1024,317 1024w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mutants-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?resize=1536,475 1536w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) calc(100vw - 20px), (max-width: 1024px) calc(100vw - 40px), (min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"><span class=\"wp-media-credit\">20th Century Fox</span></figcaption>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p><em>The New Mutants</em>, an X-Men spinoff originally produced by Fox (which itself was acquired by Disney 2019) slunk into mostly empty theaters this past weekend. Which, to be fair, was probably more a function of the timing than of the movie itself.</p>\n<p>Given that the film was originally shot in 2017 for a 2018 release, and the studio declined to screen it for critics or offer it on VOD in the midst of a pandemic (there were <a href=\"https://collider.com/new-mutants-hulu-disney-plus-release-reason-why/\">vague intimations</a> that they were contractually obligated to give it a theatrical run), it seems fair to infer that Disney &#8212; who, again, didn&#8217;t even make it &#8212; were just trying to get rid of <em>The</em> <em>New Mutants</em> as quickly and as quietly as possible. Of course, why would we ever want to let them do that? The more a studio wants to hide a movie, the more I want to see it.</p>\n<p>Considering <em>The</em> <em>New Mutants</em>&#8216; weird release and its studio&#8217;s seeming embarrassment about it, this seemed like the perfect time for <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/movies/doolittle-recreated-with-reviews/\">Plot Recreated With Reviews</a>. That&#8217;s when we try to recreate an entire movie using only expository quotes from the critics who saw it. Because sometimes it&#8217;s just more fun to hear a movie described than actually see it. </p>\n<p>&#8212;</p>\n<p>Directed by “The Fault in Our Stars” helmer Josh Boone, who co-wrote the screenplay with Knate Lee, “The New Mutants” takes place at an abandoned hospital where five teenage mutants reside semi-voluntarily while learning about themselves and their powerful abilities. &#8211;<a href=\"https://www.thewrap.com/new-mutants-film-review-josh-boone-maisie-williams-x-men/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">TheWrap</a></p>\n<p><strong>THE GANG&#8217;S NOT HERE</strong></p>\n<p>We don’t see Wolverine, Professor X, Magneto, Jean Grey, anybody. Instead, we meet a crew of mutant nobodies, who have zero control or understanding of their dangerous powers, and therefore are forced to live on a gross, crumbling campus in hopes of one day becoming proper X-Men. &#8211;<a href=\"https://nypost.com/2020/08/28/the-new-mutants-review-bland-teen-drama-forgets-its-an-x-men-movie/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">NY Post</a> <em>[The NY Post guy REALLY seems to hate the building for some reason -Ed.]</em></p>\n<p>Even Professor X, the patron saint of post-pubescent angst, is merely alluded to with a wheelchair and a look. &#8211;<a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/28/movies/the-new-mutants-review.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">NY Times</a></p>\n<p><strong>OUR HERO</strong></p>\n<p>The film stars the spectacularly named Blu Hunt as Danielle Moonstar, a Northern Cheyenne teenager whose whole Reservation has been wiped out by . . . something. &#8211;<a href=\"https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2020/08/new-mutants-movie-review-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Vanity Fair</a></p>\n<p> &#8230;computer-generated carnage outside: an ominous cloud formation, too targeted to be a tornado, that flips cars and smashes mobile homes, emitting a deep, demon-like growl as it destroys all in its path. The phenomenon obliterates the reservation. &#8211;<a href=\"https://variety.com/2020/film/reviews/the-new-mutants-review-x-men-1234752077/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Variety</a></p>\n<p><strong>THE DEMON BEAR</strong></p>\n<p>Three times Dani repeats the proverb of the Demon Bear: “Inside every person there are two bears, forever locked in combat for your soul. One bear is all things good: compassion, love, trust. The other is all things evil: fear, shame, and self-destruction.” &#8211;<a href=\"https://www.polygon.com/reviews/21405548/new-mutants-review-xmen-movie\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Polygon</a></p>\n<p>Which one emerges victorious? The one we feed. -TheWrap</p>\n<p><em>[Oh God, not this &#8220;two animals inside you&#8221; shit again. At least it <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/filmdrunk/tomorrowland-is-a-smarmy-magical-realist-disaster/\">wasn&#8217;t wolves</a> this time. -Ed]</em></p>\n<p><strong>THE ASYLUM</strong></p>\n<p>When Dani wakes up handcuffed to a hospital bed, it is revealed that she is the sole survivor from whatever happened at her reservation. &#8211;<a href=\"https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/movies/story/2020-08-28/new-mutants-review-x-men\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">LA Times</a></p>\n<p>Dani finds herself ominously kept prisoner/patient at an asylum of sorts run by Dr. Reyes (Alice Braga), whose soft tones and frowning concern for her charges belie obviously dire motivations. -VanityFair</p>\n<p>There are many red flags at this facility. Mount Sinai, it ain’t. This dump looks like an abandoned insane asylum, and it’s run by just one stern woman, Dr. Reyes, who is a mutant with the power to create impenetrable force fields. -NY Post</p>\n<p>“This isn’t a hospital,” Dani is told. “It’s a cage.” &#8211;<a href=\"https://www.scmp.com/lifestyle/entertainment/article/3099522/new-mutants-movie-review-x-men-spin-even-worse-you-expected\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">South China Morning Post</a></p>\n<p><strong>THE GANG THAT <em>IS</em> HERE</strong></p>\n<p>The mutants in question are five deadly teenagers who, shortly after their powers kicked in at puberty, each killed someone (or some entire town, in the case of the distraught Dani). -NY Times</p>\n<p>Handsome enough to begin with, jock-like Roberto da Costa (Henry Zaga) turns scorching hot when his libido kicks in. Rahne Sinclair (Maisie Williams, “Game of Thrones”) may seem mousy, but she’s actually a kind of werewolf who can transform on command. -Variety</p>\n<p>I think she can turn into some kind of angry badger. Very scratchy when threatened. She can also morph into a standard dog if anything needs to be fetched. &#8211;<a title=\"\" href=\"http://https//nationalpost.com/entertainment/movies/x-men-franchise-comes-to-an-end-not-with-a-bang-but-a-poorly-enunciated-whimper\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">National Post</a></p>\n<p>Sam Guthrie (“Stranger Things” big brother Charlie Heaton) has a thick Southern accent and the ability to shoot, rocket-like, across the sky. &#8211;<a href=\"https://variety.com/2020/film/reviews/the-new-mutants-review-x-men-1234752077/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Variety</a></p>\n<p>Anya Taylor-Joy makes for a compelling Illyana Rasputin. Presented as a victim of child slavery (and presumably rape) &#8211;<a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/scottmendelson/2020/08/28/review-new-mutants-is-the-worst-x-men-movie-ever/#3301d93e6b15\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Forbes</a> <em>[thanks for making that connection clear there, bud -Ed]</em></p>\n<p>she&#8217;s a sword-conjuring sorceress who snarls that she’s killed 18 men. -South China Morning Post</p>\n<p>Her character carries a pterodactyl hand puppet at all times -Variety</p>\n<p>and is able to teleport and turn her eyes and arms into weapons. -Variety</p>\n<p>Dr. Reyes, says they’ve been incarcerated to keep them from harming themselves and others with their nascent powers, but I think they’re undergoing AART, or Atrocious Accent Reversion Therapy. How else to explain the fact that Illyana Rasputin is rocking a ra-ra-Rasputin Russian voice? (Her other superpower seems to be perfect bangs.) Or that Charlie Heaton’s Kentucky drawl occasionally wanders as far south as Nashville, and up into Ohio? Meanwhile, Henry Zaga, actually born in Brazil and playing a Brazilian, somehow sounds Californian. &#8211;<a title=\"\" href=\"http://https//nationalpost.com/entertainment/movies/x-men-franchise-comes-to-an-end-not-with-a-bang-but-a-poorly-enunciated-whimper\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">National Post</a></p>\n<p><strong>DR. REYES</strong></p>\n<p>Dr. Reyes tells Dani that baby rattlesnakes are more dangerous than their grownup counterparts because they don’t know how to control their venom. So Dani and her fellow captives are there for their own good, to protect themselves and others until these magic adolescents can more carefully realize their full potential. -Vanity Fair</p>\n<p>Dr. Reyes, who works for the mysterious Essex Corporation. -South China Morning Post</p>\n<p>swears she can soothe their guilt with a mix of talk therapy and constant camera surveillance. The sickly teal walls are the first hint that this dormitory isn’t what it seems. -NY Times</p>\n<p>It looks an awful lot like the hospital in “Shutter Island.” That’s because both were shot at the Medfield State Hospital, an imposing late-19th-century red-brick asylum that makes for an ideal horror-movie location. -Variety</p>\n<p><strong>MUTANT BONDING</strong></p>\n<p>As Dani works to understand her talents’ true nature, her newfound friends find themselves plagued with nightmares about the lives they’ve taken. And before long, these nightmares begin to manifest themselves in the physical world, creating real-life monsters that the patients are powerless to resist. -ThePlaylist</p>\n<p>Like “The Breakfast Club” on steroids, these five misfits slowly overcome their differences, bonding and becoming friends. -Variety</p>\n<p>Naturally, the kids rebel with a dance montage. -NY Times</p>\n<p><strong>MISFITS MAKE GOOD, SORT OF</strong></p>\n<p>This is the first Marvel movie to depict an openly queer relationship, giving Dani a lesbian love interest. -Variety</p>\n<p>“It’s going to get better,” Maisie Williams’s character says, in Panglossian fashion, at one point in <em>The New Mutants.</em> -Vanity Fair</p>\n<p>Boone assigns teen mutants to teenage clichés, like the misunderstood jock (Da Costa) or mean girl with a dark back story (Rasputin) and expects the audience to feel something because there are violins playing in the background. &#8211;<a href=\"https://www.polygon.com/reviews/21405548/new-mutants-review-xmen-movie\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Polygon</a></p>\n<p>Glimpses of a TV playing episodes of “Buffy the Vampire Slayer” help drive the point home. &#8211;<a href=\"https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/movies/story/2020-08-28/new-mutants-review-x-men\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">LA Times</a></p>\n<p><strong>STYMIED EXPECTATIONS</strong></p>\n<p>In the comics, these guys become known as Wolfsbane, Sunspot, Cannonball, Magik and Mirage. Those nicknames are never used here -NY Post</p>\n<p>and we’re only given passing glances at their abilities. -TheWrap</p>\n<p>None of the patients ever step foot outside the hospital grounds. -ThePlaylist</p>\n<p>For the most part we’re meant to be invested in the twin mysteries of (A) what is Dani’s secret power and (B) is Dr. Reyes a good doctor or an evil one? -National Post</p>\n<p>When the true mastermind behind the villainy is unearthed, it’s a deep cut throwback to a franchise that no longer exists. &#8211;<a href=\"https://www.cinemablend.com/reviews/2553561/the-new-mutants-review-not-worth-the-very-very-long-wait\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">CinemaBlend</a></p>\n<p><strong>POWER UNLEASHED! SORT OF</strong></p>\n<p>Fox’s 20-year, 13-film X-Men series goes out not with a bang or a whimper . . . but a bear attack. Yes, every camper’s worst fear is the asinine conclusion of a two-decade stretch of mutant movies -NY Post</p>\n<p>Once unleashed on a series of computer-generated whatsits (including a phalanx of gangly, befanged disco dancers), the teens’ inability to control — or explain — their skills just makes them look goofy. -NY Times</p>\n<p>Featuring a demon bear, -NY Post</p>\n<p>wolves and sharp-toothed skeletons, -South China Morning Post</p>\n<p>it’s a messy action orgy that explains Dani’s mysterious powers. -NY Post</p>\n<p>While their elders boast the ability to control weather or metal or minds, the fledglings appear to have gotten the dregs of a white elephant exchange. Illyana has the gift of flickering into an alt-world where her hand puppet becomes a belching, parrot-size dragon. As for Sam, an explosive miner’s son from Kentucky, his biggest moment is when he chains himself to a post and bangs around like a tetherball. -NY Times</p>\n<p>If it wanted to be the first Marvel horror movie – a very interesting choice for a story about mutants locked up in an institute – it’s never scary. -CinemaBlend</p>\n<p>Without any palpable atmosphere, the jumpy moments and creepy suggestions arrive like only more exposition, -Vanity Fair</p>\n<p>scares that you’ll forget about as you’re watching. -Empire</p>\n<p>All of its awe is perfunctory, its reveals of superpowers and troubled backstories thunking around like particle board—dense with the pulp of other things -Vanity Fair</p>\n<p><strong>IN CONCLUSION</strong></p>\n<p><em>The New Mutants</em> is like watching a lousy TV pilot for a show that you know didn’t get picked up. -Forbes</p>\n<p>Part of me wishes its new owners had continued to punt its opening date ever farther into the future. It could have attained mythical status as the film always on the verge of opening, but never quite making it. Sometimes the best <em>X-Men</em> film is the one you <em>don’t</em> see. -National Post</p>\n<p>&#8212;<br />\nWell, there you have it, folks. It doesn&#8217;t sound so bad, but then it doesn&#8217;t sound that good. Probably a solid B+. Honestly I wanted to know more about the pterodactyl hand puppet. </p>\n<p>Also, one more thing, I couldn&#8217;t fit this quote into the format, but I felt like you should see it.</p>\n<p><strong>Most baffling sentence award:</strong> Dan Buffa of <a href=\"https://www.ksdk.com/article/entertainment/movies/movie-reviews/the-new-mutants-review/63-fbea5771-8d47-4703-9eb2-10322ad40d2c\">KSDK</a>: </p>\n<p>&#8220;Anya Taylor-Joy&#8217;s accent doesn&#8217;t just come and go; it overwhelms you the way a bad karaoke singer would right after a bad plate of nachos.&#8221;</p>\n<p>Look out, everyone! The man has a simile and he&#8217;s not afraid to use it! Two points for anyone who can figure out what the hell that means. </p>\n<p><em>Vince Mancini is on<a href=\"http://twitter.com/vincemancini\"> Twitter</a>. You can <a href=\"https://uproxx.com/tag/plot-recreated-with-reviews/\">read more &#8216;Plot Recreated With Reviews&#8217; here</a>. </em></p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=6FUulwwAPCQ:YJwqc0RlagE:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=6FUulwwAPCQ:YJwqc0RlagE:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=6FUulwwAPCQ:YJwqc0RlagE:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=6FUulwwAPCQ:YJwqc0RlagE:7Q72WNTAKBA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=6FUulwwAPCQ:YJwqc0RlagE:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=6FUulwwAPCQ:YJwqc0RlagE:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/6FUulwwAPCQ\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 02 Sep 2020 16:41:22 +0000","feedId":6617,"bgimg":"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mutants-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?w=1600&h=495&crop=1","linkMd5":"226f7dfec8a8bf4b12a2648640b3a8d1","destWidth":1600,"destHeight":495,"sourceBytes":498140,"destBytes":498140,"author":"Vince Mancini","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mutants-tfeat-uproxx.jpg?w=1600&h=495&crop=1":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/04/17-11-02-428_c8fa5e32ae89b18f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=6FUulwwAPCQ:YJwqc0RlagE:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn69@2020_1/2020/09/04/17-11-21-775_3bc0b44f883e5ad5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_2/2020/09/04/17-11-18-942_f1234b5e3acb72a6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=6FUulwwAPCQ:YJwqc0RlagE:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn27@2020_4/2020/09/04/17-11-16-635_fecc69fe1e5e65ee.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/uproxx/features/~4/6FUulwwAPCQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn30@2020_1/2020/09/04/17-11-18-783_bd6284ed13b8f8c2.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599239462320},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 01:11:02","title":"A New Francis Ford Coppola Edit Of ‘The Godfather Part III’ Will Be Released On Its 30th Anniversary","link":"https://uproxx.com/?p=402537188","description":"\t<div class=\"featured-image\">\n\t\t<figure class=\"post-thumbnail\">\n\t\t\t<div class=\"upx-component upx-image\"><div class=\"image-holder\"><img width=\"1024\" height=\"501\" src=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/godfather3pullmeout1024.jpg?w=1024&#38;h=501&#38;crop=1\" class=\"attachment-article-featured size-article-featured skip-lazy\" alt=\"\" loading=\"lazy\" srcset=\"https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/godfather3pullmeout1024.jpg 1024w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/godfather3pullmeout1024.jpg?resize=300,147 300w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/godfather3pullmeout1024.jpg?resize=650,318 650w, https://uproxx.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/godfather3pullmeout1024.jpg?resize=768,376 768w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) calc(100vw - 20px), (max-width: 1024px) calc(100vw - 40px), (min-width: 1025px) 1024px, 1024px\" /></div></div>\t\t</figure>\n\t</div>\n\t<p>Apparent <em>The Godfather</em> saga isn&#8217;t done pulling Francis Ford Coppola back in one more time. According to a report, the conclusion of the trilogy will see a new edition, one that will try to finish the saga the way he originally intended: with a different name and, if possible, a fix to the story his daughter Sofia played out on film that has been widely panned since its release in 1990.</p>\n<p><a title=\"\" href=\"https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2020/09/the-godfather-part-iii-death-of-michael-corleone-cut?utm_source=twitter&#38;utm_medium=social&#38;utm_brand=vf&#38;mbid=social_twitter&#38;utm_social-type=owned\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Vanity Fair reported on Thursday that Coppola</a> is, indeed, releasing a re-edit of the third film in The Godfather series, this time giving it the name he and author Mario Puzo originally wanted for the film: <em>The Death of Michael Corleone</em>.</p>\n<blockquote><p>The project, saddled with the lengthy title Mario Puzo’s The Godfather, Coda: The Death of Michael Corleone, will debut in theaters (where open and available) in December before hitting digital platforms as well as physical media.</p></blockquote>\n<p>The very different title is a departure from what&#8217;s been known as <em>Part III</em> of the saga for decades, and according to a release will conclude the series in a different order as well. </p>\n<p>“<em>Mario Puzo’s The Godfather, Coda: The Death of Michael Corleone</em> is an acknowledgment of Mario’s and my preferred title and our original intentions for what became The Godfather: Part III,” Coppola said in a statement according to Vanity Fair. “For this version of the finale, I created a new beginning and ending, and rearranged some scenes, shots, and music cues. With these changes and the restored footage and sound, to me, it is a more appropriate conclusion to The Godfather and The Godfather: Part II and I’m thankful to Jim Gianopulos and Paramount for allowing me to revisit it.”</p>\n<p>Vanity Fair&#8217;s story about the re-release details the years-long retrospective Coppola has had in the press over what he would do if he were to release a re-edited version of the film, so it&#8217;s likely we know what will actually happen in <em>Coda</em>. It&#8217;s also a pretty thorough run through of all the issues the film had with production and casting, which seemed to hamper what we originally got on Christmas Day back in 2020. For one, the role his daughter, Sofia, played at just 19 with little acting experience is likely to be very different. </p>\n<blockquote><p>“I want to show Sofia a new version, because she is so beautiful in it and so touching,” he told Deadline. “She wasn’t an actress. But she was the real thing, playing that 19-year-old Italian girl in love with her own cousin [played in the film by Andy Garcia]. Godfather III as The Death of Michael Corleone is doubly painful because at the end he doesn’t die, but he does worse than die. He loses everything he loves—and he lives. There are certain things in life that are worse than death.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>The film will hit theaters in December, where possible, but is also on demand as the still-ongoing coronavirus pandemic leaves the moviegoing experience entirely uncertain. For fans who may have been soured on the finale all those years ago, they just might be pulled right back in this winter.</p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=Hz6bTEtAva0:hQUr7eX429I:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?a=Hz6bTEtAva0:hQUr7eX429I:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/uproxx/features?i=Hz6bTEtAva0:hQUr7eX429I:V_sGLiPBpWU\"
